loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
OLINDA T. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras” ubicado en el Jr. Puebla N° 174 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 50 años de edad, con 04 hijos, su esposo es obrero, ella vende calzados de vestir.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro 10 pares de zapatos, vendía en el mercado a crédito, pero algunas personas no le pagaban, dejo de vender, decaía, con lo poco que tenia compró más zapatos pero esta vez solo a oficinas.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara 30 pares de zapatos, su venta es exclusiva a oficinas, el pago seguro, cada vez trae novedades, gracias a los pedidos que le hacen.

Está agradecida con Manuela Ramos, por la oportunidad que le brinda a generar trabajo y a trabajar, es una ayuda muy generosa.
texts.en:
Olinda T. P. belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Guerreras” [The female warriors] located in the district of Callería, Perú. She is 50 years old with four children. Her husband is a laborer, and Olinda sells dress shoes. The first loan that she received was for S/.3000.00 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian currency). She purchased 10 pairs of shoes, and sold them in the market on credit. However, some clients did not repay her, so she quit selling and faced declining circumstances. With the little that remained she purchased more shoes but this time sold them only at offices. With this loan of S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles ($325 US), she will purchase 30 pairs of shoes, selling them exclusively to offices. Payment is secure, and with every order she brings the newest fashions thanks to the requests that she receives. She is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the opportunity they have provided to generate a job and allow her to work. It is very generous assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase 30 pairs of shoes, selling them exclusively to offices

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du  groupe Badenya sont au nombre de dix femmes toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans,  4 enfants et vivent en majorité dans des familles monogames dans le quartier Bozo kin de Sansanding (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali.).
Elles exercent essentiellement le commerce de poissons  sous diverses formes : frais, fumé, séché et de condiments alimentaires. 
C’est le souci d’accroître leur fonds de commerce qui les a amené à s’organiser et rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire. Le premier fut correctement bien remboursé.
Ce prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 bidons de 20 litres d’huile de coton ou d’arachide, 4 paniers de tomate fraîche, une tonne d’oignon frais, 3 bassines de poivron et piment frais, 300kg de poisson fumé et de sardines séchées. Elles se ravitaillent une fois par semaine à la foire de Sansanding en légumes,  huile et en poisson à Macina. Les poissons sont revendus dans les foires de Siribala, Dougabougou et sur place à Sansanding ; les autres condiments sont écoulés à domicile et dans le marché de Sansanding au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de 19.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter leurs fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya group number 10 married women. They have an average age of 33 and, on average, 4 children, and they live mostly in monogamous families in the Bozo Kin neighborhood of Sansanding (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They mostly sell fish in diverse forms (fresh, smoked, dried) and also condiments. The need to grow their working capital led them to organize themselves and join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their second group loan. The first was correctly reimbursed.

This loan will be used to buy 2 jerry cans of 20 liters of cottonseed or peanut oil, 4 baskets of fresh tomatoes, a ton of fresh onions, 3 basins of green peppers and fresh hot peppers, 300 kg of smoked fish and some dried sardines. They do their buying once a week at the fair of Sansanding as far as vegetables go; their oil and fish are from Macina. The fish are re-sold at the fairs in Siribala, Dougabougou and right there in Sansanding; the other condiments are sold from their homes and in the market of Sansanding for cash or credit to a clientele essentially constituted of women.

They hope to make a monthly average profit of 19,000 F CFA which will be used to increase their working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish and condiments

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.en:
Abdurauf A. applied first to the MicroInvest in 2009. He is married and has 4 children that help him in the livestock business. Abdurauf is a builder also, but it is seasonal work so livestock is the general family income.

Abdurauf has been engaged in livestock for 30 years. He dreams of owning a big livestock farm, so he is ready to work hard. Abdurauf is asking Kiva for financial business support of $275 (1000 TJS) for 6 months for pedigree bull purchase.

loans.use: pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Zanased

texts.en: Zanased P. lives with his wife in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Zanased has three grown-up children. His two daughters live independently and work, while his youngest son is a college student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Zanased was trained to make products with wrought iron. When the state-owned firm he worked for went bankrupt during the economic crisis of 1990, which occurred because of Mongolia's transition away from communism, he was laid off. Since then, he started his own business making household products from wrought iron. He started his business with 200,000 MNT ($1 USD=1,500 MNT) of capital, and his business capital has now grown to 3,000,000 MNT. He hopes to one day have a workshop to make his products and to be able to meet all the iron-product needs of his town. He requests a loan to purchase supplies for his business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his business

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобар подает свою третью заявку на КИВА. Прошлый займ по подсчетам Санобар принес ей приличную прибыль, и она решила купить своим детям DVD-проигрыватель. Это приобретение означает для нее еще один большой плюс в улучшении жизненных условий. Санобар собирается и дальше развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sanobar is applying for a loan for the third time on Kiva. By Sanobar's calculations her previous loan has given her a good profit and she decided to buy her children a DVD player. This purchase means a huge plus in improvements in living conditions for her family. Sanobar plans to continue to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en: T. Nguyễn Thị (20206030007) is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Hậu 09 (9). T. is married and has two school-aged children. T. provides general services to local community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000,000 IDR a month. T. joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 IDR which will be used to renovate the business. The loan will be her first loan from DINARI. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Đàm Thị Lư (20206030008) is a 19-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. L.u Thị T. (20206030009) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. Đào Thị L. (20206030010) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her tailoring business. 4. Kiều Thị T. (20206030011) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her business raising livestock. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** T. Nguyễn Thị (20206030007) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Yên Hậu 09 (9). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 IDR. T. đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. 0 Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Đàm Thị Lư (20206030008) là 19 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. L.u Thị T. (20206030009) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Đào Thị L. (20206030010) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc. 4. Kiều Thị T. (20206030011) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về DINARI: Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ. *L.u ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Jeffie

texts.en:
Jeffie E. is from the village of Mialen Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 22 years old and married. To make a living, Jeffie owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating a tricycle for transportation services. Jeffie has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 9300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jeffie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jeffie is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used for additional payment for his motorcycle for transportation services. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jeffie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional payment for his motorcycle

loans.name: Kaniz Fatima Muhammad Shafiq Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Kaniz Fatima Baji is the wife of M. S.. She has lived in Lahore, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband runs a tailoring center in the community. He earns income by sewing both women’s and men’s clothes. Kaniz Baji is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her husband so that he can sew more clothes and complete the orders on time. Parveen Akhtar Baji wants a loan to buy items for her barber shop, such as chairs, scissors, and mirrors. Huma Baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 24-year-old single man who lives in Nablus city, Palestine.  He ownes a grocery store where he sells vegetables, chocolate, and canned food. Hasan has requested a loan of $1500 US from Ryadain order to purchase more merchandise to sell. Hasan is special in his work because of his honesty and good behavior with his clients. Hasan is grateful for your support and generosity.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for his store

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a young man aged 28 years old and married with four children. His wife doesn't work, so his business is the only source of income for the family.

Sameer finished his ninth grade but didn't continue his studies because his father died. Instead, he started as a worker in Israel but, after the second intifada where no worker was allowed to enter Israel, Sameer thought of having his own business. So he started cleaning carpets and houses.

Sameer needs this loan to buy some cleaning materials. He appears in the photo while cleaning carpets.

loans.use: To buy some cleanning materials

location.town: Al-Amary Refugee Camp, Ramllah City, West Bank

loans.name: Tifaimoana

texts.en:
Tifa  P. is a 20-year-old woman.  She lives in the town of Moataa.  She is married.  To make a living, Tifa owns and operates a business venture. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling pudding products in the local community.  Tifa  has been engaged in this business for over a year.  From these activities, Tifa  earns approximately 200 WST a month.

In 2009, Tifa  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tifa  is requesting her first loan from SPBD, for 1000 WST.  This loan will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients.  Tifa  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody S. is 31 years old and married to a fisherman. She has four children, the eldest being 10 years old.

Melody has been a Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) client for quite a long time already and, since she joined CEVI, she said to herself that she has improved a lot, especially in making her business profitable for her family. She started selling fish in 1997 and has been able to sustain it up to the present.

Melody would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI and will use the loan to buy a compressor. Some of the loan will also be used for buying food for their family consumption and in sending her children to school.

She said, she is pleased with CEVi services. She likes the idea of it giving insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy a compressor

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old married man living with his wife and child. He has owned his own car body shop for the past year with 5 years of experience.Today, Ali is hoping to borrow $1,200 in order to purchase needed tools for his business.

loans.use: to purchase needed tools for his business

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells drinks and pepper soup in her shop to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a mother of two children, and she is 39 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo, quien es pescador, y con sus 2 hijos que están estudiando. La casa que habitan es propia. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual lleva a vender a un caserío de su región a seis horas de viaje en auto. En algunas oportunidades, no vende sus prendas, sino que las intercambia por comestibles como plátanos, yucas, frijoles y otros. Debido a la buena administración de sus ganancias y con el apoyo de su banco comunal, hace 3 años logró comprar 2 motocarros, los cuales son manejados por chóferes particulares que hacen transporte de pasajeros y le dan a Juana lo que corresponde por el alquiler. Para más adelante quiere tener un tienda de a abarrotes, ya que por su zona nadie cuenta con este tipo de negocio.   

Este es su 9no préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta porque gracias a ser parte de un banco comunal ha podido ir cumpliendo cada uno de sus objetivos, además le gusta su grupo porque son personas responsables y solidarias. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más prendas de vestir y apoyará a su esposo comprando materiales de pesca.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería e inversión en el trabajo de su esposo

loans.name: Ericka Carolina

texts.es: La Señora Erika y su hermana Beatriz se dedican a la elaboracion de escabeche (pickles), ellas iniciaron este negocio hace un par de años buscando clientes por  la zona sur  y produciendo el escabeche segun sus pedidos, ahora que el mercado que abarcan a ido creciendo y asi tambien los pedidos, ellas ven necesario producir en mayor cantidad el escabeche y almacenarlo en un lugar fresco para asi dedicarse agilizar las entregas y dedicarse especialmente a repartir el producto . Es por eso que a señora Erika solicito un credito individual en Emprender como cliente nuevo para inversion en activos fijos
texts.en:
Mrs. Erika and her sister Beatriz dedicate themselves to the production of pickles. They started this business a couple of years ago looking for clients in the southern zone and producing pickles according to clients' requests. Now that the market is growing along with the requests, they find it necessary to produce the pickles in greater quantity and to store them in a fresh place so that the delivery and distribution of the product can occur in a more timely manner. It is because of this that Mrs. Erika requests an individual credit from Emprender (a Kiva field partner) as a new client to invest in permanent assets.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand a room of the house in order to use it as a work and storage space for her product

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy herbicides

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 51 years old and has seven children. Maria sells milk from her three dairy cows, and has a small garden where she grows vegetables. Maria would like to diversify her small farm and raise pigs for pork. She needs a loan to pay for pig food to fatten up the pig and for the services of a pig butcher. Maria’s husband, who sells hamburgers and drinks from a stall, has also taken out a loan from the Fundacion Paraguaya and it has helped his business enormously.

loans.use: Pig food and butcher services

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama  B.  est un père de famille de 29 ans .Il  a 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4 et 7 ans. Il  a  aussi la charge de sa propre Maman. Il est membre de l’U-IMCEC à la caisse de camberene seulement depuis octobre 2009 et n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt au sein de l’institution. Il gère un local dans lequel il procède  à la vente de portables et d’accessoires. Depuis deux ans il s’est focalise sur la vente de cartes de crédit qui est actuellement un domaine tres rentable dans le secteur. L’objet de ce crédit est le renforcement de son stock de cartes. Grace à l’accroissement de ses bénéfices il pourra mieux faire face a ses charges familiales.  
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié
texts.en:
Mr. Adama B. is a 29 year old father. He has two children between 4 and 7 years of age. He also takes care of his own mother. He has only been a member of the Cambérène branch of U-IMCEC since October 2009, and has never received a loan from the institution. He manages a store where he sells cell phones and accessories. For two years he has focused on the sale of mobile calling credit cards, which is currently a very profitable area in the sector. The purpose of this loan is to increase his stock of cards. With his increased profits he can better cope with family expenses.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC - with the positive support of lenders - succeeds in supporting women in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable, socioeconomic development.


Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: reinforcement of working capital

loans.name: Redem

texts.en:
Redem L., age 46, is a rice farmer from Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur.  He works from early morning until sunset to insure that the farm is free from weeds and birds. Currently, he tills a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm, which he hopes will provide him income to buy food, clothing and other basic needs. 

He would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In that way, he will be able to grow his harvest and increase his income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene la edad de 48 años. Actualmente es casada Solamente tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de ella es una pulpería esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años cuando ella empezó a vender fue porque laboraba como docente y el salario no era lo suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Ya que siempre le ha gustado el negocio y además sacar adelante a sus hijos.  Por lo que ahora solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, granos básicos, pan, galletas entre otros. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio de tal forma que le permita mejorar la situación económica de su familia y brindarles a sus hijos la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Julia is 48-years-old. She is married and has 2 children. She has had a small grocery store for 6 years. She started to sell groceries because when she worked as a teacher, her income wasn't enough to cover her family's expenses. She has always liked this business, and it lets her take care of her children. Now she is requesting financing that she will use to purchase candy, natural juices, basic grains, bread, cookies, etc. Her biggest wish is to expand her business in such a way that will let her improve her family's economic situation and offer her children the best education possible.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candy, natural juices, basic grains, bread, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Sabitu

texts.en:
Sabitu sells beef. He purchases the cow and slaughters the cow to sell. In this picture, Sabitu just finished slaughtering the cow. He loves this business because of the profit he makes from it. He hopes to expand his business. 

Sabitu is 65 years old, married with four children. Sabitu’s wife sells jewelry to help her husband meet the basic needs of the family. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more cows to slaughter and sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cows

loans.name: Simon Kamau

texts.en:
Simon is a 40-year-old farmer. He has one son and two daughters, aged 21, 17 and 7 years. Simon has been doing small-scale farming for the past fifteen years, planting crops like maize and beans. He also works at dairy farming, selling the milk for profit.

He was introduced to Kadet through marketing outreach at his home town, Gatundu. He has applied for a loan which he plans to use to expand his dairy farming business. Simon intends to purchase more dairy cows with the extra income he hopes to generate. 

His future hopes are to be a dairy cow breeder, and he believes his hard work will make this dream possible.

loans.use: To expand his dairy farming business by purchasing another cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Pastora V. Z., tiene 42 años de edad, vive en el barrio la Primavera, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en donde ofrece frescos, almuerzos, cocteles, frijoles.

Ella hace unas semanas la operaron de una hernia que le ha obstaculizado el convivir de manera habitual en las labores de su negocio y del hogar, ahora que se ha restablecido paco a poco, solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materia prima, para la venta de cocteles, esto le permitirá elevar las ventas y por ende sus ingresos, de tal manera espera se le apoye como en años aanteriores a mejorar su estabilidad económica y favorecer el status social de la familia.
texts.en:
Pastora V. Z., 42, lives in the La Primavera neighborhood. She is single and has 2 children. She has a small eatery where she offers soft drinks, lunches, shrimp cocktails and beans. She had surgery a few weeks ago for a hernia that has hampered her ability to live in the usual way, working in her business and her home. Now that she is gradually recovering, she requests a loan to buy raw materials for the sale of shrimp cocktails. This will allow her to increase her sales and also her income. She expects that this support, as in previous years, will help her improve her economic stability and will promote the social status of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shrimp

loans.name: Mestari Group

texts.en:
Zabiullah is the group leader of Mestari group.  He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives in a household with five members. He is a responsible man and works hard for his family to have comfortable life. 

He has a workshop where he repairs different kinds of cars. He needs the loan to purchase car parts and essential tools for repairing cars. 

He is confident that he will make his payments on time to repay the loan and will apply for another loan as soon as he finishes his repayment.

loans.use: To purchase car parts and tools to expand his business

loans.name: Suly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Suly V. de 44 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así por la abundancia de la flor orquídeas,  casas de cemento y calles en proceso de regeneración) de Guayaquil, esta separada de su esposo, ella tiene tres hijos que viven con ella. 

Suly por la desesperante idea de tener un negocio y la falta de oportunidades decidió invertir todos sus ahorros en botones, cierres y hilos y alquilar un local ya que vio mucha demanda para este tipo de negocios ya que habían muchos confucionistas pero nadie que venda los implemento para realizarlo. 

Por la buena decisión que tomo ahora ella es la principal distribuidora de artículos de sastrería de su sector, trabaja sola desde las 07h30 am hasta las 00h30 todos los días. Vende botones, cierres, hilos etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar botones, cierres, hilos, encajes para poderlo surtir mas. En el futuro quiere otros locales de ventas de artículos de sastrería.
texts.en:
Suly is 44 years old and lives in an urban zone of Las Orquídeas (named for the abundance of orchids, cement houses, and streets in the process of regeneration) in Guayaquil. She is separated from her husband, and has 3 children who live with her. Suly had the desperate idea of having her own business, and due to the lack of opportunity, decided to invest all her saving in buttons, zippers and thread, and to rent a locale, since she saw much demand for this type of business. There were many dressmaking shops but no one had these materials to satisfy demand. Due to her good decision, now she is the principal distributor of sewing articles in her sector. She works alone from 7:30 am until 12:30 every day. Suly sells buttons, zippers, thread, etc. With this loan she wants to buy buttons, zippers, thread, and cases to display more. In the future, she wants to open other locales to sell sewing supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MORE BUTTONS, THREAD, AND ZIPPERS TO SELL

loans.name: Urla

texts.es: Urla, de 39 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora,  vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia.Se dedica a la producción de  bisutería con alambres, cristales y perlas. Es diestra en el tejido de dijes y aretes, y cada modelo  es muy peculiar, además ofrece sus creaciones sobre una franela para que sus clientes escojan con facilidad la bisutería de su agrado. Cuando sus hijos eran pequeños estropeaban su avance y hoy en día; son sus fieles colaboradores, con la ayuda de ellos  entrega oportunamente sus pedidos. Está muy contenta por lo que produce, ya que lo realiza en su casa, donde también  vende desayunos. Así lleva 8 años trabajando; sólo que siente dificultad al no contar con herramientas apropiadas, que le  faciliten el avance. En el futuro, lo que más desea es instalar  su taller de bisutería.Este es su doceavo  préstamo con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, es por eso que  se compromete en pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente.Urla tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de una máquina que prense alambres, para  de ese modo, avanzar más rápido en la entrega de sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Urla is 39 years old. She is a mother and very hardworking. She lives with her husband and her 4 children in their own house. She makes jewelry with wire, crystals, and beads. She is skilled in making pendants and earrings and each model is unique. She offers her creations for sale on a piece of flannel so that her customers can easily choose the jewelry they like. When her children were small, they sometimes made it difficult to work; they are now her loyal collaborators and with their help, she can finish orders on time. She is very happy with what she makes because she can do this at home, where she also sells breakfasts. She has been working in this business for 8 years. One of her difficulties is not having appropriate tools that would make it easier to work. Her greatest wish for the future is to have a jewelry workshop. This is her twelfth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She knows the loan will be very beneficial for increasing her working capital, and so she promises to make all of her payments on time. Urla plans to use the requested money to buy a machine that makes wire so that she can work more quickly on her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a machine that will make wire for her jewelry

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
REYNA 
Nuestra socia Reyna es una mujer luchadora ella empezó su negocio hace muchos años al principio vendía refrescos ambulatoriamente, pera las personas solicitaban postres  así que tuvo la idea de prepararlos como son arroz con leche, mazamorra de calabaza, mazamorra morada entre otros, después de mucho tiempo y esfuerzo se pudo establecerse en un pequeño mercado por su casa. Uno de sus objetivos es ampliar su negocio y ahorrar para el futuro. Ella está agradecida con el préstamo y continuara cumpliendo sus obligaciones de pago. Seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
REYNA Our member, Reyna, is a tenacious woman. She started her business many years ago. At first she sold soft drinks as a traveling salesperson. But, people asked for desserts. That is how she had the idea to make desserts like rice with milk, pumpkin “mazamorra” (a typical Peruvian sweet), and corn mazammora, among others. After a long time and much effort she was able to set up a small market in her house. One of her objectives is to expand her business and save for the future. She is grateful for the loan, and she will continue to make her payments on time. EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Sergio C. is from the village of Lingating Baungon, Bukidnon. He is 65 years old. Sergio is married. To make a living, Sergio runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Sergio has been engaged in his business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Sergio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sergio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sergio is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Sergio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Godfrey Wasonga

texts.en:
Godfrey Wasonga O. was born in 1984 and is 26 years old. He is married to Lillian Owingu and they don't have any children. They live in the Mapera area in the outskirts of Migori town. 

Godfrey has been running his shop for the past three years and has seen his business grow through the years. He was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by a friend. He wants to borrow 80,000 Kenyan shillings to enable him to buy some sugar, flour, soft drinks and other foodstuffs to add to his shop. His shop is in Mapera market, approximately 7km from Migori town. The market serves as a meeting point of three small towns that neighbor it, which makes him have a big clientele.

He hopes in the next few years, he will be able to open a supermarket and also employ people to enable him to run this business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour and foodstuff to stock his shop

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine L. is from the town of Banga. She is 45 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lalaine raises corn for sale. Lalaine has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.  Lalaine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lalaine has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is now requesting a second loan of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Yahaira Patricia

texts.es: La señora Yahaira Patricia posee un negocio que es una tienda de venda de ropa nueva en su casa de habitación desde hace dos años realiza. Ella comenzó a vender ropa en las calles del suburbio para poder mantener a sus hijos, poco a poco con esfuerzo alcanzo a comprar más mercadería como relojes y mas ropa.  La compra de su mercadería en Managua de contado específicamente en el mercado oriental, junto a su esposo ha logrado salir adelante ya que con su ayuda su rentabilidad es mejor. El crédito que está solicitando es para invertir más en su negocio ya que se aproxima una buena temporada, la señora vive junto a su esposo de manera moderada y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yahaira Patricia has a business that is a store that sells new clothes in her house. She has had it for years. She started to sell clothes on the streets of the suburb to be able to support her children. Little by little, with hard work, she was able to buy more merchandise such as watches and more clothes. By buying merchandise up front in Managua, specifically in the Eastern Market, she has been able to get ahead. With her husband's help, her earnings are better. The loan that she is asking for is to invest more in her business since a busy season is approaching. She lives with her husband in a modest manner and she has basic services.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina;  La socia tiene 34 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, La socia elabora quesos en forma artesanal;  Ella necesita  el capital para invertir en los ingredientes e insumos para la elaboración de quesos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes e insumos para elaborar quesos. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank “Virgen Del Rosario De San Sebastian”; located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Sabina. She is 34 years old, married and has 4 children. She makes artisan cheeses. She needs capital to invest in the ingredients and consumables to make cheeses. She is requesting a loan for this.

She is grateful and values the loan granted through these means and also promises to complete the payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the ingredients and consumables to make cheeses

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma L. is 32 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Barangay 4 in the municipality of Talakag, Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Alma provides trisikad (a bicycle with sidecar for two) services to local community members with her husband as the driver. Alma has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Alma is requesting a loan, her first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase equipment needed to maintain service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment needed to maintain service

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans O. J. is thirty years old and married. His wife is a businesswoman. They have one son, three years old, whom they hope to give quality education to through the university level. 

Evans' business is located at a busy town center called Kakamega. He provides motorcycle transport to the local people. He has been in this business for ten years now. In addition to his transport business, he also sells water to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. 

He will use this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes) to purchase a motorcycle, which will add to his income. He hopes to grow his business, buy land, and build a house for his family, as well as help the needy in society. He describes himself as very hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi  exerce depuis 3 ans déjà le commerce de céréales, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays, ce qui lui permet de bénéficier d’une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes. Actuellement la demande de sa clientèle est élevée, le stock dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de satisfaire toute sa clientèle, elle sollicite donc de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat d’une trentaine de sac s de maïs et assurer le transport de la marchandise. Elle est mariée avec une personne à charge.
texts.en: Akouvi has already been in the business of selling cereals for three years.  She gets her supplies  within the country which allows for a greater profit margin on her sales.   Currently, the demand from her clients is up and the stock available to her is not sufficient to satisfy all of them.  Therefore, she is requesting from WAGES her first loan for the purchase of about thirty sacks of corn and to have it transported.  She is married and takes care of one other person.

loans.use: to purchase corn

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her sister's children. Grace has a business selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for over 10 years and  works 6 days a week selling her clothing at the market. 

Grace has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through making hand crafts. Her main business challenges include transportation and thieves. Her goal for her business is to start selling wholesale and to educate her children up to university level. Grace lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla L. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan.  Shventure ie is 34 years old.  Priscilla is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Priscilla owns and operates a business raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.  Priscilla has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Priscilla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Priscilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI.  Priscilla is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Priscilla from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla A. is from the village of Tuburan, Villaflor. She is 54 years old. Perla is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a specialized retail store. The store's main source of income comes from the sale of daily-use products such as canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste to the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Perla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from GDMPC. Perla is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which she will invest in expanding her business. This will be Perla's twelfth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her store

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
Sandra de 41 años,  es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha querido ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos familiares por eso ella hace algunos años atrás comenzó a hacer cortes de cabello desde $ 2.00 c/u  en su casa a sus vecinos y conocidos. 

Viviendo en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos comenzó a promocionarse como estilista del sector. Aunque al principio de esta actividad económica ella tuvo inconvenientes por no tener un lugar donde atender a sus clientes esto no fue de impedimento para que continuara trabajando. Por la buena administración en la actualidad ella ya tiene un local donde tiene su salón de belleza y trabaja todos los días desde las 09h00 haciendo tratamientos, cortes de cabello, manicura, pedicura etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo sillas, tratamientos capilares, productos de belleza. En el futuro quiere tener uno de los gabinetes más grandes que se halla conocido en Playas.
texts.en:
Sandra is 41 years old.  She is an enterprising woman who has always wanted to help her husband with their family expenses.  For this reason, some years ago she started providing haircuts in her home, charging $2.00 upwards, for neighbors and acquaintances.

Sandra lives in a canton called Playas, one of Ecuador's tourist destinations that is noted for its wide variety of seafood.  Sandra began to promote herself as a stylist in her district.  Although she had some problems at the beginning because she didn't have anywhere to serve her customers, this wasn't an obstacle that would stop her working.  Through her good management of her business, she currently has premises for her beauty salon and she works every day from 9.00am providing treatments, haircuts, manicures, pedicures, etc.

To continue in her business, Sandra would like to use her loan to buy chairs, hair treatments and beauty products.  In the future, she would like to have one of the biggest salons that has ever been known in Playas.

loans.use: To buy chairs and hair treatments

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and cooperates with his father to provide a better income for the family. He has been working as a home painter for eight years, and he has owned his business since 2007. He purchases his painting tools and products from a local painting center.

 He works on a freelance basis upon request of his clients. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed painting tools. With the new utensils, he will be able to take on more projects and be in demand with his clients. In the future, he hopes to start taking on bigger projects in order to increase his business operation.

loans.use: to purchase needed painting tools

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinter A. is 32 years old and married to Peter Otieno and they have four children aged between 11 years and three years old.

Jacinter has a retail shop that she runs in Molem shopping centre and has created a huge clientelle due to the fact that her shop is strategically placed. Jacinter needs money to buy maize, sugar, and cooking oil to add to her stock to enable her meet the demands of her clients. She is currently applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend of hers who is a client. The profits made will be used to cater for the family needs and also pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to own a big supermarket in the future and sell things on wholesale price.

loans.use: Buy maize, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Sudi

texts.en:
Sudi is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is security bills.

He has operated his retail shop for the past two years, selling to his neighbors and passersby. Previously, he was selling newspapers at the market. Sudi faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He hopes to expand his shop and establish a wholesale operation.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase sacks of sugar for sale at his retail shop. He decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar for sale at his retail shop

loans.name: Estanislaa

texts.en:
Ms. Stanislaa owns a store in the San Salvador suburb of San Ignacio town. Her store is known for its good service. She is married with grown children, and has worked for years in her business.

She opted for the loan with Fundación Paraguaya to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to provide customers a greater variety of products. She welcomes working with Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for their support of the development and growth of her business.

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a single man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

To earn a living, he operates a fruit-selling business. Specifically, he sells avocados at the market to market dwellers and to his neighbours. Mohamed hopes to own a retail shop in the future.

He is now seeking a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES ($375) to purchase sacks of avocados for re-sale purposes. He decided to join Yehu in order to be able to better engage in business activities.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional avocados

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Ricardo; El socio tiene 65 años de edad, el socio  es casado; el socio tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 6 de ellos aún dependen del socio para los estudios y la alimentación; El socio tiene un pequeño restaurante llamado el Cienciano ubicado en el Jr. Mainique 360; el restaurante del socio es atendido por su esposa y sus hijos, el socio es trabajador en el área administrativa de educación en Urubamba y con todos sus ahorros puso este restaurante para que su familia trabaje y puedan tener otro ingreso extra, les ha ido muy bien y con lo que ahorran pueden comprar al por mayor los productos requeridos por la demanda de insumos, el socio desea el crédito ahora para comprar cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor, para implementar el negocio familiar y de este modo mejorar las ventas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cervezas y gaseosas al por mayor.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a member of the "Tercer Milenio" (Third Millennium) community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Ricardo is 65 years old, married, and has 8 children, 6 of whom still depend on him for their education and food.  Ricardo owns a small restaurant called 'El Cienciano'  which is located at 360 Jr. Mainique.  His wife and children work in the restaurant.  Ricardo works in educational administration in Urubamba.  He used all his savings to set up the restaurant so that he could provide work for his family and so that they could make some extra income.  It has done very well and, with what they save, they are able to buy the products and supplies they need wholesale.  

Ricardo is requesting this loan to invest in buying beer and soda wholesale to stock the family business.  In this way he hopes to improve sales.  He is requesting this loan to buy beer and soda wholesale.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda wholesale

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente L. M. es un hombre muy trabajador que para sostener a la familia se queda largas horas en la maquiladora para tener un ingreso extra. En este momento una persona le ofrece un terreno a un precio muy bajo, el cual no quiere desaprovechar esta oportunidad; pues este será su patrimonio para ofrecer a su familia. Vicente ya es una persona grande de edad el cual no desea ser carga para sus hijos, por lo que pide el apoyo para adquirir el terreno.
texts.en:
Vicente L. M. is a very hard working man who spends long hours at an assembly plant in order to support his family and have extra income.  

He is currently being offered a lot by a person at a very low price and he doesn’t want to miss out on this opportunity since it will be his family’s estate.  

Vicente is an older adult who does not want to be a burden to his children so is asking for help to acquire the lot.

loans.use: to buy a lot.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a cosmetics sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Remedios requested a 23,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy cosmetics and beauty supplies to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty supplies to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marina tiene  45 años y es madre soltera  de un hijo pequeñito. Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, exclusivamente uniformes para colegios, escuelas y empresas.
Trabajó desde muy pequeña con su madre, de quien aprendió el oficio, luego de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logró montar un pequeño taller con cuatro máquinas de coser, y hoy día ya posee una buena clientela formada.
Es muy conocida por su zona pro la calidad de sus prendas y el precio accesible que otorga a cada confección que realiza, ahora ella necesita de este crédito para comprar telas en cantidad y de esta manera abaratar aún más el costo de sus prendas.
Marina en el futuro  desea  abrir un salón propio y exhibir las confecciones únicas que realiza.
texts.en:
Marina is 45 years old and the single mother of a young son.  She dedicates herself to making clothing, exclusively school and business uniforms.

She worked from a young age with her mother, from whom she learned the trade.  After much effort and dedication, she managed to open a small workshop with four sewing machines.  Today, she has a well-established customer base.

She is known throughout her area for the quality of her clothing and the reasonable price she charges for each of her creations.  She now needs this loan to buy fabric in bulk so she can lower the prices of her clothing even more.  Marina wants to open her own salon and showcase the unique clothes that she makes.

The loan requested would be destined for the purchase of the tools of her trade.

loans.use: buy fabrics, threads, glues, buttons, zippers, borders.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.es: Sherly tiene 27 años vive en compañía de sus padres en la propiedad de ellos. La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de comida, que junto a su mama, se asociaron para instalar un restaurante, ubicada en su misma casa. Es así que hace dos años que atienden a sus clientes mientras que su Mamá se dedica a la preparación de comida. Ambas tiene el control de la cantidad de comida que deben preparar y gracias a la buena sazón, la cantidad de clientela han ido en aumento. Su negocio es ventajoso porque el local de venta es propio y eso le permite no gastar en el alquiler. Le gusta desarrollar esta actividad porque es independiente en sus ingresos y puede disponer de sus horarios por lo que desea seguir mejorando en su servicio y atención a sus clientes. Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP,  esta muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal ya que en este corto tiempo de permanencia que tiene aprendió bastante y esta muy agradecida por ello así mismo se compromete una vez mas a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicito, comprará utensilios nuevos en cantidad.
texts.en:
Sherly is 27 years old and lives with parents on their property. She and her mother sell food in a restaurant established in their home. For the past two years, Sherly has been attending to the customers while her mother takes charge of preparing the food. Both of them have control over the amount of food to prepare, and thanks to its good flavor, the number of customers has increased. The advantage of her business is that she owns it and does not have to pay rent. Sherly enjoys developing her business because it allows her to be independent with her income and gives her the chance to establish her schedule. She wants to improve the service and attention she provides to her customers.

This is the second time she has received a loan from MFP. Sherly is very pleased to be part of her Communal Bank because she has learned a lot within a short period of time. For this she is grateful and promises once again to be prompt with her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a large number of new utensils.

loans.use: to purchase new utensils.

loans.name: Adeela's Group

texts.en:
Adeela is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighborhood clients to share the financial burden with her husband. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month which earns her reasonably good income. She is also a very responsible housewife and does her household work very well. 

Her husband is a fruit seller by trade. He sells fresh seasonal fruit from his shop in the community market. Adeela is the mother of four children: two of them are enrolled in a local school while the others stay at home. 

The summer season has come and her husband needs to offer some fresh seasonal fruit to his customers. Therefore, Adeela has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in this regard. Her husband has more than 10 years of experience in his business and Adeela hopes that an investment will help him improve his business and increase his profits. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Adeela.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit for resale.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene, a responsible 41-year-old housewife, has been engaged in selling cosmetics and apparel from AVON, Natasha and MSE within her village for almost five years. She usually earns about PHP 5,000 each month. Mylene is now requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional lipsticks, perfumes, lotions and powders to sell.

In the future, Mylene hopes to strengthen this enterprise in order to help her husband in gaining income for their family. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support them in this business to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase additional lipsticks, perfumes, lotions and powders to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has three children. Ama sells bowls, pegs, slippers and other things at Abura, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a court cleaner. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Ama will use the loan to purchase more slippers and pegs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and pegs to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria de 45 años de edad es una mujer consagrada a su único hijo de 2 años de edad, con el que sueña construirle un futuro exitosos, trabajando fuertemente en su negocio, a través del cual vende mercancía al detal, principalmente ropa, cremas y en general productos de belleza, mediante el sistema de contado en punto comercial y a crédito y en plazos pactados de acuerdo a las posibilidades de pago de sus clientes. 
Desde el año 1985 Maria trabajó durante 22 años en Venezuela, país fronterizo, logrando ahorrar un dinero con el que regresó en el año 2007 a su querida Colombia y compró mercancía para dedicarse al negocio ya mencionado.  Ella inició con un mercado doméstico entre sus más cercanos familiares, vecinos y amigos, vendiéndole ropa interior, deportiva, cubre lechos, artículos para el hogar, pero gradualmente su clientela ha crecido y también ha diversificado su mercancía, agregándole especialmente productos de belleza en una vitrina que surte en su propia casa, como punto comercial, además de un local en un centro comercial bien posicionado, donde exhibe sus mercancías.  Su sueño más adelante es contar con una vivienda propia y apoyar el emprendimiento en su familia, igualmente  ampliar su negocio, con nuevos puntos comerciales para continuar día  a día generando ingresos que le permitan crecer y fortalecer su sueño de bienestar con su pequeño hijo. Su Credikiva es el primer financiamiento, que Maria hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará mercancías que le permitirán actualizar sus inventarios con los productos que más rotan, pues son apetecidos por su clientela, por la que cada día perfecciona sus estrategias mercadológicas con tal de fidelizarla.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and she is a woman who is devoted to her only child, a 2-year old son, to whom she dreams of giving a successful future. She works very hard in her business and through it she sells merchandise in retail, primarily clothing, skin lotions, and general beauty products. She completes her sales in cash and on credit. Payments are worked on based on the clients' ability to pay.

Starting in 1985 Maria worked in Venezuela for 22 years, a neighboring country. She managed to save some money and in 2007 she returned to her beloved country, Columbia. She purchase merchandise to start the above-mentioned business. She started out in a local market, among her closest relatives, but gradually her clientele increase and she diversified her merchandise. She included beauty products displayed in a display case in her own home. She also has a store in a well situated shopping district where she displays her merchandise. Her dream for the future is to own her own home and to support small businesses in her family. She also wants to expand her business and to generate new business opportunities to continue to earn money day after day. It will help her to grow and strengthen her dream to provide her son with wellbeing. Her Kiva loan is her first loan that Maria accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it she will purchase merchandise which will permit her to supply her inventory with the products that sell best, those that her clients demand the most. Every day she perfects her market strategies with the goal of earning their loyalty.

loans.use: to supply her inventory of products which are in highest demand.

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es:
Bertila tiene 61 años D. edad, vive en casa propia, junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito D. Chiclayo, en una zona rural D. este. Bertila y su familia gozan D. buenas referencias personales, por ser personas trabajadoras y por la unión que existe entre ellos.

Bertila se dedica a la agricultura y cuenta con varios años D. experiencia en este rubro. Actualmente, cultiva arroz y tiene clientes establecidos que compran su producto. 

La demanda D. Bertila ha crecido y es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le permitirá invertir en su cultivo D. arroz, comprando fertilizantes para mejorar su cosecha.

Bertila es un cliente conocido D. nuestra entidad y tiene buenas referencias.
texts.en:
Bertila is 61 years old and he lives in a house of his own, together with is wife and children. It is located in the district of Chiclayo, an eastern rural region. Bertila and his family enjoy good personal references. They are hardworking people who have strong family ties among themselves.

Bertila is an agriculturist and he has many years' experience in this field. Currently he is cultivating rice and he already has established clients who buy his product.

Bertila has seen an increase in demand and it is why he requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. It will help him invest in his rice cultivation with the purchase of fertilizers to improve the harvest.

Bertila is a well known client by our organization and he has good references.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his rice plantation.

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en:
Antonieto is a 45-year-old fisherman living in Dauis, Bohol. He is asking for a loan to purchase fishing nets and gas for his pump boat. This loan will help him continue running his business and catch more fish to sell.

Antonieto works hard to support his family of a wife and 4 children. His oldest child is 15 years old and the youngest is 5. 

In the future, Antonieto hopes to buy another pump boat and renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and gas for his pump boat

loans.name: Las Artesanas Del Fresno Group

texts.es:
Doña Angelina vieve en una comunidad que se distingue por ser casi un bosque, hay muchos pinos y tambien se encuentra el centro ceremonial Mazahua, se dice que no hace mucho tiempo habia venados pero hace unos años se terminaron, doña Angelina tiene un grupo que se llama las artesanas del fresno, se llaman así porque las 8 integrantes son artesanas y sabes bordar y coser por esa razón se llaman así, doña Angelina se dedica a comprar tela por metro para hacer colchas, cobijas y chalecos, ya tiene 15 años de experiencia y sabe bordar muy bien, nos dice que hay varias cosas que le dificultan las ventas, por ejmplo nos dice que en tiempos de calor sus bordados no se venden, porque como son de lana es dificil que una persona quiera comprar un chaleco, tambien nos dice que las ventas son un  albhur, para poder salir a vender nesecita llevarse todo lo que hizo para enseñarles al cliente su trabajo, pero como puedes vender cosas como te puedes regresar con ellas, por eso nos comenta que es un albhur, otra cosa que se le hace dificil es andar cargando las cosas, y es mucho peso el que se junta y si se hace muy complicado cargar toda sus cosas, a doña Angelina le gustaria ya tener suguras sus ventas nadamas dedicarse a entregar pedidos, porque sus hijos estan estudiando y quiere que salgan adelante, el credito le ha servido de mucho para poder hacer sus bordados y manda un mensaje de agradecimiento por los creditos para su negocio, la señora tiene 4 hijos, lleva 8 años de casada, y 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia y su esposo trabaja y tambien nos dice que sabe bordar y habeces le ayuda, las demas integrantes del grupo se llaman
1.-Maria de los Angeles,
2.-Leonila,
3.-Lucia,
4.-Gregoria
5.-Rufina
6.-Rosio
7.-Juana Iris
todas las integrantes son artesanas y se dedican a lo mismo hacer bordados de manteles y costuras de todo tipo.
texts.en:
Doña Angelina lives in a community that is distinctive for being almost a forest; there are many pine trees and it's also the location of the Mazahua ceremonial center.  It is said that not long ago there were deer here, but as of a few years ago they were gone.  

Doña Angelina has a group that calls themselves "Las Artesanas del Fresno" (The Artisans of Fresno).  They are so named because the 8 members are artisans who know how to do embroidery and sewing, and they are from El Fresno.  It is for this reason that they are named this way.

Doña Angelina works buying fabric by the meter for making bedspreads, blankets and waistcoats.  She has 15 years of experience and knows how to embroider very well.  She tells us that there are several things that hinder sales.  For example, she tells us that in hot weather her embroidery does not sell; as her waistcoats are made from wool it is difficult for a person to want to buy one.  She also says that making sales is a gamble.  To be able to go out to make sales, she needs to bring everything she has made ​​so as to educate her customer about her work, but while she may sell some items, she needs to return with the rest, which is why she tells us it's a gamble.  Another thing that makes it hard is carrying the items, as they are very heavy together which makes it very difficult to carry all her items.  Doña Angelina would like to have reliable sales and only offer items to meet orders, because her children are attending school and she wants them to progress in life.

The loan has done a great deal for her embroidery business, and she sends a message of thanks for the loans for her business.  The señora has 4 children; she has been married for 8 years and is 37 years old.  She lives in her own house and her husband works.  She also tells us that he knows how to embroider, and provides her with help.

The other members of the group are named:
1.-Maria de los Angeles
2.-Leonila 
3.-Lucia 
4.-Gregoria 
5.-Rufina 
6.-Rosio 
7.-Juana Iris 

All the members are artisans and work in the same field, embroidering tablecloths and sewing of all different kinds.

loans.use: to buy fabric for embroidery.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección, tiene 53 años. Lucy se dedica a la venta de pescado en el Mercado 12 de Abril, es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos, solo 2 de ellos estan a su cargo, el préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de pescado y mariscos de mejor calidad, ella esta en Finca hace 20 años, antes vendía pescado en un triciclo pero ahora tiene un puesto, agradece todo el apoyo que le dieron y que le estan dando ahora con el préstamo, el cual necesita para invertir en su negocio. Gracias a las capacitaciones aprendió a ser mas recta y la puntualidad mas que nada.
texts.en: Lucy is a member of Banco Comunal Proyección.  She is 53 years old and sells seafood in the 12 de Abril (April 12th) market.  She is a single mother and has 6 children.  Only  2 are still dependent on her.  She will use the loan to buy fish and seafood in large quantities.  She has been in Finca for 20 years.    She used to sell seafood on a tricycle, but now she has a stand.   She is grateful for all the support given to her and for the current loan which she needs to invest in her business.  Most of all thanks to the training she has learned to be more conscientious and punctual.

loans.use: purchase fish and seafood.

loans.name: Mabel Betsabe

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Mabel; tiene 29 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 2 hijos de 13, 8 meses de edad;  La socia trabaja en su propio  salón de belleza como manicurista ella realiza diversos trabajos en las uñas de sus clientas, la socia hace figuras, aplicados, aumento de uñas, en acrílico, en ceras, en gel y con muchas técnica logra bellos trabajos, la socia desea poder invertir el préstamo en la compra de esmaltes, secador de uñas, pinceles e incrementar sus salón para poder un día verlo crecer y ser famosos así tendría su sucursal de salones de belleza especialistas en uñas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la implementación de su negocio y comprar esmaltes de uñas de diversos colores y de buena calidad, comprar secador de uñas y pinceles de finos tamaños.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Mabel belongs to the “COMUZONE II” communal bank. It is located in the Huanchac District, in the province and department of Cusco.
Mabel is 29 and lives with her partner. She has 2 children ages 13 and 8 months. She works in her own beauty salon as a manicurist. She does various nail work; she paints shapes, does applications and nail extensions, and works with acrylics, wax, and gel. She is very skilled and creates beautiful results. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of nail polishes, a nail-dryer, brushes, and to expand her salon so that she can see it grow one day and be famous. She wants to have a chain of beauty salons specializing in nails. She is requesting a loan to invest in stocking her business, buying various colours of high-quality nail polish, a nail dryer, and fine brushes.

She is grateful for the support authorized and promises to repay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in stocking her business: to purchase high-quality nail polishes in various colours, a nail-drying machine, and fine brushes.

loans.name: Familia Con Suerte (Manta) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les va a servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos mejoran sus pequeños negocios.  Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como, comercio en general, venta de comida, servicios entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ludis, tiene 32 años, casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es supervisor en una fábrica en Manta.
