Ella es una gran ama de casa que además de estar al tanto de todas las necesidades de su hogar y de sus pequeños hijos también se dedica al comercio con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos, ella vende arroz por quintales, en su casa vende muchos quintales de arroz a sus clientes ya que este es un producto indispensable  en los hogares del país,  recibe directamente el arroz desde las piladoras y luego vende a sus clientes y les da facilidades de pago ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva 2 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien, le gusta ya que se gana un dinero sin tener que descuidar a sus pequeños hijos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar quintales de arroz, este es su primer crédito en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.
 
Sus metas son  seguir adelante en su negocio y con el banco.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Familia Con Suerte" meets every 15 days in the Miraflores neighborhood of the city of Manta.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many in all seasons of the year, and for being a city with unparalleled beauty and many tourist attractions.  This  group of people decided to unite and form this communal bank so that they could get loans to improve their small businesses, which will help them a lot. The members have a variety of businesses including: general retail sales, food sales, services, and other activities.

Here we meet Ludis, 32, who is married and has two children aged 10 and 7 who are in school.  Her husband is a supervisor in a factory in Manta.

Ludis is a great housewife who, along with carrying out the household chores and caring for her small children, also has a business which allows her to generate her own income.  She sells rice by the quintal (hundred pound sacks.)  She sells a lot of quintals of rice to her customers from her house, because this is a staple product in the households of her country.  She receives the rice directly from the rice mills, and later sells it to her customers.  She provides her customers with payment terms, since she sells on credit, and she collects every week.  She has been doing this work for 2 years, and it is going very well.  She likes it because she earns money without having to neglect her small children.  

This loan will be used to buy 100-pound sacks of rice.  This is her first loan with the communal bank.  She is the president of her communal bank, and she likes it because of how quickly the loans are disbursed.  

Her goals are to continue to make progress with her business and with her communal bank.

loans.use: to buy 100-pound sacks of rice

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 36 years old and single. She supports a family of three people.  She has a retail shop which helps her in meeting her family’s needs.  She has been running her business for three years, and earns an income of KES 70,000 per month.  

She was previously given a loan of KES 50,000, which she used to expand her business.  She has been paying it back successfully.  This is her fourth loan, which she will use to buy more stock of soft drinks, wheat flour, sweets, and washing detergent. The anticipated profit that she will get will be used to expand her business. Her hope and dream for her business is to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, wheat flour, sweets, and washing detergent.

loans.name: Camlus

texts.en: Camlus used his previous loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fabric for making clothes. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He needs another loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 37-year-old single man from Lebanon, living with one parent and a sibling. He has owned a carpentry business for the past eight years. He works very hard to earn good income and has two full-time employees helping him achieve the work tasks.  

With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, Iyad will be able to purchase more wood for his business. He reports that both his business productivity and income will be increased as a result of the loan.

loans.use: buy wood for his carpentry business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen, age 35, would like a loan to buy clothes for resell ahead of the Christmas season. He has been operating a boutique for five years despite the challenges of the high transport costs encountered in purchasing stock. He wants his business to expand into new markets, especially in town, and also dreams of educating his children.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resell.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie is a 35-year-old married man with three children. He is a very kind and hard-working father. He does everything to provide for the basic needs of his family. His spouse is a a full-time house wife who cares for their children, and sometimes, his wife helps him to manage the farm.

Freddie is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase corn seed and fertilizer for his farm. He is a man of courage and hopes that all his plans will be granted through his determination and patience for his work.

In the future, Freddie hopes that his farm will expand to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Vaimulimuli

texts.en:
Vaimulimuli is 28 years old and is married with 2 children. She owns and operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community. Vaimulimuli has 2 years of experience in this business.

She needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Vaimulimuli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Vaimulimuli's 2nd loan with SPBD. 


About  SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked products for sale

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
This is 32 -year-old Donald from Krootown, a central area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with one child, age nine years-old. His wife assists him in the store. Their only child is currently attending school. 

Donald runs a clothing store in Krootown, where he sells clothes for men and women. He has been running this business for 13 years. He works at his store from Monday until Saturday, six days per week and eight hours a day from 8:50 am – 5:30 pm. He has a passion for business, and his business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is low inventory turnover.

Donald has requested a loan in order to buy more clothing for men and women. The extra income from this loan will allow him to expand his business and increase his income, which will make it possible for him to take care of his family. In the future, he plans to open an industry in Sierra Leone. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
Juana María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a varias actividades comerciales   tiene una pulpería desde hace 11 años, vende comida y gaseosa por mayor.  Ella está casada con don Eugenio quien es ingeniero.
El crédito lo invertirá en huevo, granos básicos, queso, carne…etc. para aumentar el negocio.
texts.en:
Juana María is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has several businesses.  She has had a grocery store for 11 years and sells food and soft drinks in quantity.  She’s married to Eugenio who is an engineer.

She will use the money from this loan to buy eggs, basic grains, cheese, meat, etc. to grow her business

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Emile

texts.en:
Emile is 27-years-old and is single. He owns a business of supplying furniture. This is his second year in this business and he works from 8am until 6pm every day except on Sunday. He currently employs two people to help him.

Emile has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more furniture for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying more furniture for resale.

loans.name: Katierton  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe KATIERTON 1 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  NIMPRODIOULA un des villages de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso enfin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.
 lls sont à leur 7ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
 La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Amadou en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo, il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 492.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat de labour, d’intrants et de semences agricoles

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario has a stand in the local market where he sells fruits and vegetables. He started the business over 15 years ago after working at a fruit stand with his uncle. With $30 dollars he was able to set up a stand and with money from loan sharks he was able to buy the fruit. He works an early schedule from 5:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. with the support of his wife. This stand is the only the source of income for his family and has provided enough for them to buy a small home and barely enough to send his kids to school. He says that there is certainly enough demand to sell more fruit but he does not have the money to purchase higher quantities. For this reason he has approached Mifex and Kiva for a loan.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a larger variety of fruits and vegetables for his stand

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly has a store where she sells all kinds of food, vegetables and drinks. She started her business 2 years ago. Her mother had the store before and left it for Nelly. Nelly has been able to manage the store well. She works every day from 6am to 11pm. The store is located in a central location. She needs the loan to buy food, such as: rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, sausages, meat and chicken. Nelly was born in Guayaquil and is 21 years old. She has 2 children. She is a single mom as her husband left her. She lives with her mother who helps out all the time. Since she was young, she has always worked at the store with her mother. She knows how to run the business and wants to do well to provide for her sons. Despite her youth she is a good businesswoman ready to do well and move ahead.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Zoe], Kiva Volunteer.

Nelly tiene una tienda donde vende toda clase de víveres, legumbres y gaseosas. Ella comenzó con el negocio desde hace 2 años su madre tenía la tienda y se la dejó a ella. Nelly ha podido manejar el negocio bien. Atiende todos los días de la semana desde la 6:00AM hasta las 11:00PM. El negocio esta ubicado en una de las principales de la zona. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar los víveres como: Arroz. Azúcar, aceite, legumbres, embutidos, carnes y pollo. Nelly nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 21 años. Con 2 hijos. Ella es madre soltera su esposo la abandonó. Ella vive con su madre, quien la ha apoyado en todo momento. Desde joven comenzó a trabajar en el comedor de su madre. Sabe del negocio y piensa salir adelante especialmente por sus hijos. A pesar de su juventud se ve una persona emprendedora dispuesta a salir adelante.

loans.use:
To buy: rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, sausages, meat and chicken.

para comprar: Arroz. Azúcar, aceite, legumbres, embutidos, carnes y pollo.

loans.name: Martín

texts.en:
Martín is married and lives in Tampico, Tamaulipas. Six years ago, he retired from his job in the Mexican Navy and started selling jewelry with his wife so they could still afford necessities. The business was successful and thanks to it, after three years Martín was able to buy a taxi and is currently a taxi driver.

After all this time, the taxi needs repairs, new tires and shocks. Martín is asking for a loan of $925 to help cover these expenses so he can continue to offer a quality service to his clients and avoid accidents. He needs your to keep working. You can help improve the life of this family. They are thankful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Martín es casado, vive en Tampico, Tamaulipas. Hace seis años, Martín se retiró de su anterior trabajo en la Armada de México y empezó a vender joyería junto con su esposa, para poder obtener los recursos que necesitaban, les fue muy bien en este negocio y gracias a éste, después de tres años, pudieron adquirir un taxi en el que Martín actualmente trabaja.

Después de todo este tiempo, el taxi necesita reparaciones, llantas nuevas y amortiguadores, para lo que Martín requiere de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que empleará con este fin, para poder ofrecer un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y evitar cualquier tipo de accidente. Él necesita de tu ayuda para seguir trabajando, tú puedes ayudar a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To make repairs and cover expenses on his taxi.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
"I am 49 years old, married with eight (8) children. LAPO has brought rain (i.e., growth) to my
business and my family," say Mrs. Maria B.. Maria is from Delta State of Nigeria and specializes in hair
dressing . She is eager to access a loan of US$ 450 so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more equipment & also goods for sale

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara makes footwear from leather, imitation leather, and other materials. She works for a shoe manufacturer that pays her for every dozen pairs of shoes she produces. Her home and her workshop are in Alto Tejar district of La Paz. She is a single mother and the sole support of her daughter. This is her first loan application. She would use the money to buy an industrial sewing machine and thus increase her productivity. She qualifies for the loan because of her experience in shoe manufacturing and her existing business, which generates enough income for her to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Clara recibe cuero, cuerina y todo tipo de material para calzado ya que se dedica a la preparación de calzados. Trabaja con una empresa de calzados donde le cancelan por la preparación de cada docena de calzados. Su domicilio y Taller se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Alto Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene una hija y es la única que mantiene a su familia ya que es madre soltera. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de una maquina de coser industrial para mejorar su producción Su trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en la preparación de calzados, lo cual le da ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine on which to make shoes

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
I sell second-hand clothes for a living. I have had this business for five years. Now I need more capital in order to maintain my business and buy shirts, pants, sweaters, blouses, and other apparel. Because the holidays are approaching, I currently have several orders. This is a great season for my business because my sales increase. With the income generated from my business, I help my husband with the family expenses, since he earns very little.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Yo me dedico a la venta de ropa usada, este negocio lo tengo en mi casa desde hace 5 años. Ahora necesito el dinero para poder sustir mi negocio y comprar: camisas, pantalones, sueteres, blusas etec. Ahora tengo varios pedidos ya que se hacerca la tenpodata de navidad esta es una buena epoca ya que se incrementan mis ventas. Con los ingresos de las ventas ayudo a mi esposo con gastos de familiares, ya que el gana muy poco dinero en su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase of shirts, jeans, pants, and other apparel

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Twenty five year old Faafetai T. from Fusi Safata has been doing her best to keep her vegetable plantation running well.  Having no children, she has dedicated most of her time to working her plantation together with the help of her husband.  The reason for the loan is to buy new chemicals, seeds and working tools for her plantation.  Her husband, being a farmer, is also a very big help.  She is grateful to SPBD for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, seeds, and tools for her plantation

loans.name: Haneefan's Group

texts.en: Haneefan S. is the mother of four children. Three of them attend a local school and the eldest is a tailor. He could not study because of the family's poor financial circumstances when he was of school age. But now, the family's financial circumstances have grown much better. Her husband is a contractor, and he constructs buildings on contract. She will use her loan to buy construction supplies so her husband can build rental units to increase the family's income. Haneefan wishes to help others in her community, so she has become the leader of her loan group, which includes four other women.  Maqbool B. will use her loan to manufacture embroidery frames. Zarina B. will use her loan to help her husband's construction business. Zarina T. will use her loan to improve her husband's scrap business. Salma B. will use her loan to buy toys in bulk for her toy business.

loans.use: To improve businesses

loans.name: Khamid

texts.en:
R. Khamid is 44 years old. He and his wife have three children.

In order to support his family, Khamid purchases cattle for breeding which he sells for meat. He has been in this business for the past 16 years. His elder son is grown up enough to help his father in his business, which is the main source of income for the family. 

Khamid is requesting a loan of USD1000 in order to purchase one more bull and the necessary fodder. The loan will be paid back over the next 9 months. This is the second loan of Khamid.  The first was paid back on time.

loans.use: To purchase one bull and fodder

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix's call shop recently marked its one year anniversary. However, this isn't the only business that he runs. He also has a restaurant that is progressing with the help of his wife and children.

With the idea of making the most of the success that call shops were having a year ago, and with the goal of giving his children more work, he decided to open this business. Nevertheless, the competition is a factor that he has to fight every day because currently there are two call shops on every corner of the district where Felix lives. This is why he would like to implement more modern equipment in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El locutorio de Félix tiene recién un año en funcionamiento. Sin embargo, este no el único negocio que él maneja. A la par, tiene también un restaurante que con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos lo saca adelante.

Con la idea de aprovechar el éxito que tenían los locutorios hace un año y con el propósito de darles más trabajo a sus hijos, decidió abrir este negocio. No obstante, la competencia es un factor con el que debe lidiar diariamente ya que en la actualidad hay dos locutorios en cada esquina en el distrito donde Félix vive. Por esto, le gustaría implementar con equipos más modernos su local.

loans.use: To implement more modern equipment in his call shop

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna, in her 21 years has demonstrated that she is a hard working, creative and intelligent woman. Sher immense will to make herself into an excellent professional has motivated her to keep up her efforts in the noble business in paper recycling. She decided to take on this business thanks to an initiative started by her beloved parents, who supported her every step along the way and motivated her in her work. During her spare time she travels along practicallly every major route in her native city of Juliaca, with the goal of acquiring her merchandise from business, factories, and institutions in her city. Once she has gathered enough she sells it to a paper factory, a producer of note books and bathroom tissues, located in the city of Arequipa. With this wonderful job she has managed to covery the costs of her university education. Giovanna hopes to increase her capital, and with this goal she comes to you petitionning for a loan. Your generous heart will enable the fulfillment of the dream of this brave young woman.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Giovanna, a sus 21 años demostró ser una mujer muy empeñosa, creativa e inteligente, sus inmensas ganas de convertirse en una excelente profesional la motiva a seguir esforzándose en su noble labor de reciclaje de papel.Decidió dedicarse a esta actividad gracias a la iniciativa de sus queridos padres, quienes en todo momento la apoyaron y motivaron en el desempeño de su labor, durante sus horas libres recorre prácticamente todas las arterias de su ciudad natal,Juliaca, con el fin de adquirir su mercadería de los moradores, empresas, y distintas instituciones de su ciudad, luego de reunir una buena cantidad los vende a una fábricade cuadernos y papel higiénico, en la ciudad de arequipa.Con este ingenioso trabajo está logrando cubrir los gastos que demanda su educación en una Universidad Privada de su ciudad natal.Giovanna tiene pensado aumentar el monto de su capital, con ese propósito recurre a tu persona para hacerte la petición de un préstamo.Tu buen corazón permitirá cumplir los anhelos de esta valiosa joven.

loans.use: To increase her capital to be able to purchase a greater quantity of paper.

loans.name: Kathy

texts.es:
Kathy is a member of the Communal Bank of Las Americas, which is located in Psj. 27 de Mayo S/N in the district of Ucayali. She is 33 years old and is the mother of two children. Her husband is a carpenter. With her first loan from Manula Ramos S. 300 she decided to invest in the sale of frozen beverages.

Now her sales have increased; thanks to the climate in the city her drinks sell easily. She tends to her children, does the housework and takes care of her business at the same time.

With this loan of S. 1,000, which she will repay in four months, she will buy sodas of all prices and sizes, ice and jello.

With the money she has made, Kathy is thinking about putting up a small coffee shop in order to sell more products and thus generate more income for her family.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Kathy pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Américas, ubicado en el Psj. 27 de Mayo S/N, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es cubicador de madera. Kathy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de bebidas heladas. En la actualidad sus ventas han aumentado, gracias al clima de la ciudad sus bebidas se venden facilmente , atiende a sus hijos y realiza las labores de su hogar y las comparte junto con su negocio. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: gaseosas de todos los precios y tamaños, hielo, gelatina. Kathy con las ganancias obtenidas esta pensando en poner una fuente de soda para así poder vender mas productos y así generar mas ingresos para su familia

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Abdul Magid

texts.en: This is Abdul Magid, who is married with two children and lives in district 14 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a retail shop and he is the one to support his family with this small business. He hopes to increase his income and be able to send his two children to a better school. He wants to take out an individual loan to buy more merchandise and enlarge his shop to attract more clients and make a good income for his family. He is happy about this loan.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Saipocho

texts.ru:
Saipocho M. lives in the Rudaki region. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband does not have a job, but Saipocho has a store next to her home where she sells food products. She has been in this business for 10 years. This business helps her to feed her family. Saipocho would like to take out a loan to update her inventory. She will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Махадбекова Сайпочо проживает в районе Рудаки. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж нигде не работает , но он имеет магазин рядом со своим домом. Торгует продуктами питания . Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Этот бизнес и помогает ей прокормить семью. Хочет обновить ассортимент путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: I Made

texts.id:
I Made S. has a motorcycle repair shop in Denpasar. His shop provides services such as motorcycle maintenance works, oil changes, replacing the tires etc. His average earning is IDR 850 thousand per week (approximately of USD 105/ week).

He sets aside a part of his proceed for expansion of his shop. He uses the rest of the proceed for his family and to pay school fees for his kid who is in Junior High School. The school fees is IDR 100 thousand/ month (around USD 12/ month).

He hopes to get the loan money to enable him to expand his motorcycle repair shop.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang dijalani I Made S. adalah membuka bengkel sepeda motor. Bengkelnya melayani servis kendaraan bermotor seperti ganti oli, ganti ban dan juga menjual bensin eceran. Rata-rata penghasilan per minggunya mencapai 850.000. Dengan harus membiayai sekolah anaknya yang saat ini duduk dibangku SMP sebesar 100.000 perbulan, dia harus bisa menabung dari usahanya. Selain itu dia juga harus menyisihkan untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari. Made sangat berharap dia diberi pinjaman utnuk mengembangkan usaha bengkelnya. Saat ini, bersama istrinya, Kadek Dahlia mereka tinggal dirumah sendiri di Denpasar.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa is a member of the Bonanza Communal Bank. Rosa is a single mother, is 26 years old and has one son who is 2 years old. Rosa lives with her mother and son in the Mollepata neighborhood, which is located 20 minutes from the center of the city of Ayacucho and still does not have basic services. Rosa has a variety store in which she sells groceries, vegetables and meat. Rosa goes to the supply market every day where she makes her purchases. She has her mother’s support and the store is open every day of the week from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m.

Rosa needs a loan of 1650 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and drinks.

Rosa dreams of having another piece of land on which to build a house made of sturdy materials, diversifying her business and providing a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.

Rosa es madre soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo de 2 años, Rosa vive junto a su mama e hijo en el barrio de Mollepata que se ubica a 20 minutos del centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, lugar que no cuenta aun con los servicios básicos. Rosa tiene una tienda surtida en donde vende abarrote, verduras, carne, Rosa cada dos días va al mercado de abastos a realizar sus compras, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su mama, la atención en su tienda es todos los días de la semana y de las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1650 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, bebidas.

Rosa sueña con tener otro terreno y construir una casa de material noble, surtir su negocio, brindar una buena educación a su hijo.

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1650 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, and drinks.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia esta casada su esposo es empleado den una empresa y tienen un niño pequeño de 8 años, cuando el niño empezó a crecer ella veía que también los gastos aumentaban, y decidió empezar a elaborar y vender meriendas para piñatas, despedidas y baby shower, y así siguió desde hace 7 años que empezó con su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para invertirlo en materia prima. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Leticia is married. Her husband is employed in a business, and they have one 8 year old boy. When the child began to grow, she saw that the household expenses also grew, and she decided to begin to make and sell picnic lunches for Christmas parties, farewell parties and baby showers. She has continued this activity for 7 years since she began with her business. She needs a loan of US $300 that she would repay in 4 months in order to invest in primary ingredients. With your help she will continue improving her life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan S. is a villager in Chong Ankor Village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land to till to earn her living. In this plantation, she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile so she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve her field to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Loeng Sam Ang, is a fisherman who can catch a few fish to sell for an income to supplement the earnings for the household.

Mrs. Chan S. is 40 years old and the mother of six children, four of whom are attending the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are two and four years old. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to make her crops more productive

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Mrs. Kalpana P. lives in Kritpur, Kathmandu. She lives with her husband, Mr. Prem Kumar P., her two daughters, and son. Her husband is a carpenter, and her children are in higher secondary school.

Mrs. P. opened a grocery shop 10 years ago to improve her family's standard of living. She sells different types of groceries such as rice, maize, snacks and green vegetables.

Due to a lack of funds, she can’t buy goods for her shop. Mrs. P. is asking for a loan of Rs 20000.00 ($275.00) to buy goods like rice, dhal, and noodles. She wants to use her income to provide a better education for her children and to help her husband improve the quality of their lives.

loans.use: Buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Loun

texts.en:
Loun N., 39, is married and lives with her husband and two of her four children in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Since 2001, she has been selling fruit in the market to earn a living and is able to make $4 a day.  Her husband is a taxi driver, earning around $2.5 a day to help support the family members. This couple also is supported by one child who works selling fruit with her mother. 

Loun N. would like to take out a loan of $700 to breed pigs for extra profit. This will allow her family to improve their standard of living. (Her husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To breed pigs.

loans.name: Solidarité Group

texts.en:
Irma, one of the members of this loan group, sells lamp oil, soft drinks, doughnuts, and omelette. She makes about US$ 70 in profit per week. She began working in business with her mother in 1988 when she was 11 years old. She used to sell beside her mother until she began her own business with a capital of US$ 5 in 1992.

Irma began purchasing and re-selling about 10 kilograms of corn. Over the years, her business sometimes stopped because of her studies, but she did not close completely. In April 2008, Irma decided to join Solidarité Community Bank, one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo Microfinance Program), and she has received three loans. Through the funds received from Hope’s loans, Irma’s business began to expand and she was able to stabilize her merchandise.

With the new loan, Irma will purchase an ice chest, 2 cartons of eggs, and a crate of soft drinks to expand her product offerings to her customers. Irma believes that she will increase her profit by selling these new products. She is 32 years old, single, and has a 3-year-old boy. She lives with her parents. Irma’s dream is to open a fresh food store.

loans.use: To purchase an ice chest, cartons of eggs, and crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mrs. Vong Chouy is a villager in the Toul Kandal Choerng Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Horn Sinan, is a construction worker. He has a problem because he does not have enough money to buy construction supplies to support his work. Thus, Mrs. Vong Chouy decided to ask for a loan to buy those supplies for her husband's career. She is 29 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to support her husband's career

loans.name: Rak

texts.en: Mrs. Rak C. is a villager in Bort Tonle village in Kampong Cham province. She sells fruit and palm sugar. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates yams. She faces a problem because she does not have enough money to cultivate yams on the field. Thus, Mrs. Rak C. decided to ask for a loan to grow yams to earn income. She is a 35-year-old widow with two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: to grow yams to earn income

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Ходжиев Исматулло житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 43 года , женат и имеет пятерых детей. Образование среднее. Единственный источник дохода его семьи является животноводство. Он покупает молодых бычков для откормки , а затем продает по более выгодной цене. Этот бизнес наиболее распрастраннен среди сельской местности. Поэтому его действия могут внести лепту в развитие животноводства. Сейчас он планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев, с целью увеличит поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Ismatullo H. lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region. He is 43 years old, married and has five children. He has secondary education. Animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. He buys young calves for growth, and then resells them at a more profitable price. This business is very common among the villagers. By doing his business Ismatullo can contribute into the development of animal husbandry. At this time he wants to get a loan for 12 months term to increase headcount of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase headcount of cattle

loans.name: Bat-Orshih

texts.en: Bat-Orshih D. has a family of five and lives in Arhanghai, one of the central provinces of Mongolia. His oldest daughter is a high school teacher and lives away from her parents. His second-oldest daughter is a college student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently, Bat-Orshih lives with his wife and his youngest daughter, who is a local high school student. Bat-Orshih started a small carpentry business in 1990, with just 40,000 MNT of capital ($1 USD=1,500 MNT). He makes wooden furniture, such as chairs, beds, and tables. His clients are mostly from the town where he lives. As the business expands, he would like to acquire more clients from neighboring towns in the province. In the future, he hopes to continue to be able to afford his daughters' college tuition. He requests a loan to purchase more wood for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for his carpentry business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys D. is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children: three sons and four daughters. She says three of her children are currently in the primary school. The others are out of school and working. Gladys lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband works with the railway corporation in the community. She works to support her husband financially.

Gladys is a trader. She trades in textile fabrics and school uniforms. She sells at the local market and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She also trades in bags. Gladys buys the materials from wholesalers in Accra. She has been in business for more than 22 years now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy textile materials and underwear

loans.name: Jou-Ann

texts.en:
"I married so early. I was just 21 and already have a child. Now, I realize that life is really not easy. I should have gone to school and pursued my studies," says Jou-Ann B., a farmer from Agusan Del Sur from Mindanao. "Now, my only treasure aside from my family is my farm. My husband is the one managing it. Working very hard to increase our harvest", she added.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and seeds. The loan will help a lot to increase their income.

CEVI provides a lot of opportunities for people to start up and run their own business. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicide, and seeds

loans.name: Saima Muhammad Raza Group

texts.en:
Salma baji and Waziran baji each want a loan to buy materials (colored thread, beads and clothes) for their decorative embroidery business.

Saima baji is a wife of M. R.. They have been citizens of a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines. Saima baji is a very efficient and a hardworking lady. She manages all the household works efficiently. She takes care of the needs of her family. Her husband is a driver and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), but he couldn't get the whole amount for his struggle. Saima baji is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing yams

loans.name: You Thinking Group

texts.en:
Abie J. is a mother of 3 children whose ages range between 7 – 15 years. She resides in the Outland community in Browerville and sells variety of goods on a table (fresh milk, rice, oil, sardines, etc.). 

She says, “The business is profitable and does well during the rainy season despite it being slow. I am successful because of the way I talk to my customers and the management of the business. I am also dreaming of having a very big business in the future.” She desires to train her children to become good leaders for tomorrow.

loans.use: To buy goods for resale

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a young man aged 33 years old and married with three children aged 8, 6 and 3 years old. He has a problem with his leg.

Amjad appears in the photo at his store. He started his business from personal savings a year and a half ago. His business is growing since it is based in a busy location near Ramallah hospital.

loans.use: To purchase new products for his shop

loans.name: Gwen Rowena

texts.en:
Gwen S. is a 21-year-old woman living in the town of Taufusi S. She is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Gwen owns and operates a handicraft business. She sells traditional handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Gwen has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities. In 2008, Gwen joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This will be Gwen's second loan from SPBD. She successfully repaid a loan of 750 WST that she used to invest in her business. Gwen will use this loan of 1500 WST to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. About SPBD
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme âgée de 32 ans et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend des perles, de l’encens et divers autres articles. Elle aimerait avec ce prêt renforcer son capital afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle participe aux charges familiales dans le but d’améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 32-year-old woman and the mother of four children. She sells pearls, incense, and various other items. She would like to use this loan to bolster her capital in order to satisfy her customers better. She helps cover family expenses with the goal of improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in pearls, incenses, and other products

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen M. D.
texts.en: Carmen M. D.

loans.use: To stock her store.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is a rice farmer from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is 43 years old, married and has two children. Her eldest is now 25 years old. The 1-hectare rice field she owns supports her family. Julieta needs financing for her farm. She requested to loan 15,000 PHP from CEVI. The loan will be used to purchase farm supplies and other materials that she needs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret C. owns and operates a beauty salon and sells wigs weave on mesh and other her products as well at Elmina near Atabadze.  Margaret has received junior high school education.  She is divorced and has three children. Margaret has been selling wigs , weave on mesh and so on since 1999. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more wigs, mesh and other products for use at her saloon. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more wigs, mesh and other products for use at her saloon.

loans.name: Genesis Estefany

texts.es:
Génesis tiene 18 años de edad, tiene 6 meses de gestación y vive junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Maneja junto a su madre un negocio de venta y distribución de productos avícolas y embutidos en el mercado de la ciudad. Su madre empezó en el negocio hace seis años pero enfermó repentinamente y debe ser operada en la ciudad de Lima. Entonces se vió en la necesidad de empezar a administrar el establecimiento desde hace seis meses y durante este tiempo ha trabajado por mantenerlo.

Ella recibe temprano la carne de pollo y la distribuye en pequeñas tiendas de la periferia de su ciudad, luego vuelve a su establecimiento y empieza a ofrecer su mercancía al por menor a sus clientes habituales. Genesis nos cuenta que en esta temporada la demanda de los clientes se ha incrementado por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para ampliar su negocio.

Ella desea seguir creciendo como empresaria y además estudiar una carrera técnica para asegurarle a su hijo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Genesis is 18 years old, is 6 months pregnant and lives together with her parents in the city of Lambayeque, located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. With her mother she manages a business for selling and distribution of poultry and sausage in the city market. Her mother started the business 6 years ago but fell ill suddenly and so the business must be operated out of the city of Lima. Genesis saw the need to start administering the business for the last 6 months and during this time has worked to keep it going. She receives the chicken meat early and distributes it to small stores in the outskirts of the city. Then she returns to the business office and begins to offer her merchandise at retail to her regular customers. Genesis tells us that this season the demand from her customers has grown and so for the first time she is asking for a loan of 800 PNS from Edpyme Alternativa to grow her business. She wants to continue growing as an entrepreneur and also to study a technical career to ensure a better future for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chicken meat to grow the business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: 53-year-old Lucia A. lives in Canonoy, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Her husband originally earned a living from making wine from coconut sap (tuba) which they sold to people around the neighborhood. The couple is blessed with four adult children who are now between 28 and 34 years old, some of whom are gainfully employed and are therefore helping in the support of their family. Lucia hopes that she can continue improving their family's lifestyle through their family's collective hard work. As a wife, Lucia always had a realistic view of their family's situation. She very well knew that the income her husband earned as a tuba maker was just not enough to cover all of their expenses and the increasing need for finances. Because they lived near the sea, Lucia decided that, if she had some capital, she'd engage in the buying and selling of fish to her neighbors and to people in the surrounding villages. To get the necessary access to new capital, Lucia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, and this enabled them to rent a fishing boat that one of her sons used for fishing, while she continued with her fish-vending venture. With the additional income they were able to buy their own motorized fishing boat soon after. This has enabled them to earn an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Her Credit Record: Lucia’s previous loan of Php 12,000 was utilized as additional capital for her fish-vending business. The loan was fully repaid on time and within the designated loan term without any delays. Now, her 13th loan of Php 14,000 will be used to buy an engine for her fishing boat and to make a few repairs and maintenance work on it. The income from it will be used for the improvement of the family’s living conditions. In the accompanying photo, Lucia is shown with the motorized fishing boat that her son just finished painting. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a boat engine and to repair the fishing boat

loans.name: Marco Vinicio

texts.es: Marco Vinicio Z. H.  de 36 años de edad, vive en Sonsonate, junto a su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos. Marco posee una venta de celulares y accesorios para estos, así mismo vende recargas de saldo y repara celulares. El solícita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar nuevos modelos de celulares y accesorios para estos. Para marco el crecimiento de su negocio es de mucha importancia, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee, es por ellos que solicita un préstamo con la esperanza de poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marco Vinicio Z. H. is 36 years old and lives in Sonsonate with his wife and two small children. He manages a vending post where he sells cellular phones and accessories. In addition, he sells phone chargers and provides phone repair services. He is requesting a loan in order to buy new phone models and related accessories. Growing his business is important to Marco since this is his only source of income. Therefore, he hopes this loan will help improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cellular phones & accessories

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.en:
The loan for this committee will be used to purchase clothing and lingerie for subsequent resale; to buy milk, herbs, sugar, oil, flour - all ingredients for pastries; meat, chicken, cassava, fruits - all in bulk for subsequent resale or for cooking; and selling baked goods and ready prepared food.

The committee Divino Niño Jesús was founded when women from a committee in their neighborhood told their friends about the Female Entrepreneurship program. Edith B. sells groceries. M. Librada sells groceries. Dominga G. sells groceries. Gladys R. sells clothing. Digna F. sells fruits and vegetables. Lorenza O. sells roasted chicken. Bernarda D. sells ice cream. Brigida M. sells groceries. Leticia C. sells furniture. Angela M. makes and sells fruit salads. Gladys B. sells groceries. Juana B. makes and sells fruit salads. M. Heriberta sells groceries. Patricia V. sells groceries. Luz O. sells fruit. Carmen V. sells haberdashery. Julia A. sells groceries. Teresita V. sells groceries. Lucia Nuñez sells lingerie. Isabel F. sells groceries.

loans.use: Merchandise and foodstuffs

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle T. is 25 years old. She has two children. Her eldest is only four years old. 

Michelle learned to farm from her parents. She has a farm and she makes sure that her crops are healthy and well taken cared of. She said that if she only had resources she would buy more farms to plant more rice. Now, she just focuses on what she has at present. 

Michelle would like to request a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her harvest and income as well.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
el señor Jose Danilo E. tiene 28 años de edad, vive en union libre y no tiene hijos. su señora se dedica a vender pescado en la casa. Jose transporta el marisco que compra en cedeño a pespire y otros lugares. su meta es poder comprar el marisco y venderlo en Tegucigalpa por encargos, para ello necesita mas capital de trabajo para comprar mas producto y algunos repuestos para el carro para que no tenga problemas al hacer el viaje. 
tiene una hielera grande para poder meter una buena cantidad de mariscos.
 
Jose desea que todo le salga bien en su negocio. tiene mucha fe de que todo sera muy bueno para el y para su compañera de hogar.
estan planeando tener un hijo.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose Danilo E. is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and does not have any children. His wife sells fish from their house. Jose transports the seafood that he purchases in Cedeño, Pespire, and other places. His goal is to buy seafood and sell it upon order in Tegucigalpa. In order to do this, he needs more operating capital to buy additional inventory and some spare parts for his vehicle because he does not want to encounter problems when traveling. He has a large cooler for carrying large amounts of seafood.

Jose wants everything to go well for his business. He has much faith that all will be well for him and his wife. They are planning to have a child.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shrimp, fish, and parts for his pickup truck

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa F. est une femme de 70 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle fait du commerce de fruits de saison (des oranges et mandarines) depuis plus de 4 ans. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne
texts.en:
Awa F., 70, is married and the mother of 4 children whom she is still supporting. She has been selling seasonal fruit (oranges and mandarins) for more than 4 years. Her goal is to help support the family and add to her savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintain her little business

loans.name: Wendy Lizet

texts.es: La Sra. Wendy es un cliente nueva que vive en la calle 27 de Cota Cota y tiene un negocio de venta de licores en la calle Sucre en el centro de la ciudad la señorita trabajo desde muy pequeña en el negocio de su mama que tiene una tienda en su mismo domicilio, hace un año su tia la Sra, Dina le dio a conocer una oportunidad de negocio por su zona ya que exactamente al frente de la licoreria existe una salon de eventos, ademas de  tres cuatro night clubs y ningun proveedor cerca, desde ese dia hasta la fecha Wendy atiende esta licoreria, ahora necesita un monto mas grande para comprar mas whisky y helados para tener un freezer y guardar hielos. En el presente año la señorita esta en tratativas para adquirir un local un poco mas grande en la esquina de la misma cuadra, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Wendy is a new client. She lives on the 27th of Cota Cota Street and she has a liquor store on Sucre Street in the center of the city. She has been working since she was very young, first in her mother's business which is a store in her mother's home. A year ago, her Aunt Dina told her about a business opportunity in her neighborhood. Right across from where the liquor store is located there is an event space and three or four nightclubs but at the time there was no place selling liquor. Since that day until now, Wendy has had her liquor store. Now she needs more capital in order to buy whiskey and a freezer where she can store ice. This year Wendy is in negotiations to move to a bigger space on the corner of the same block She is a responsible and hard-working person and she is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for having the confidence in her to offer her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy whiskey and a freezer

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence G. is 48 years old and is a rice farmer. He has four children and his income is being utilized to supply all their needs and to pay school fees. He told CEVI that, aside from farming, he also raises pigs to supplement the family income. His dream for his children is for them to graduate in their studies so that they land good employment when they are older.

Laurence would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve his harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 67-year-old widowed woman who supports her family by running a general store and a cafeteria, and through pig fattening. She lives in Prk Ipil-Ipil Brgy Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental, with her 8 children who are between 36 and 51 years old and all have their own families.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since May 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, cafeteria, and pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000.

Gloria is now borrowing Php 19,500 so that she can continue sustaining operations of her general store, cafeteria and pig fattening businesses. This will be her 19th loan cycle with NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gloria aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Solidarias es uno de los tantos bancos comunales formados en la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad de Chican en el  cantón Paute en la región centro sur del país, este cantón es reconocido por la presencia de la Hidroeléctrica Paute la más grande del país y  por su producción artesanal.

María del Carmen  tiene  veinte y tres años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión concibió dos  hijos quienes se encuentran de cinco  años y estudia en primer año de educación básica, el otro tiene apenas dos meses de nacido,  su esposo trabaja en la elaboración de estucos (cielos rasos), no tienen casa propia  por lo que viven en casa de su madre. Ella se dedica a la cría de animales como borregos, pollos, ganado que los vende en su comunidad, también compra hortalizas para revender en el mercado de Paute, tiene un puesto propio y vende solo los días domingos, esta actividad lo realiza desde sus trece años de edad.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en la Fundación Espoir,  los préstamos  le han beneficiado para el crecimiento de su negocio, ingreso al bankito gracias a su mamá quien la invito, con el nuevo crédito va a comprar crías de pollos, alimento y vitaminas  y  algunas  verduras como zanahoria, remolacha, rábano, acelga, etc.

 Su meta es llegar a construir su casa propia.

La señora  Berta V.  tiene cincuenta y seis  años de edad,  separada de su  cónyuge hace cuatro  años porque la maltrataba mucho y le ocasionaba muchos sufrimientos, en su unión conyugal procreo cuatro  hijos que se encuentran de 33, 30, 26, 22, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, el segundo se encuentra fuera del país, por lo que vive con su tercera hija que es madre soltera y con su último hijo de 22 años. Nos comenta que  se siente muy orgullosa de tener su casa propia esfuerzo de toda su vida.

 Es socia del Banco Comunal  Mujeres Solidarias hace un año y el credito obtenido lo invirtió en su negocio de pollos  ya que ella se dedica a la cría y venta de borregos, pollos y cuyes que luego son vendidos en su comunidad cuando tiene algún apuro económico, con el nuevo crédito va a adquirir más  crías de pollos, alimento y vitaminas  para así seguir con su negocio, su meta es de llegar a terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Mujeres Solidarias (Solidarity Women or Supportive Women) is one of many community banks formed in the city of Cuenca, in the neighborhood of Chican, in the canton of Paute, in the south central region of the country. This canton is known because of the Paute Hydroelectric Power Plant which is the biggest in the country, and also because of their handicrafts production. Maria del Carmen is 23 years old and married; from the fruit of her union she conceived two children; one child is 5 years old and is in first grade; the other child is just two months old; her husband does stucco work (ceilings). They do not own a house and they live with her mother. She raises animals such us sheep, chickens and cattle which she sells in her neighborhood; she also buys vegetables to resell in the market of Paute; she has her own stall and only sells on Sundays; she has been doing this since she was 13 years old. This is her third loan from Fundación Espoir; the loans have benefited her to grow her business and to join the “bankito” (little bank), thanks to an invitation from her Mother. With the new loan, she will buy chicks to grow, feed, vitamins and some vegetables such as carrots, beets, radishes, chard, etc. Her goal is to build her own house. Mrs. Berta V. is 56 years old and she is has been separated from her spouse for four years because he mistreated her and caused her much suffering. In her marriage, she conceived four children of ages 33, 30, 26, and 22. Her first son is married and lives independently; the second one is out of the country so she lives with the third child, her daughter (who is single), and the youngest child who is 22. She shared with us that she is very proud to her own house from her life-long hard work. Mrs. Berta has been a member of the community bank Mujeres Solidarias for one year; the loan she received was invested in her chicken business; she grows and sells sheep, chickens and guinea pigs; she sells the animals in her community when she needs money. With the new loan, she will buy more chicks to grow, feed, and vitamins to continue her business; her goal is to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicks to grow, feed, vitamins, and vegetables for her stall at the market

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
Bassem is a 42-year-old man who resides in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Bassem has a fruit and vegetable shop. He has been in this business for 10 years and has been able to attract many customers who buy fruits or vegetables in his neighborhood since he sells good quality products. 

He is requesting a loan for the second time from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, so that he can buy fruits and vegetables. This will help him become more competitive in the market. His previous loan allowed him to purchase merchandise and provide the best to his clients. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his work by purchasing and offering the best produce and also purchasing more exotic fruits and vegetables depending on the season.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mario Octavio

texts.es: El Sr. Mario, tiene 30 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus papas, se encuentra casado con doña Sarait que tiene como actividad una tienda de ropa y calzados, con quien tiene dos hijos, son un apareja muy unida siempre colaborandose en el trabajo y en la familia, El Sr. Mario tiene como actividad principal ser chofer propietario de una camioneta de carga y como actividad secundaria una tienda de barrio, el crédito solicitado es para la compra de mercaderia para la tienda de la esposa, pues tiene una oferta de compra de calzados por cajas, es muy trabajador siempre velando el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianz a brindada en la otorgacion dle credito.
texts.en:
Mario is 30 years old and lives in his parents' house. He is married to Sarait, who runs a store that sells clothing and shoes. They have two children together and they are a very tight pair, always working together both in their work and with their family. Mario's main job is as the owner and driver of a cargo truck. His second job is running a neighborhood store. Mario is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for his wife's store, as they have an offer to buy boxes of shoes. He is a very hard worker and is always watching out for his family's well-being. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they show in granting him this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Percy Fredy

texts.es: Percy tiene 28 años de edad, el es soltero vieve en la casa de sus padres quienes son separados. El se dedica al alquiler de su vehiculo, cuenta con un automovil tico , lo adquirio  con capital propio, el se inicio como comerciante de la compara y venta de frutas, actualmente realiza esa actividad solo por temporada de cosecha de uva o mango. El es un joven con muchos sueños uno de ellos es poder tener mas vehiculo. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en la conversion de gas a su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Percy is 28 years old, single, and lives in the home of his parents, who are separated. He has a business renting his vehicle. He has a Daewoo Tico automobile, which he acquired with his own capital. He started out as a fruit merchant; he now carries out this activity only during the harvest season for grapes and mangoes. He is a youth who has many dreams; one of these is to be able to have another vehicle. With the money he requests he will invest in converting his vehicle so that it can run on natural gas.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to convert his vehicle to natural gas

loans.name: Nueva Integracion Group

texts.es:
Miryam es la socia entusiasta, responsable y alegre que representa la Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Integración” ella se dedica  a la comercialización de vinos, que además lo reparte a pedidos, lo trae desde la ciudad de  Ica, al sur de Lima, Luz es otra de nuestras socias que trabaja como profesora en un colegio, hace varios años, ella desea aperturar una librería en casa que le permita mejorar sus ingresos.

Benny tiene una tienda en casa donde lo aperturo con mucho esfuerzo ella vende diversos productos de librería y ropa esto le permite aportar con los gastos en casa. Gracias a los préstamos los socios pueden invertir en diferentes negocios que les permitan contribuir con los gastos y la manutención de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miryam is the enthusiastic, responsible and happy member who represents the Nueva Integración Communal Bank. She works selling wines, which she also distributes on order. She brings the wines from the city of Ica, south of Lima. Luz is another of our members who has worked for several years as a teacher in a high school. She wants to open a bookstore in her house, which would help her increase her income. Benny has a store in her home which she opened with great effort. She sells several bookstore-type products and clothing. This allows her to contribute toward household expenses. Thanks to the loans, the members can invest in different businesses which permit them to contribute to household expenses and support their children.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and supplies

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en: Mrs. Loeng N. is 60 years old and is a villager who lives in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Yong Sam, are farmers who own a 3.80 hectare piece of land to cultivate rice. They are able to earn a small income, in this way, to support the family's costs of living. For this farm, Mrs. Loeng N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming crop. Aside from farming, Mrs. Loeng N. is a Khmer cake seller in the local market while her husband is a fisherman. This couple has a child, who is a farmer. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

loans.name: Bukasa Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Making the best out of the incessant bad bargains that come with plying a cutthroat business is what 45-year-old Edward S. can speak authoritatively on. In his 14 year checkered history overseeing his brick-laying and sand-quarry businesses, he has been brought to terms with the requisite virtues that are needed to make successful headway in firmly establishing a business niche. 

A lot of sacrifices have to be made to get that leeway, especially when one is an upstart businessperson. An unwavering sense of purpose, hard work and determination are vital means to achieving one’s ends in any business, according to this affable and buoyant gentleman. He also points out that a belief in one’s abilities is paramount.

The vestiges of his first business experience can be traced to his erstwhile diary and still existing retail enterprise. These two businesses were both gotten off their feet with a lot of persuasion from friends. 

In Bukasa, his sand and brick products are in high demand. This he attributes to the good rapport he has created with his customers. These customers return the favor by bringing in other customers. He says it is mostly middle-class people constructing family homes who are his clients. 

The happily married father of four says he has made profitable use of his businesses. In a month, his balance sheet profits add to 400,000 shillings. He also still ekes out side profits from his retail shop. Educating all his children to higher institutions of learning is his highest priority for now and the future. With this loan, he is upbeat that he will be in a much stronger financial position to buy more firewood that he requires to bake his bricks.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for baking his bricks

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma T. is a 51-year old widow who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a lumber yard and a cassava plantation. She lives in, Brgy. Poblacion, Madredijos, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her lumber yard and plantation, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP30,000. 

Wilma is now borrowing PHP 29,500 to use as additional working capital. This will be her 22nd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Wilma  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additonal capital

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El socio vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

El  socio es el Sr. Reynaldo; el socio tiene 43 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, el socio es fundador del banco comunal, él trabaja con los préstamos que le otorga el banco y de este modo el socio pudo crecer en su negocio; el socio se dedica a la venta de golosinas,  y también es chofer de moto taxi. El socio solicita el préstamo para poder hacer el mantenimiento de su moto taxi que ya necesita cambiarle de repuestos.
 
El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Reynaldo, 43, is a member of the “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA” communal bank. He lives in Urubamba province, Cusco department. He lives with his spouse and they have two children. He is a founding member of the communal bank. He uses the loans from the bank to help his business grow. He sells sweets and is also a mototaxi (three wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) driver. He is asking for a loan for vehicle maintenance and repair because the mototaxi is due for service. He values and is grateful for the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Ana Belly

texts.en:
Ana Belly S. is a married woman who lives in Bgry. Tuguis, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a small planters business. Her husband Rolando S., who is 57 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living , and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 6 children who are 10 to  23 years old. 

Ana Belly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ana Belly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of  10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of  4000 PHP,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing 13,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the education of children. Ana Belly S. is a "Dungganon" woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Koy K. is 57 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Takeo province. Since 1995, she has been making and selling brooms at the local market to earn approximately $3 of profit a day, while her husband (pictured here) works in construction. On average, he makes $4 per day. This couple is also supported by two children who are garment-factory workers. 

Koy K. is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase wood and other material to build a new wooden house. Since the old house is too old, not reliable and leaking during the rainy season, Koy K. asks for the loan to build a new house.

loans.use: To finish her construction

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C., 59, is a member of Ahon sa HIrap, Inc.(ASHI) – a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines. She joined the institution in 2004 and has been active in all ASHI activities. Despite the difficulties of balancing her duties and responsibilities as both a mother and a member of ASHI, she is diligent in meeting all obligations.

Teresita's previous loans enabled her to start a variety store, the income from which helped support the schooling of her only child, who graduated from college and is now working in a call center. Her financial independence from her husband's income has bolstered her confidence, and her business goal is to begin a grocery goal in the future to generate more profit and provide employment among her neighbors or relatives.

Teresita is applying for a new loan of Php 45,000.00 pesos to increase her stock of grocery products. She will buy more sacks of rice and sugar, flour, canned goods, beverages, soaps, eggs, assorted kitchen ingredients, candies, snack foods, coffee, assorted brands of cigarettes, etc. She will start saving from the proceeds of this additional capital to prepare for the renovation of her store. She hopes and prays that KIVA lenders will support her in reaching her dreams and goals in life.

loans.use: Additional grocery products for her variety store

loans.name: Elsa Esperanza

texts.es:
Elsa Esperanza S. Cálix es una comerciante de 40 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijas de 11 y 16 años de edad, y junto a su ellas reside en el Barrio Guanaste en la municipio de San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho. 
Desde hace seis años doña Elsa se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general, su horario de atención es de 6:00 am a 7:00 pm y mientras ella cuida su negocio sus dos hijas se van a sus centros escolares.  La ventaja de tener su propio negocio es que le ha permitido tener un ingreso económico con el cual ha podido sostener a su pequeña familia y eso es importante para ella porque no tiene la ayuda del padre de sus hijas, también puede realizar los quehaceres del hogar y ayudar a sus hijas a realizar sus tareas. 
Elsa solicita el préstamo porque está realizando unas mejoras en su casa y necesita comprar materiales de construcción para repellar las paredes y echar el piso. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera que su hogar tenga un aspecto más atractivo para sus clientes y que sus hijas se sientan más cómodas. Su meta es trabajar y esforzarse cada día para que sus hijas puedan llegar a la universidad y se hagan profesionales, ya que ella no lo pudo hacer. Es su quinto año en FAMA  y con los financiamientos obtenidos ha podido ir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 40 year old trader who is a single mother of two daughters, aged 11 and 16. They live together in Barrio Guanaste in the municipality of San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho.
For the past 6 years, Elsa has been selling general groceries, and her work hours are 6:00am to 7:00pm. While she runs her business, her two daughters go to school.
