The advantage of having her own business is that it enables her to have an income to support her small family, which is important because they do not get any help from the father of her daughters. She also does the housework and helps her daughters with their homework.
Elsa is requesting a loan because she has been making some improvements to her house and she needs to buy construction materials to plaster the walls and lay a floor. With the help of the loan, she hopes to make her house more attractive for her customers and more comfortable for her daughters. Her goal is to work and strive every day so that her daughters can go to the university and become professionals, something that was not possible for her. This is her 5th year with FAMA and the loans she has had have enabled he to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Oyuntungalag

texts.en:
Oyuntungalag G. is 48 years old and lives with her daughter in their own apartment in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. She has two children; her daughter attends university while her son lives on his own by working as a private businessman. 

Oyuntungalag operates a consumer goods sales business at a stand at the local market in Bayanzurh district. She has been engaged this business since 2005 and has built up a stable operation. Over the years of operation, she has gained much experience as a retail trader. She hopes to continue to grow her business in the future. She needs more funds to increase her working capital therefore she is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to expand her product line.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra N., age 16, has been a charcoal vendor for three years. She lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is unmarried and has no children.       
  
To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Barbra hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  

In the future, Barbra hopes to become a pharmacist. Barbra is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to play such cooperative games as netball.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna B. is a married woman who lives in Locatha in the village (barangay) of Lo-oc in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband, Fernando B., who is 62 years old, works as a mechanic to earn his living. They have 7 children between 23 to 40 years old. Three of her children have their own families and the other four have stable work and help her. 

Paterna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Paterna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20000 which improved the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17000, which she intends to use to buy more product to sell so that she can continue to save for the future. Paterna B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "dungganon," a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su familia en el sector Saltur, una zona rural del distrito de Zaña, sus pobladores trabajan principalmente en actividades agrícolas, se encuentra ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo ella siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez más clientes.

María desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y ampliar su stock fijo de cosméticos que tiene en su vivienda, esto le permite a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente sin tener que esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.
texts.en:
María Elena, 51, is married and has three children.  She lives with her family in the Saltur sector, a rural zone in Zaña district.  Its residents are mostly farmers and it’s located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells beauty products and cosmetics by catalogue.  She has a group of regular customers that buy her products frequently.  The more orders she gets the more points she earns from the firm that supplies the products thus greater profits.  This is why she always strives to increase the number of her customers.

María wants to have stable capital to acquire more products and expand the fixed stock of cosmetics she has at home.  This allows her customers to get the products they need quickly without having to wait until the end of the month which is when her orders are delivered.  To reach this objective, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan that will help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To increase her fixed stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 64 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de cerveza, ella tiene una tienda que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cerveza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cerveza al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the José Carlos Mariategui community bank which is located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Rosa is 64 years old, married and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling beer.  She has a store where she serves from 8.00am to 11.00pm.  Through her business, she manages to get her child ahead in life.

Rosa would like to expand and improve her beer sales business.  She is requesting this loan to buy beer wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy beer wholesale

loans.name: Wattuba Aids Group-Kampala

texts.en: S. Umaruh, 38 years old, belongs to the Wattuba Aids group, Kampala. He has been operating his general store in Kiti B Trading Center for 4 years. He says he began this business immediately after he finished constructing a commercial plaza in Kiti. Prior to this, he was mostly into coffee selling and real estate. Umaruh, a happily married father of 5, says this business generates him 70,000 UGX weekly. He also has a side business of commercial motorcycle transportation. With this loan, Umaruh is going to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, soap and soft drinks to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more items to resell

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia was born in 1972. She has five children. The youngest is four months old and the eldest is 18 years old. Rukia sells goats and she is requesting a loan to buy more goats. She plans to pay her children’s school fees with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To Buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Nob Sopheap Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people make up this village bank loan. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. They are located in Ta Muong village in Takeo province. All the members have selected Mrs. Nob S. to be a village bank president. 

Mrs. Nob S. and her husband, Mr. Som Somret, are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. At present her house is not comfortable to live in because it has no electricity. Mrs. Nob S. is, therefore,  requesting a loan to access electricity. She would like to use the rest of the loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. She is the mother of three children: one is a construction worker, one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other is a student.

loans.use: To access electricity to use

loans.name: Trebol De La Suerte Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama el "Trébol de la suerte" y esta ubicado en el estado de Morelos, en México. Esta comunidad se distingue por su tradicional carnaval del chinelo que se celebra cada año en semana santa. El grupo esta conformado por nueve  integrantes y es la tercera vez que solicitan un prestamo. Maely G. A. es integrante del grupo se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, negocio que inicio hace un año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar tomate, calabacitas, papa, jitomate etc. Ella tiene 21 año, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria, es casada y tiene una hija de 4 años de edad. Sus clientes se sienten contentas  porque siempre encuentran lo que necesitan  para cocinar. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta por que podrá tener una mayor variedad de verduras en  su negocio. Ella espera  que con sus ganancias pueda  poner su  propio local, ya que el que tiene es de su cuñada y con lo que ahorre de la renta lo utilizara para la escuela de su hija ya que el próximo año estará en preescolar. Observaciones, la persona que no se ve bien se llama Clara M..
texts.en:
This group is named the “Trébol de la suerte” (The Lucky Clover) and is located in the state of Morelos in Mexico.  This community is known for their traditional Carnaval del Chinelo (a traditional dance) that is celebrated every year during Semana Santa (a week of celebrations in April).

The group is made up of nine members and this is the third time that they have requested a loan.  Maely G. A. is a member of the group who works selling fruits and vegetables in a business she started over a year ago.  She is requesting the loan to buy tomatillos, squash, potatoes, tomatoes, etc.  She is 21-years-old, studied through the sixth year of primary school, is married, and has a 4-year-old daughter.  Her customers are please because they always find what they need to cook.  She feels happy requesting this loan because she will be able to have a greater variety of vegetables in her business.  She hopes that with her earnings she will be able to get her own stall as the one that she has now is her sister-in-law’s space and with what she would save in rent she would use it for her daughter’s schooling as next year she will be in preschool.  

Note: the person who is hard to see in the photo is Clara M..

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La Sra. Yolanda  se dedica a la venta de productos variados en uno de las calles mas concurridas dela ciudad, su puesto este bastante surtido.  La cliente es casada,  ella vive en casa familiar donde se encuentra viviendo por 15 años.  Es una mujer que quiere superarse para poderle así brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.  Con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería por docena para poder surtir su puesto, La cliente se encuentra trabajando con emprender desde el año 2004 desde entonces ha mostrado buen comportamiento de pago, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Yolanda sells assorted products in one of the city’s busiest streets; her stand is quite well stocked.  She is married and lives in the family home where she’s lived for 15 years.  She is a woman who wants to improve herself to provide her family with better living conditions.

She will use the money from the loan to buy merchandise by the dozen to stock her stand.  

She has been collaborating with Emprender since 2004 and has had good repayment behavior since then.  She is a responsible, hard working person.  She is grateful to the institution for the support it’s given her.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products like gifts and office decorations.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 menores hijos. Vive en casa propia en el caserío Laguna Larga, en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Vive en la  parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Maruja cuenta con una pequeña bodega ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 3 años. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Realiza ventas al crédito y al contado. Compra su mercadería en la ciudad de Olmos para luego llevarla a su caserío. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Con los ingresos de su bodega, Maruja puede ayudar a su esposo, quien se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, en el sostenimiento económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Maruja, 38, is married and has two minor children.  She lives in her own house located in Laguna Larga, Olmos District, an agricultural zone with quite a bit of commercial activity located in Lambayeque Province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.  She lives in the rural part of the district and does not have running water or electricity.

Maruja has had a small, home-based grocery store for three years.  She sells basic need items of daily use and groceries to her neighbors and customers.  She sells both for cash and on credit.  She buys her merchandise in the city of Olmos and takes it to her hamlet.

She wants to expand her business buying more merchandise.  To do so, she’s thought it advisable to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  With income from her store, Maruja is able to help her husband, who raises small farm animals, to support the family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cow ties to sell

loans.name: Felicia Santos

texts.es:
Felicia  D. 45 años D. edad; es una madre D. familia que vive con su esposo y  sus hijos en  su casa propia, la cual cuenta con los servicios D. agua y luz   en el asentamiento humano (lugar en desarrollo donD. existen pocas vivnedas ) Alan García del distrito D. Olmos  a tan solo 1 hora D. distancia del departamento D. Lambayeque. La ciudad D. Olmos se caracteriza por ser una zona D. mucha actividad agricola y ganadera.

Felicia se dedica  a la venta D. golosinas y bebidas desD. hace 3 años, en su domicilio. Lo que lepermite atender a sus clientela a cualquier hora del día y sus ventas diarias le va a permitir  tener mayores ingresos para las necesidades D. a su hogar.

A solicitado un préstamo Felicia a Edpyme Alternativa D. 3000 nuevos soles para  comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería para implemntar su pequeño negocio y así su clientela tenga diversidad D.  productos para que pueda escoger y llevar lo que desee, al tener mayores ganancias pueD. brindarle a su familia un mejor nivel D. vida, con los ingresos que obtenga con sus ventas.

Felicia es conocida en la zona por ser una mujer trabajadora, que con mucho empeño desea que sus hijos tengan mayores oportunidades D. mejorar en la vida.
texts.en:
Felicia is 45 years old. She is the mother of a family and she lives with her husband and children in a house that they own. It is equipped with running water and hydro and it is located in the human settlement (region in development where there are only a few dwellings). Alan Garcia of the district of Olmos is only 1 hour's distance from the department of Lambayeque. The city of Olmos is known to be a region with a great deal of cultural and farming activity. 

Felicia has been selling sweets and drinks for the past 3 years from her home. This helps her attend to her clients at any hour of the day and the daily sales help her increase her income for the needs of their home.

Felicia has requested from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to purchase greater quantities of merchandise to supply her small business. Her clients will have a variety of products to choose from and to purchase whatever they need. With a greater income she will be able to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

Felicia is known in the region for being a hardworking woman who, with a great deal of effort, wishes that her children will have more opportunities to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of products to supply her store.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Batbayar is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt), in Hovd province of Mongolia. His older two children go to a local secondary school while the youngest one is in kindergarten. He operates a animal raw hides trading business with the help of his wife. He started his business at a rented stall at a local market in 2005 and gained much experience. He is a polite man who is planning to continue his business in the future. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more animal raw hides in order to increase his business sales.

loans.use: To purchase more animal rawhides

loans.name: G.s. Montes De Los Olivos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Montes De Los Olivos. Sofía tiene su negocio que es la venta de frijoles, desde hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy responsable y disfruta de su actividad al proporcionar a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Inicio con la idea de ayuda r a su esposo en la manutención del hogar. Es por eso que realiza este crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de 2 quintales de frijoles y proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan.
texts.en:
“Montes De Los Olivos” (Mount of Olives) communal bank.

Sofía’s business is selling beans.  She’s had it for over four years.  She’s always liked being a very responsible person and she enjoys being able to provide her family with needed income.  She started out with the idea of helping her husband support the household.  This is why she’s asking for this loan to buy two quintals of beans to have for customers who request them.

loans.use: to buy two quintals of beans.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Doña Elana se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva bariada para niños y mayores de edad, ella leva ya barios años de dicarse a esta actividad y se a esforzado mucho para que su negocio  prospere y lo a logrado ahora esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva ya que nececita mas capital para trabajar.
texts.en: Elena has a business where she sells a variety of new clothing for children and adults.  She has been doing this type of work for a number of years.  She has worked hard and been able to make her business prosper.  Now she is requesting a loan to buy new clothing, since she needs more capital to work with.

loans.use: to buy new clothing

loans.name: Sugheylis

texts.en:
Sugheylis worked two jobs to save up for her new neighborhood deli. She enjoys being self-sufficient and having the opportunity to help family members back home in Venezuela and Mexico. Sugheylis works full-time as a personal administrative assistant at a wholesale fish distributor and works at her deli on the weekends while her fiancé manages it during the week. Although she is proud of the growing family business that she has created, Sugheylis realizes that she needs better restaurant/food equipment to increase sales and efficiency.
 
With this loan from ACCION USA, Sugheylis will be purchasing a new grill, freezer, and air conditioner for her deli. She looks forward to starting her own family in the future and hopes that the business that she created will be something of which the entire family can be proud.

loans.use: to purchase a new grill, deli freezer and air conditioner for her deli

loans.name: Edinson Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven emprendedor de 24 años de edad. Él vive con su madre en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque y se dedica a la preparación y venta de Kingkong (postre típico del norte del Perú, hecho a base de galleta y manjar blanco), galletas y dulces.

Miguel realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años, en un espacio acondicionado en su domicilio. Él cuenta con clientela establecida en Chiclayo y Lambayeque.

Miguel solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles, con el que comprará una máquina de amasar para la elaboración de sus productos. Esto le permitirá realizar una mayor cantidad y por lo tanto incrementar sus ventas. Miguel cuenta con clientela fija en la zona.

Miguel es un cliente antiguo de nuestra entidad y presenta un historial crediticio bueno.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 24, is an enterprising young man.  He lives with his mother in the rural part of the Lambayeque district.  He makes and sells “Kingkong” (a typical dessert in the northern part of Peru, made from a base of cookies and blancmange), cookies, and sweets.

Miguel has been engaged in this business activity for three years.  He works in a well set up space in his home.  He has regular customers in Chiclayo and Lambayeque.

Miguel is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use the loan to buy a mixer to make his products.  This will allow him to make a greater quantity and, therefore, increase his sales.  Miguel has regular customers in the area.

Miguel is a long-time client of our institution, and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a mixer.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 33 years old. She is married and has 3 children.

Jacqueline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Jacqueline has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying & selling rice and charcoal.

Jacqueline aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is married and has six children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Lilia is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase piglet feed and vitamins. 

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions and to have more savings for their future use.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda: de 32 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elavoracion de tejidos a mano, ella nos cuenta que se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, y es un trabajo que le a permitido superarse poco a poco,esta contenta porque sabe que fape le pueda ayudar con el credito solicitado,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos en diferentes diceños, el sueño de ella es elavorar en gran cantidad su tejidos para generar mas ingresos y estar mejor economicamente.
texts.en:
Hilda is 32 years old. She makes her living by handweaving fabrics. She says that she has been weaving fabrics for a number of years, and that it is a business which has allowed her to improve her life little by little. 

She is pleased because she knows that FAPE will be able to help her with the loan she has requested. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase raw materials to weave fabrics with different designs. Her dream is to create a great number of fabrics to generate more income and be better off financially.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to weave fabrics.

loans.name: Blanca Emerita

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 51 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos que tienen 21 y 18 años de edad, vive con su familia en Ambato, Blanca se describe como una persona colaboradora.

Trabaja con sus hijos en la siembra y cultivo de fresas; es la primera vez que trabaja con FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de fertilizante y para pagar a personas para la cosecha de las fresas, lo cual le ayudaróa ya que mejoraría su producción.

Su sueño es poder comprarse un vehículo para la venta de sus fresas y también sueña en tener un reservorio de agua para los tiempos de sequía.
texts.en:
Blanca is 51 years old, married, and has two children who are 21 and 18 years old.  She lives with her family in Ambato.  Blanca describes herself as someone who likes to collaborate.

She works with her children in the planting and harvesting of strawberries.  This is the first time she has worked with FODEMI.  The loan she is asking for is for the purchase of fertilizer and to pay people to pick strawberries, which will help her improve her yield.

Her dreams are to be able to buy herself a vehicle to sell her strawberries and to have a water reservoir for times of drought.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay people to pick her strawberries

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is 60 years old and lives in Medallo, Sapang Dalaga. He is married with eight children. 

Edgardo has a shop that sells charcoal. He has had this business for 28 years. He requested a loan  to purchase charcoal for his retail business.

Edgardo has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for his retail business.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is 16 years old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past year, Ritah has been working hard to manage her catering business, with which she delivers hot meals to local families and businesses. 

To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy electric stoves, plates, and chairs for the customers, and will help Ritah to generate greater profit and pay the school fees for her siblings. Ritah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a tailoring machine. 

Ritah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Ritah's future prospects by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy electric stoves, plates, and chairs for her customers.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Anacleta; La socia tiene 52 años D. edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales dos D. ellos son independientes y los otros dos tiene 29, 9 años D. edad; la socia tiene un automóvil el cual lo hace trabajar con un chofer y le paga el 30 por ciento D. lo que ingresa diario;  La socia desea invertir el crédito en la reparación D. su automóvil porque el chofer ha chocado y ahora esta en el taller y requiere planchado y pintado, la socia requiere el dinero para poder sacar su automóvil del taller y continuar con el trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago D. la refacción y reparación D. su automóvil, planchado y pintado.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas D. acuerdo al cronograma D. pagos.
texts.en:
She belongs to the communal bank IMASUMAC II. The communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Anacleta. She is 52 years old, married, and she has 4 children. Two of her children are independent and the other two are 29 and 9 years of age. She has a car which is driven by a driver and she pay him 30% of what he earns every day. She wants to invest this loan it maintenance repairs to her vehicle. The driver had an accident and it is now in the mechanic’s shop. It needs body work and painting. She requires the funds to drive her vehicle out of the mechanic’s shop and to keep it working. She requests a loan to invest in paying for the repairs of her car, including body and paint work.

She is thankful for the loan and she is committed to making her payments according to the established time intervals.

loans.use: to invest in the repairs of her car

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 28-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is an experienced furniture carpenter; he has owned a carpentry shop for almost 11 years. He is the main income provider of his family. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow 1,000 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an air compressor and other equipment needed to improve his business operation. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring him positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase an air compressor and other equipment needed

loans.name: Lukongo A Group

texts.en:
Alphayo takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Alphayo had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alphayo was only able to harvest 1/2 a bag of maize on ½  acres of land.
With income from maize sales, Alphayo will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

Alphayo is the facilitator of Lukongo A group. Alphayo and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Lukongo A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alphayo and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen, 48, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean sites. Phen and her husband are farmers. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. 

Phen is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase a motorbike for her son to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to commute to work.

loans.name: Oyundelger

texts.en: Oyundelger, 44, lives with her husband and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bulgan province, Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver, her elder daughter is a nurse and her younger one is a school student. She started her meat retailing business in 2000 by renting a counter in the market. Now she also owns a small food court. Her food court business is going pretty well, therefore she wants to buy raw materials for the business. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to buy food materials.

loans.use: to buy food materials.

loans.name: Karim Patricia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Karim; ella tiene 37 años de edad, separada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de reposteria,ella prepara tortas,galletas y postres,ella trabaja en forma independiente,la socia tambien trabaja en una distribuidora de medicamentos,por medio de este negocio y este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de reposteria.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina,azucar,mantequilla y utensilios al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Karim is 37 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two children. She now has a dessert business where she prepares cakes, cookies, and pastries. Karim works independently. She also works at a medicine distribution center. Through her business and her job, she is able to help her children move forward. Karim wants to expand her dessert business, so she is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, butter, and utensils in bulk.

She is grateful to everyone who helped her to fulfill her dream, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, and utensils in bulk.

loans.name: Andres Nestor

texts.es:
El señor Andrés es músico y chofer de moto taxi a la vez, el tiene 39 años y es un hombre que tiene que buscar distintas maneras de poder ganar el dinero que sea necesario para mantener y cuidar a sus hijos. Actualmente el vive con su familia en la ciudad de Ica, reconocida actualmente en el país como una de las principales ciudades en las que se pueden realizar inversiones, esto se ha logrado gracias al ingreso de nuevos centros comerciales de distintas partes del país, a su vez estas grandes empresas han permitido que muchas más personas tengan oportunidades de empleo, así mismo también se ha beneficiado a comerciantes ajenos a estos grandes centros comerciales, entre uno de esos casos se encuentra la historia del señor Andrés, que gracias al incremento de la afluencia de público y la gran necesidad que tienen de transportarse le han permitido tener mayores ingresos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

El nos cometa que tiene dos niños, uno de 2 y 9 años de edad, ambos acuden diariamente a la escuela. El señor Andrés es chofer de moto taxi y su recorrido siempre es alrededor del centro de la ciudad, esta actividad le permite tener un promedio de 45 clientes diarios, lo que le permite ganar un aproximado de S/.45. Él se inicio en esta actividad gracias al consejo de un amigo, como otro medio de ingresos en algunas ocasiones eventuales trabaja como músico en algunas reuniones familiares u otro tipo de eventos.

Este crédito le permitirá poder pagar las cuotas iníciales de una moto taxi que desea comprar para incrementar sus ingresos e iniciarse como dependiente. Su sueño es poder algún día tener una casa propia y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Andrés is a musician and also drives a moto-taxi.  He’s 39 years old and is a man who looks for different ways to earn money, which he needs to be able to support and care for his children.  He lives with his family in the city of Ica, known for being one of the main cities in the country where one can make investments.  This has been made possible thanks to new business centers in different parts of the country.  These large companies have allowed many other persons to have employment opportunities.  This has also benefitted foreign businesses as well as the business centers.  Andrés has also benefitted, thanks to the increase in wealth and the increased need for transportation.  It’s allowed him to increase his income through much effort and dedication.

He says that he has two children, ages 2 and 9, who attend school daily.  Andrés drives a moto-taxi and his run is always around the city center.  This allows him to service 45 customers a day, earning him 45 PEN.  He started this business thanks to a friend’s advice.  For extra income he also works as a musician at family reunions and other social events from time to time.   

This loan will allow him to make his first payments on the new moto-taxi he wants to buy so that he can increase his income and become more independent.  His dreams are to have his own home one day and provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to make payments on his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki Athmani is a 44-year-old widow and a mother of three children. She has been running a grocery business for the last ten years.
This is the third loan Riziki has taken to finance her business since she was introduced to Kiva partner KADET. She plans to buy tomatoes, kale, cabbages, onions and carrots to sell to the residents of Kaloleni. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. 
Riziki hopes to have a prosperous family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, kale, cabbages, onions and carrots.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is married with six children. Vivian is 54 years old. She lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Vivian owns and operates a farm planting & harvesting rice to sell to earn a living and she's been in this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

In 2007, Vivian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Phal is 29 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been making baskets to sell for more than seven years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband purchases cattle to resell. He earns about $4 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Phal is requesting a loan of $700 to raise capital for her husband’s business. The loan will enable her husband to earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use to expand the business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to raise capital for her husband's business to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 41 años de edad, vive sola en casa propia, ella es divorciada y tiene dos hijos. Ella posee un salón de belleza en el cual atiende a mujeres, hombres y niños, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación y lo posee desde hace más de cuatro años, ella hace cortes de cabello, tintes, faciales, peinado y así mismo comercializa cosméticos como cremas para el cuerpo y el cabello, maquillaje, tratamientos para el cabello y otros más. Debido a que ella realiza un excelente trabajo, posee muchos clientes los cuales son muy fieles a su negocio, a pesar de esto, ella desea mejorar aún más su salón, es por ello que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: tintes, cremas para el cuerpo y cabello, tratamientos y todo lo esencial para su salón, no solo por mayor sino también al contado ya que en la actualidad ella compra a crédito lo que no le permite dar precios más bajos, esta es una de las mayores razones por las cuales desea comprar al contado y de esta forma bajar los precios para poder obtener más clientes y así mismo darle un mejor servicio a los actuales. Maribel es una persona muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

loans.use: Compra de productos de belleza para comercializar

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en: Ashura is a young girl of 20 years. She lives with her parent in Handeni District, Tanzania. Ashura volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in a secondary school helping students boost their academic performance through a life skill. Ashura requests a Kiva loan in order to obtain capital to sell cooking oil, rice, beans, and coconut in her stall. She wants to provide a good service to her fellow villagers where she can increase profits and use the profits to help her family buy household needs.

loans.use: to start a grocery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah wants to buy two young bulls

loans.name: Palasi

texts.en: Palasi is a mother of five who never attended school. Her children now go to schools in the village. Though Palasi does not have a formal education, she learned the skills of a farmer on the plantation where she was raised. She lives 200-300 meters inland from the main road. Before she joined the lending program, Palasi and her family lived without electricity and running water. Their water came mainly from rainwater. She has applied for three loans, which have helped her develop her plantation and given her access to a power supply. She is requesting a capital loan in the amount of $850.00 so she can continue to develop her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers, fungicides and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Ana Maria Sandra

texts.es:
Ana Maria is married and she has two children, her husband works as teacher in a small school in the city Monclova in the state of Coahuila. Before the need of an additional income, Ana Maria decided to start her own business of selling groceries, in order to help her husband with the family’s expenses and the education of their small children. She first started with very few products but she has managed to increase the variety and make this business work. The desire to offer the best to her family motivates her to work hard every day. Now, Ana Maria needs a loan of $200 that she will use to buy merchandise. She is hoping to be able to cover the demand of her clients and to keep her business growing like up until now. You can help with the growth of this business. Help improve the quality of life of this family! They are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Maria es casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo se desempeña como maestro en una pequeña escuela de la localidad de Monclova en el estado de Coahuila. Ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra Ana María decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de la educación de sus pequeños, inició con muy pocos productos pero ha logrado incrementar su variedad y sacar adelante su negocio. Los deseos de ofrecerle lo mejor a su familia la motivan a esforzarse más cada día, ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora. En tus manos esta el crecimiento de este negocio, ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use:
Buy 
Merchandise

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mr A. Kossi was born in 1975 in Gati in the prefecture of Zio. After his primary studies, he obtained a car driving licence. Not having the means to buy a car, he completed 5 years of farming after that. Married and father of two children, his wife does not have any income generating activity -- with the result that all the needs are all supported by Mr A.. From his farming business, the family performs well -- it is responsible for the family's survival.

He is honest and rigorous, In order to have his own motor-driven pump, he requests a loan of $1000. He will be able to thus increase the farm's cultivable surface for an increase in its profits. This will be able to thus provide even more suitably for the needs of the family.

ORIGINAL FRENCH

Monsieur A. Kossi est né en 1975 à Gati dans la préfecture du Zio. Après ses études primaires, il a fait la conduite auto sanctionnée par un permis de conduire. N’ayant pas les moyens pour s’acheter une voiture, il fait depuis plus de 5 ans le maraîchage. Marié et père de deux enfants, son épouse n’a aucune activité génératrice de revenu, ce qui fait que toutes les charges sont supportées par Monsieur A.. A partir de cette activité qu’il maîtrise si bien et à qui il doit sa survie, il assume tant bien que mal les besoins alimentaires des enfants. Honnête et rigoureux, il a su gérer les deux crédits obtenus. Afin d’avoir sa propre motopompe, il sollicite un crédit de $1000. Il pourra ainsi agrandir sa surface cultivable pour une augmentation de ses revenus. Il pourra ainsi subvenir convenablement aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d'une motopompe pour le maraîchage

loans.name: Lepetia

texts.en: Lepetia is 45-year-old mother from the village of Matautu Lefaga. She is applying for her 5th loan, which she plans to use to expand her plantation business.  She sells her banana and taro products once a week at the Fugalei market, where she earns more than $120 a week. Because of the good quality of her taro and bananas, she is always able to sell all her products in less than 4 hours. Her husband helps her with the maintenance of the plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, knives, and other tools for her plantation, as well as cement and timber for home improvement

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en: I am Hamida B. and I belong to a low-income family. I live with my family in Arifwala, a small city in Pakistan. I am a mother of ten: five boys and five girls. My husband is a very dedicated carpenter who loves his work. My family is big and our income is small. Therefore, we need to expand our business, and require $175 for this purpose. My husband will buy wood in bulk as it is cheaper if bought in cash.

loans.use: Buy wood in bulk

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mr. Sim S., 61, is married with four children and lives with his ailing wife in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He works driving a taxi to generate his income and typically earns around $5 each day of profit. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory, while the rest of whom two are unemployed. Mr. Sim S. works very hard every day to economic money for his wife’s treatment and also for his daily’s expense. Recently, he has requested for a loan to change a new car for his business because his current car is frequently fixed and waste him a lot of money.

loans.use: To  change a new car for his business because his current car is frequently fixed and waste him a lot of money.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Mrs. Ek S. E., age 45, works selling secondhand clothes at an open-air market and typically makes on average around $3 each day of profit. Her husband works as a taxi driver, earning about $10 each day in revenue. They have 6 children, two who work as taxi drivers, two who are employed by a garment factory, and the rest of whom are at school. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a taxi for one of her children to operate his own taxi business. This will increase income for the entire family.

loans.use: To purchase a car to operate their own taxi business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Phương, 32 years old, is a member of the TYM Fund since 2002. She took out her first loan of 125USD to open a hair salon. Her energetic and skillful nature made her shop a crowded place. In 2006, she acquired bridal make-up, dressing and photographing skills and expanded her shop to a bridal do-all shop. The monthly income is 450USD. Though busy, she always whole heartedly participates in the Fund’s activities and helps other members. She lives with her husband and two children in Quang Tiến, Sóc Sơn. This time, she is applying a loan of $1200 to buy bridal gowns and cosmetics for her shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Phương, 32 tuổi, là thành viên Quỹ Tình thương năm 2002. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay của Quỹ 125USD đầu tư vào cửa hàng cắt tóc gội đầu. Bản thân là một người có tay nghề và nhiệt tình với công việc nên khách đến cửa hàng ngày một đông. Kinh tế phát triển, năm 2006 chị Phương học thêm nghề trang điểm cô dâu và cho thuê áo cưới, chụp ảnh. Khách hàng của chị là những đôi lứa yêu nhau và những cặp chuẩn bị cưới. Thu nhập bình quân một tháng của cửa hàng đạt 450USD. Mặc dù rất bận rộn với công việc nhưng trong thời gian tham gia Quỹ chị Phương luôn hoàn thành tốt trách nhiệm của mình, và sẵn sàng giúp đỡ chị em trong cụm khi gặp khó khăn. Hiện tại chị Phương đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Quang Tiến, Sóc Sơn. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD mua áo cưới và mỹ phẩm.

loans.use: Buy bridal gowns and cosmetics

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel transports plants to the capital, selling them by the dozen. They are special plants that she grows on her patio and garden, and used in funeral wreaths and for placing at a gravestones.

Isabel realized that in the capital city she could make more money which she needs to support her children, especially her older two who are attending college in the capital. She also takes advantage of her frequent trips to the capital to shop wholesale.

To increase the amount of flowers she sells Isabel needs a loan, and asks us to contribute.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

ISABEL, tiene una ardua labor de trasportar plantas a la capital, son especiales y las siembra en el patio de su casa o dentro de su chacra porque son utilizadas en las decoraciones de las coronas que llevan a los velorios o a los cementerios para sus seres queridos y por ser de gran utilidad a Isabel se le ocurrió llevarlos hasta la capital para venderlos por docenas y obtener mayores ingresos, los cuales son necesarios para solventar los gastos de sus hijos y en especial la de sus dos hijos mayores quienes cursan estudios superiores en la capital.Ahora esta aprovechando sus viajes para comprar algunos productos de la empresa UNION quienes ofrecen deliciosos productos masivos para la comunidad. Para aumentar la oferta de productos en su nuevo desempeño necesita un préstamo para dar un gran realce a su negocio y pide podamos contribuir con ello.

loans.use: Buy more plants and increase her flower cultivation

loans.name: Glodomiro

texts.es:
Glodorimo is a youth with many ideals of improvement and with this progress in mind he has capitalized on an investment in a small center that raises bulls and he wants to continue with his work. For this reason he asks for a loan to acquire a greater quantity of balanced feed for his temporary tenants.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith , Kiva volunteer.

Glodomiro, es un joven con muchos ideales de superación y con su propósito de progreso en mente ha capitalizado su inversión en un pequeño centro de crianza de toros, desea continuar con su labor y por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de alimento balanceado para sus inquilinos temporales.

loans.use: Purchase of balanced feed

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 48 year-old Gulzar S.. She is widowed, and has three children aged between 13 and 30. She has one dependent. In 1999, Gulzar established her clothing business. Gulzar requires a loan in order to expand her range of clothing and traditional African cloth. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing and traditional African cloth.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Ms. N’Diaye Fatoumata A. is a 60-year-old married women and the mother of eight children. She resides in the 2nd district of Ségou with her husband (retired) and her children.

Never having attended school, Ms. N’Diaye Fatoumata A. was initiated into commerce at a tender age by her grandmother. She has a good sense for business, thanks to this long accumulated experience. After six loans (in groups) with Soro Yiriwaso that were all paid back correctly, she is on her first individual loan. She gets her inventory locally in Ségou and intends to use this loan to buy raw materials: 10 boxes of powdered juice, 5 fifty-kilo sacks of sugar, 1 packet of plastic bags, 1 sack of dah (dried hibiscus flowers), 1 sack of tamarind, 11 packets of vanilla, and 1 sack of ginger.

She enjoys a great reputation in her business and receives orders especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, etc....) In addition, she makes sales from home to a diverse customer base.

With this loan, she expects to realize a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA that she intends to use to bolster her business and to initiate another business (the stocking up and marketing of cereal products).

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mme N’Diaye Fatoumata A. est une femme mariée de 60 ans, mère de 8 enfants et résidant au 2ème quartier de Ségou avec son mari( à la retraite) et ses enfants.

N’ayant jamais été à l’école, Mme N’Diaye Fatoumata A. a été initié aux activités commerciales depuis sa tendre enfance par sa grande mère. Elle a un grand ses des affaires grâce à cette longue expérience accumulée. Après 6 prêts (en solidaire de groupe) avec Soro Yiriwaso tous correctement remboursés ; elle est à son premier prêt individuel Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou et compte utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat de matières premières : 10 cartons de jus en poudre, 5 sacs de sucre de 50 kg ,1 paquet de sachet plastique, 1 sac de dah ,1 sac de tamarin 11 paquets de vanille et 1 sac zinzimbre .

Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit des commandes surtout lors des cérémonies (Mariages, baptême etc.…). En plus elle vend quotidiennement chez elle à domicile à une clientèle variée.

Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour renforcer son activité et initier une autre activité (Stockage et commercialisation des produits céréaliers).

loans.use: To buy raw materials and packaging for juice

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is the wife of Muhammad Afzal. She has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, for the last 16 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and a daughter. Her sons have a furniture business. Her husband has a cigarette shop. Khursheed baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more cigarettes for her husband’s shop.

Khursheed baji is joined in her loan group by a few other members. Sugran baji wants a loan to expand her wheat business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Carmen Rosa Milagros

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa is 37 years old and belongs to the "Las Candelarias II" Communal Bank in Huaraz. She would like to learn how to prepare regional food and open a restaurant in her home with the support of her husband who works in a private institution.

She has been selling cosmetics door to door for 3 years.

Carmen is a professional systems engineer and has spent her life caring for her four children. She is now happy because her eldest son is studying to be a policeman.

With this loan of 1,200 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments, she will be able to cover the cost of all of her orders because she only asks for 50% in advance and is paid upon delivery.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

En la actualidad Carme Rosa, de 37 años pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II” de Huaraz, quisiera capacitarse en la preparación de comidas regionales y abrir un restaurante en su casa, con la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja en una institución privada. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos desde hace 3 años, ella reparte casa por casa a sus clientes. Carmen es ingeniera de sistemas de profesión, se ha dedicado a sus cuatro hijos, y ahora se siente satisfecha al haber logrado que su hijo mayor estudie para policía. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,200 soles, que pagará en 6 cuotas, ella cancelará el costo total de sus pedidos debido a que vende sus productos con el 50% de adelanto, para después ser cancelados.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is a 50 year old widow with six children. One of the kids is currently in school, while the others have completed their schooling. Rose enjoys selling and has a great deal of experience in customer care. She has been selling maize and gari for thirty years to support her family.

She treks to farming communities to buy her stock from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher price. She wants to use this loan to buy maize and bags of gari in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids who are ready to enter university this year.

Rose is a member of a community group called First Kings Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy maize and bags of gari in bulk.

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en: Nhim S. Y., 34, is married and lives with two young children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1990, she has been growing yams to earn a living and is able to make around US$5 each day, while her husband is a taxi driver, earning about US$5 as well. Mrs. Nhim S. Y. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to rent a farm to raise yams for sale.

loans.use: To rent a farm to raise yams.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna K. is a villager in Pong Ro Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. 

Since her field is far from irrigation, she does not have a way to generate water to water her plants. Thus, Mrs. Vanna K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to water her crop. 

Her husband, Mr. Nut Dem, is a fisherman who gathers a little fish to support the family. Mrs. Vanna K. is 46 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump to water her crop.

loans.name: Kalisa

texts.en:
Greetings from Kalisa G. in the Northern province of Rwanda! Kalisa, 44 years old and married with four children, has owned a butcher shop located in the Ruhengeri Market for the past 10 years. He began this business when he returned to Rwanda from Democratic Republic of Congo after the Genocide of 1994.

Kalisa is requesting a loan to increase his working capital and offer better service to his customers. This loan will be repaid in eight months

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is married. She is an entrepreneur from Vinogradovo. Magdalina sells children’s clothing in the central city market. She has been in the business for 5 years. Financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine has impacted her business a lot. Moreover, favorable location in the marketplace and growing sales have only added to the success of Magdalina’s business and increased her income within the past few years.

Magdalina is currently making about 15,000 Grivnas in gross income. Her monthly net profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnas. Magdalina has an enterprising spirit. She is a thorough planner, very punctual and active. One of her long-term plans is to open one more vending stand in the market.

Magdalina believes current increase of assorted merchandise will help her develop her business consistently and move her one step further in her business progress. Magdalina is now requesting a 2,500 Grivna loan. This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Mr. Chhoeun I was born in 1979 and lives in Trapaing Kork village in Takeo province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Chim Theat, is a duck breeder. Her business is going well and she would like to expand. Mr. Chhoeun is requesting a loan so his wife can buy more ducks to breed and duck food. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. They have two children, one is attending a local school and the other is too young to work or study. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to breed and duck food.

loans.name: Holmo

texts.ru: Абророва Холмо одинокая женщина, которая одна воспитывает четверых детей. Занимается животноводством. Имеет трех коров, молоко которых она продает , и за этот счет обеспечивает семью. Кроме того покупает неоткормленных телят , которых откармливает и перепродает на рынке . Таким образом она решила получить кредит и увеличить поголовье скота, что даст возможность увеличить товарооборот. Погаить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Holmo A. is a single mother of four. She works in animal sales. She has three dairy cows whose millk she sells in order to make a living. She also buys young bull calves that she then sells at the market. Holmo decided to apply for a loan that would allow her to increase the number of livestock and increase cash flow. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Kyambadde Aidah Group

texts.en:
Kyambadde A. is 32 years old and married with eight children. She owns a house with five rooms and that is where she stays with her family. She does not have water or electricity in her home. She has to fetch water from a nearby spring. She has three meals a day and her greatest monthly expense is feeding her children.

Kyambadde A. sells charcoal from home and she works seven days a week. She receives about 30 customers a day. She sells her charcoal both at retail and at wholesale. She has done this business for 10 years now. The challenge she faces in this business is that she has to collect the charcoal from the villages. The distances are very long and when it rains, it is very difficult to access the village roads because most times they become impassable.

She has worked with MCDT for eight years and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is that she needed capital for her business. She wants to use this loan to invest in her business. Her aspiration is to start a retail shop.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Adeola

texts.en: Adeola is 43 years old and she is married with 5 children. She sells foodstuffs like rice, tomato paste, palm oil, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is a hard-working woman. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mejor Progreso Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Mayra del Socorro G., Matea Hipólita S. G., Rita de los Angeles C. y Ligia del Rosario L. R..

El grupo solidario El mejor progreso son originarios de la ciudad de Masaya, tienen varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim porque sienten que es una institución que ha confiado en ellos, expresan que se sienten como parte de la familia de Adim. Todas las miembros del grupo venden en el mercado municipal.

Doña Ligia es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado donde ofrece frutas y verduras, con seis años de tener esta actividad ha sabido como es el giro de su negocio, expresa que ella ha visto como en cada préstamo le va quedando un mayor inventario en el negocio. Ella es una madre joven de treinta y cuatro años de edad con cuatro hijos adolescentes sueña con que ellos puedan estudiar la secundaria completa para que se defiendan en la vida. Su esposo es agricultor en tierras familiares y la producción de él, ella se la compra y la vende a mejor precio en el mercado.
Todo lo que ha logrado le anima a seguir trabajando y quedando bien en Adim, esto se lo hace saber a su grupo y por eso se encarga de ir a dejar el abono para garantizar la puntualidad.

Doña  Mayra del Socorro vende productos varios como detergentes, pastas de dientes, jabones etc. Tiene cinco años de vender en el mercado, ella compra a empresas que ofrecen productos al por mayor y así le queda un mayor margen de ganancia, no tiene hijos a su cargo y su esposo está en Costa Rica trabajando, le envía remesas de poco dinero pero que le ayudan a sus gastos.



Doña Matea vende perecederos, tiene cuatro hijos jóvenes solteros que viven con ella, todos estudian y el mayor cursa la Universidad, con más de treinta años de trabajar en el mercado expresa que hasta ahora logra obtener un crédito que es en base a la confianza y está clara que debe de ser puntual con su pago. Su esposo trabaja como artesano de madera y le ayuda con los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos.

Doña Rita de los Angeles C. vende truchas y productos varios, ella es viuda vive con dos hijos que le ayudan a vender en el puesto, un varón de veintiún años y una mujer de veinticinco ambos solteros. Ella expresa que su negocio le ha dado para vivir, en Adim ha aprendido a invertir bien su dinero y el del prestamo.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Mayra del Socorro G., Matea Hipólita S. G., Rita de los Angeles C. and Ligia del Rosario L. R.. The supportive group members of El Mejor Progreso are from Masaya city. They have worked with Adim for several cycles because they feel that it is an institution that has believed in them. They feel like they are part of the Adim family. All of the group members sell in the municipal market. Ligia, the coordinator of this group, has a stall in the market where she sells fruits and vegetables. With six years of experience, she knows how her business goes. She has seen how with each loan she is able in increase her inventory. She is a young mother of 34 with four adolescent children. She dreams that they will be able to finish their high school studies so that they can take care of themselves. Her husband is a farmer on family land. She buys what he produces and sells it for a better price in the market. Everything that she has achieved encourages her to keep working and staying with Adim. She lets her group know this, and that is why she is in charge of turning in the payment to make sure it is on time. Mayra del Socorro sells various products like detergent, toothpaste, soap, etc. She has been selling in the market for five years. She buys from businesses that sell wholesale. That way she gets a bigger margin of earnings. She does not have children to take care of, and her husband is in Costa Rica working. He sends her remittances of not very much money, but it does help with her expenses. Matea sells perishables. She has 4 single children who live with her. They all go to school, and the oldest goes to the University. She has more than thirty years of working in the market. She knows that a loan is based on trust, and it is clear that they payment should be on time. Her husband is a wood craftsman, and he helps with the educational expenses of the children. Rita de los Angeles C. sells trout and various products. She is a widow, and she lives with her two children. Her son is 21, and her daughter is 25. They are both single. They help her sell at her stall. Her business has given her a living. In Adim she has learned to invest her money better, and she has learned about loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetales, products not grown in  Masaya like: broccoli, lettuce, carrots, onions, etc.

loans.name: Tsevelravjaa

texts.en:
Tsevelravjaa T. lives with his wife and their youngest daughter in Ovorhanghay, one of Mongolia's southern provinces. They have four children, whose ages range from 2 to 21. Three of their children are students at universities in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Tsevelrajvaa makes a living transporting raw materials from Gashuun Sukhait, a border town next to China, and the province's center. When he returns from Gashuun Sukhait, he usually carries back imported bricks, cement and/or cereals, which he buys at wholesale and then resells. He normally travels to Gashuun Sukhait once or twice a month. Tsevelravjaa works hard to make sure that his three children will be able to finish university successfully and without any financial strain. 

He is applying for this loan to buy more construction materials, such as bricks and cement.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as bricks and cement.

loans.name: Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
Kisira has been a clothes and other items seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for six years. She belongs to Tujikwamue group loan (Group code 2074).  Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  


She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and other items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  


Kisira is 40 years old and married. She takes care of three dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Fatma, who has her own small business selling mixed food and charcoal in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Komi Ernest

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un résident du quartier de kégué,  il a appris la cuisine, et très tôt en 2000, étant  célibataire et devant subvenir à ses propres besoins, il a ouvert un restaurant dans le quartier de Novissi qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Ses plats sont très appréciés par ses clients, il jouit d’une très bonne réputation. Actuellement sont stock de matières nécessaires à son activité de restauration sont épuisés, il veut rehausser son stock, ayant déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’il a remboursé, il sollicite un second crédit pour acheter  les matières nécessaires aux activités de la restauration et des casiers de boissons.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a resident of the Kégué district. He learned how to cook, and being unmarried supporting himself, he soon opened a restaurant in 2000 in Novissi, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. His dishes are highly appreciated by his customers. He enjoys a very good reputation. His stock of supplies that are needed for the restaurant business is now exhausted. He wants to replenish his stock. Having already had a WAGES loan which he repaid, he’s requesting a second loan to buy what’s necessary for his business and some cases of drinks.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the goods necessary for his restaurant business and some cases of beverages

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 54 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sencilla, vive en la casa de unos familiares junto a sus 2 hijos; Osías de 19 y Álvaro de 17 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy niña le gustó trabajar, actualmente tiene un puesto donde vende golosinas y muñecos de peluche, el cual es muy concurrido por sus clientes ya que ella es una vendedora muy alegre y divertida. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta. Para un futuro cercano, Genoveva espera tener una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le genere mejores ingresos económicos, sabe que el camino a sus metas es largo y sacrificado, pero esta dispuesta a recorrerlo. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y espera poderlo pagar a tiempo, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a sus demás compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más productos y así implementar mejor su puesto de golosinas y muñecos.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 54, is a very happy and unassuming woman. She lives with her two children; Osías who is 19, and Álvaro who is 17, in a house that belongs to relatives. Her children are the motivation for her efforts. She has liked to work since she was a little girl. She currently has a stand where she sells candy and stuffed animals. Her stand has lots of customers because she is a happy and fun sales lady. What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers. She has been in this business for ten years. The hardest part is having to stay in her stall all day. In the near future Genoveva hopes to have a grocery store. That would generate greater income. She knows that the road to reaching her goals is long and requires sacrifice. But, she is prepared to go down that road. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She expects to be able to pay it back on time. She does not want to cause problems for the other members of her community bank. In the bank she is well liked and respected. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more products. That way she can improve her candy and stuffed animal stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Amen

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a appris le métier de la menuiserie, il a ouvert en 1998 son propre atelier  qu’il a appelé « Etablissement Moderne et bois ». Les matières nécessaires à son activité de menuiserie sont épuisées, il voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 29 grumes de Teck.
Il est marié et père de 02 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de cette activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman learned to be a carpenter. In 1998 he opened his own workshop which he calls « Etablissement Moderne et bois ». The necessary materials for his work as a carpenter are expended, and he would like to replenish them, so he is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 29 teak logs.

He is married and the father of 2 children. It is with the income from his business that he supports his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of teak logs

loans.name: Losa

texts.en: Losa S. (0) is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Fusi Saoluafata. She is married and has four infant children. Losa owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 550 WST a month. In 2005, Losa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Losa is now requesting a new loan of 1,750 WST which will again be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Talapsu Group

texts.en:
This is Masiray K., Warrah A.T. D., Adama C. and Iye S.. They called their group Talapsu. This is the first loan they are receiving from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. They’re requesting a loan of Le 500,000 to enable them expand their businesses. This will helped them a lot. They will able to make a lot of profit from the loan, thus able to solve much of their household problems. 

Masiray is the leader of this group. Masiray was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown. She is twenty-four years of age, married with two children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary School I and the other is in nursery I. Masiray sells cottons, she will use this loan to buy bales of cotton. A bale of cotton costs Le 40,000.00. Presently, Masiray is trading with ten bales of cottons, but with the loan, she will be able to get least eleven more bales of cottons. Masiray has been a businesswoman for ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Lucila Flora

texts.es:
La señora Lucila Flor, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años y es madre de 02 hijos,  02 que aun depende de ella.

Lucila Flor, se dedica a la venta de muebles, se inició con S/. 2,000.00 producto del ahorro familiar quienes la motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio de carpintería, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenos pedidos de muebles, camas, comedores, cómodas y roperos. Ya es muy conocida en su Distrito y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.
