Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará madera en cuartones, en sus diferentes variedades como: ishpingo, caoba, capirona, así tener más acogida y satisfacer a sus clientes. Los muebles que realizan y la calidad de sus trabajos hace que tenga mucha clientela.

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.

loans.use: Comprará maderas, para elaborar sus muebles.

loans.name: Alexer

texts.en:
MFI Staff Member Name
	Rose 
Date	24.09.09
Full Name Of Each Group Member	Prossy Nalwoga 
GROUP MEMBERS AND THEIR lOANS
Prossy  Nalwoga 	500,000
	
	
 	
Center No	70
Alexa is a 52 widowed with five children aged between 11 and 18 years. All her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Alexa resides and owns a one roomed house where she is staying with eight people. There is electricity no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Kyebando Nsooba . Alexa works seven days a week. She buys her second hand shoes from owino Market and incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She pays monthly rent of 50000/=.  She sells and works to all categories of people Alexa has been in this business for ten  years and with MCDT for eight years, servicing her twentieth  loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand shoes .Alexa is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start import them directly

loans.use: To buy more second hand shoes

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “8 de Septiembre” del distrito de Acora, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 01  hijo, vive en el Sector Pilcuyo, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años, es una de las socias fundadoras, inicio su préstamo con la suma de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde, y lana acrílica de colores para la elaboración de títeres de dedo, ya que ella se dedica también  a la elaboración de artesanías.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para ayudar a su hijo.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino y lana acrilica.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El señor Carlos Alberto es casado y vive con su esposa la señora Wendy Adriana Corpus y son padres de familia de 2 niños en edad escolar. El señor Carlos inicio su negocio de enderezado y pintura hace 9 años, el cual esta dando muy buenas ganancias ya que los clientes lo buscan porque realiza muy buen trabajo y además es económico, pero ahora desea invertir en mas pinturas y materiales para realizar enderezados ya que quiere convertirse en proveedor para otros pintores y además seguir con su taller. Es por tal motivo que esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Carlos Alberto is married and lives with his wife, Señora Wendy Adriana Corpus, and their two school-aged children. Carlos started his automotive body shop 9 years ago, which generates very good earnings. His customers look for him because he does very good work and is also very economical. Now he would like to invest in more paint and materials, since he would like to become a provider to other body shops as well as to continue with his own shop. For this reason he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in a body shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabon, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 45 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 01 que aun dependen de ella y está estudiando.Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de anticuchos, negocio por la cual se hizo conocida, de esta manera hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de Comidas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes y pensionistas. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, muy bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the "Los Diamantes" community bank in the district of Eslabon, province of Bellavista, department of San Martin. She is unmarried, 45-years-old, and is the mother of two children, one of which still depends on her while they are in school. Rosita, as she is affectionately known, previously made a name for herself by being a vendor of kebabs called "anticuchos." In the same way, she now sells food out of her own home, a well-equipped place, where she attends her customers and guests. She tells us that her daily sales are good due to the delicious flavor she gives her food. She is well-known and very welcoming. These days, she maintains the same business and is very happy with her day to day work. It is Rosa who personally serves her customers with her characteristic charisma. She will use this loan of 1,500 soles ($525) to buy ingredients for the preparation of her daily foods, such as kilos of rice, liters of oil, crates of chickens, vegetables, and also some utensils - all that will go towards better serving her customers. She feels very fulll of life, and with her desire to keep moving ahead, she has many goals and dreams for her life, such as opening her own well-stocked grocery store. And, at the same time, she would also like to thank the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Nadia Stephani

texts.es: Nadia tiene 21 años  de edad y es soltera. Vive en la casa de su abuela juntamente con sus hermanas. Su madre  viene temporalmente de la sierra. Sus padres son de la sierra. Nadia tiene una pequeña tienda surtida de abarrotes y verduras. Ella se inició en este negocio con apoyo de sus padres motivos por el cual las boletas de compra estan a nombre de la madre pero quien administra el negocio en Nadia. Ella es una persona responsable con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.  Cuenta con metas y objetivos uno de ellos es realizar estudios Universitarios. Con el dinero que solicita desea adquirir y surtir su mercaderia de productos navideños.
texts.en:
Nadia, 21, is single. She and her sisters live in their grandmother's house. Her parents are mountain people and her mother comes down to visit occasionally. Nadia runs a small grocery and produce store. Her parents helped her set up this business so the purchase orders are in her mother's name. However, Nadia is who actually runs the business. She is a responsible person with very good personal and work references. She has goals and objectives, one of which is to finish university studies. With the requested financing she wants to stock up on Christmas merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Christmas merchandise.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn V., 39, is from Brgy Balaring, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She is married to Edwin an auto diesel mechanic. They have two children who are five and 12 years old.  The older child attends school. 

She dreams to improving her business so she can help her husband earn their livelihood and to send their children to school. In 1990 Ronalyn started making embroidered pillows, bags and other products.  She enjoyed her business and is very skillful in machine embroidery.  As she became known for the quality of her work, her customer-base grew.  It became apparent that she needed more capital to fill orders from her growing clientele. This is why she joined the NWTF Project Dungganon in 2002.  Ronalyn is happy because she is doing something that she loves while earning additional income of at least PHP 2,500 a month.

Ronalyn's Previous loan of Php 19,500 was used as additional capital for her business. Because she used the loan wisely in her business, she was able to pay off her weekly installments on time until she paid the loan in full.  Now for her 15th cycle loan, she wants to borrow another PHP 19,500 so she can continue her embroidery business.
 -------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros  Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the  lives of thousands of women through Project  <i>Dungganon</i> (a Hiligaynon word that means  <u>Honorable</u>). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is  empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to  achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a  life path that will ultimately make them <i>Dungganon</i> -  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has  earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Asya

texts.en: Asya S. was born in 1964. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli region.  Now, she has settled in the Fuzuli region, Qayidish settlement.  Asya is married and has 2 children. She has a cattle breeding business. She needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy four calves for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: José Demetrio

texts.es: José Demetrio A. de 39 años de edad y reside en el pueblo de Jocoaitique, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a su esposa, la cual le brinda toda la ayuda necesaria en su negocio, y junto a tres hijos de 11, 7 y 2 años de edad. José cuenta con dos años de poseer su propio negocio el cual consiste en la venta de productos alimenticios y  de primera necesidad para el hogar tales como: desinfectante, detergente y otros más. José solicita un préstamo, ya que desea poder surtir su negocio, comprando diferentes tipos de queso, así también crema, arroz, frijol y maíz; esto debido a que son unos de los productos con más demanda en el lugar, lo cual tiene mucho que ver con la costumbres alimenticias de las personas que habitan en dicho pueblo. José espera percibir mayores ganancias, cabe mencionar que la tienda esta ubicada en las cercanías del parque Central de Jocoaitique, esto, junto al hecho de brindarles más productos a sus clientes, será de gran beneficio para José, ya que le permitirá aumentar su clientela.
texts.en:
José Demetrio A., 39, lives in Jocoaitique, which is in Morazán department. He lives with his wife, who is a great help to him in his business, and their three children, who are 11, 7 and 2 years of age. José has had his own business for two years now, which is a small grocery store in his home. He sell basic needs items like: disinfectant, detergent, etc. as well as food items. José is requesting funding because he wants to stock his store; he needs to buy several kinds of cheese, as well as cream, rice, beans and corn, since these are the most requested items because they form an important part of the usual diet of folks in his area. José hopes to make higher profits. It's noteworthy that the store is located near Jocoaitique's central park. This, added to a varied stock to offer his customers, should be of great benefit for him because this will bring about an increase in the number of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Rosalpina

texts.es: Rosalpina es soltera, tiene 2 hijos: Pierina de 25 años quien esta casada pero vive con su mamá y esta cursando el ultimo año de Administracion de Empresas en la universidad, y Rafael de 21 años cursando el 4to año de mercadotecnia. Rosalpina trabaja para la Alcaldía Municipal de Juigalpa desde hace 7 años. Está solicitando su 9no crédito para comprar una computadora para que sus hijos puedan hacer sus trabajos e investigaciones que les dejan en la universidad, asi mismo le serviria para realizar trabajos que no puede terminar en la oficina, pues como hay reduccion de horas laborales, no puede completar algunos informes en el tiempo establecido. Los créditos anteriores han sido utilizados para mejorar su vivienda. Es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo, se caracteriza por ser honesta y responsable.
texts.en:
Rosalpina is single and has two children: Pierina is 25 years old, married, but lives with her mother and is in her final year of Business Administration at university; and Rafael who is 21 years old and is in his fourth year of a course in Marketing. Rosalpina has worked for the Mayor’s Office in the municipality of Juigalpa for seven years. She is asking for her ninth loan and will use it to buy a computer so that her children can do their university work and research on it. As well, Rosalpina would use it to do work that she hasn’t been able to finish in the office because a reduction in hours has meant that she can’t complete reports in the time allotted. Her past loans have been used to improve her house. She is much-liked by her work colleagues and is known to be honest and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: 3 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación se encuentra en la zona de Exaltación, en la ciudad de El Alto, que a su vez le debe su nombre a la Virgen de la Exaltación.  En esta zona se formó el grupo “3 de febrero”, 9 mujeres trabajadoras esperan recibir un crédito para mejorar los negocios.  Las clases de la escuela han comenzado y las socias manifiestan que como madres, deben trabajar más  para responder a las necesidades de sus hijos.

Los negocios son variados: Transporte público, venta de material escolar, confección de mantas, venta de verduras y vajilla.

En el caso de la presidenta Fanny C. M., es una joven de 19 años de edad, muy entusiasta y llena de vitalidad que ha terminado el colegio el año pasado y ahora piensa que mientras inicia las clases en la Normal (Educación superior para formación de Profesores de colegio), ella estará gustosa de guiar a la asociación comunal.

Los últimos años ha tenido el negocio de venta de papa a los restaurantes y pensiones.  Tambien, tiene un puesto en la zona 16 de julio que comparte con su  madre para la venta de mochilas.

Por ahora está muy interesada en fortalecer su negocio pues tiene a su cargo una hijita de un año, con quien es feliz.  Su situación de madre y padre al mismo tiempo no le limita a realizar sus actividades.
texts.en:
The Community Center of Villa Exaltación is located in the District of Exaltación, which was named after Our Lady of the Exaltation. In this district, the February 3rd Group was formed by nine hardworking women who hope to receive a loan to improve their businesses. Since school has started and the members are also mothers, they say that they must work harder in order to meet the needs of their children.

The businesses represented are diverse. They include public transportation, school supply sales, manufacture of blankets, vegetable sales, and dinnerware sales.

Fanny C. M. is 19 years old and serves as president of the group. She is enthusiastic and full of vitality. Now that she completed high school last year, she is considering starting classes at normal school (a higher education program designed to train school teachers). Fanny is happy to be leading her Community Association. In recent years, she has managed a business selling potatoes to restaurants and boarding houses. Fanny also has a place in the July 16th District where she and her mother sell backpacks. She is now interested in strengthening her business because she is responsible for a one year old daughter, who is happy. Her role of being both mother and father to her child has not limited her in pursuing her activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
António V. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 59 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 30, 24, 22, 17, e 12 anos de idade, os 2 mais novos é que vão a escola. Fez somente 7 ª classe não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua familia, e sustenta o pai enviando dinheiro para as despesas de casa. 
Saiu de Inhambane Para Maputo com os pais quando tinha 3 anos de idade, mais tarde foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório no tempo colonial. Depois da sua desmobilização começa a trabalhar na empresa Telecomunicações de Moçambique, onde fez acima de 25 anos de carreira profissional. Actualmente é reformado desta empresa e tem uma pensão de 5.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 28.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, pedra, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 11.200.00mt, 20.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência para oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
António V. was born in Inhambane province, in southern Mozambique. He is 59 years old, is married and has 5 children, ages 30, 24, 22, 17, and 12. The two youngest go to school. António only finished 7th grade; he didn't continue with school because he was drafted into military service. He lives in his own house with his family, and he supports his father by sending him money for household expenses. He left Inhambane for Maputo with his parents when he was 3 years old. Later, he was drafted into military service in the colonial era. After his demobilization, he began to work for Mozambique Telecommunications, where he spent more than 25 years of his professional career. He is currently retired from this company and has a pension of 5,500 MZN per month, which he uses for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account. António has never taken out loans from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is his fourth loan. He is asking for 28,000 MZN, with which he wants to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, stone, cement, sand and other items) to continue building his house. The earlier loans were for 11,200 MZN, 20,000 MZN and 20,000 MZN, all for the same purpose. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he can take out more loans. In the future, he would like to ask for more loans to finish his home and offer better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement and zinc sheets)

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Уринов Рустам проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее "Бухгалтер". Работает по профессии. Кроме того занимается растениеводством. Имеет земельный участок, где сажает пшеницу. В этой областе более 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Рустам хочет посеить и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Rustam U. lives in the town of Turzun-zoda. He is 56 years old. He is married and has four children. He has a degree in accounting and works in his profession. Besides his work he does agriculture. He has a plot of land where he plants wheat. He has been in this business for more than eight years. The loan will be used for purchase of mineral fertilizer. Rustam wants to sow and collect a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen .

texts.es:
En el barrio Germán Pomares   Municipio de Somotillo 
La señora B. G.  realiza su trabajo como  promotora del plan de ayuda alos niños pobres de occidente de Nicaragua
 Ella quiere el crédito para la compra de 15 bolsas de cemento Y  7 quintales de hierro  para la construcción  de un cuarto en su casa de habitación y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
In the Germán Pomares neighborhood, part of the Somotillo Municipality, Mrs. B. G. works as a an coordinator of the plan to help poor children from the west of Nicaragua. She would like the loan in order to buy 15 bags of cement and 7 hundred-weight of iron. These will be used to build a bedroom in her home and in this way improve the living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 bags of cement and 7 hundred-weight of iron for the construction of a new room in her home.

loans.name: Koipaso Enole

texts.en:
Koipaso Enole K. is 41 years old. She is married to Mainka K., and together they have seven children.

Koipaso is a farmer, and she does her farming on her own piece of land, something she has been doing for the last three years.

She learned about KADET from other women who were already registered members. This will be her first loan, and she is planning to use it to plant more wheat, which normally does well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Koipaso's dream is to do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To plant more wheat on her farm

loans.name: Espiritu Santo De Anchaq Wasi Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Espiritu Santo de Anchaq Wasi inicia su primer ciclo  con 10 socias. Las socias son de la Comunidad de Anchac Huasi, Distrito de Vinchos. Las actividades principales de la comunidad son la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de truchas.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de cereales, animales menores, tienda de abarrotes.
Como es el caso de la Señora Julia que es la presidenta del Banco comunal, Julia es casada y atiene 4 hijos, Julia se dedica a la venta de cereales que compra en las diferentes comunidades de la región y los comercializa en la ciudad de Pisco y Cañete. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de cereales, los sueños de Julia son comprar un terreno en ayacucho y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total de 3,500 soles.
texts.en:
The Espiritu Santo de Anchaq Wasi (Anchaq Wasi Holy Spirit) communal bank starts its first cycle with 10 members from Anchac Huasi community, Vinchos district. The community’s main activities are agriculture, cattle-raising and trout-raising. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities like: sale of cereals, small animal sales, grocery stores. Such is Julia’s case. She is the communal bank president; she’s married and has 4 children. Julia sells cereals that she buys in the various communities in the region and sells them in the cities of Pisco and Cañete. She will use the funds to buy cereals. Julia’s dreams are to buy a piece of property in Ayacucho and that her children become professionals. The members need loans in varying amounts: 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, totaling 3500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca Group

texts.es:
SEÑOR CAUTIVO DE AYABACA
La Alcancía Comunal Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca  es un grupo solidario y viene trabajando varios años con EDAPROSPO. Nuestra socia Nancy empezó su negocio de venta de carne y quesos en forma ambulatoria, con los préstamos recibidos en estos años pudo alquilar un local donde ahora tiene una tienda, además con muchos años de esfuerzo logro comprarse un terreno que empezara a construirlo con la ayuda de sus hijos.
La venta de productos de belleza le ayuda con los gastos en casa a Rosa que se desempeña en este negocio hace muchos años, ella tiene hijos a los que educar asi que se esfuerza por incrementar sus ventas, además su esposo es su compañía y la ayuda en este duro reto. Las socias invertirán los préstamos en la compra de mercadería, para incrementar sus negocios y así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
SEÑOR CAUTIVO DE AYABACA The communal bank "Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca" is a solidarity group that has been working with Edaprospo for several years. Our member, Nancy, started her business selling meat and cheese, as an ambulatory merchant. With the loans received over the years, she was able to rent a place to have a store. She has also, after many years of hard work, been able to buy herself some land that she will begin to build on with help from her children. Selling beauty products helps Rosa with the household expenses. She has had this business for many years. She has kids to educate which is why she is trying to increase her sales. Her husband is her company and helps her with this difficult goal. The group's members will invest the loans in the purchase of merchandise to grow their businesses and in this way be able to provide their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia T., 44 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Lucia owns and operates a farming business,  primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 17 years. She also dreams to have all her children finish college and find decent jobs for themselves.

In 2006, Lucia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and fertilizers. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Lucia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 51 years old, married, and the mother of three, aged 28, 26 and 10.  She sells secondhand clothes in an open air market called Toi Market.  She has been in this business for twenty years.  She also does tailoring as her part time job.  

She joined a group which consists of women entrepreneurs in Faulu Kenya with the aim of sharing business ideas, saving her money and being guaranteed her loan.  Through the group, she wants to take out her first loan of 20,000 KES.  She will use this loan to buy more clothes to sell.  She believes that with additional stock she will get more income.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en: Salwa A. is currently in the business of treating and weaving hair in a salon shop, and is requesting a loan to stock more weaving materials to sell.  Salwa is 25 years old and is married to a businessman. She has one child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock more weaving materials to sell.

loans.name: Filber

texts.es:
Filber nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 25 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su pareja y su hija Melodi de 4 años.
A los 21 años,  Filber aprendió  a reparte teléfonos móviles en la ciudad de Lima y después regreso al Cusco donde está ejerciendo su aprendizaje. 
 
Filber tiene una tienda en el centro comercial “El Paraíso”, donde hace mantenimiento y vende teléfonos móviles. Le pueden encontrar en su puesto de venta, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Filber que espera recibir S/. 2000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar más mercadería como teléfonos móviles. El sueño del socio es abrir una tienda de venta de computadoras personales y venta de ropa y zapatillas de marca. 

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Filber pertenece desde hace varios años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Filber, 25, lives in Cusco with his partner and their daughter, Melodi, 4. At the age of 21, Filber learned how to distribute mobile phones in Lima and then returned to Cusco where he is applying his knowledge. Filber has a store in the “El Paraíso” shopping center where he sells and repairs mobile phones. He can be found tending his store seven days a week from 9am until 9pm. Filber expects to get 2000 new soles in his next loan that he’d like to use to buy more merchandise like mobile phones. His dream is to open a personal computer, clothing and brand name slippers store. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” (Lord of Ccoyllority Cachimayo) communal bank has been in operation for three and a half years; Filber has been a member for several years and does well. The members of this communal bank are devoted to Taytacha Ccoyllority (Lord of the Shining Snow) and this is why they named their communal bank thus.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like mobile phones.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is married and sells clothing at an open market called “Belochka” which means “Squirrel”. She started this business three years ago. Today she has many repeat clients that buy clothing from her. Good prices and a large assortment are the keys to success according to Magdalina's definition.

Magdalina hopes to develop her business further and start one more location in the nearest future. She would like to borrow 6,400 Grivnas to purchase more inventory. She hopes to make additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Erkhembayar

texts.en:
Erkhembayar is a 26-year-old single man. He lives with his mother and younger brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Before 2009, he used to run a transportation business and left it because of the tough competition. Since 2009, he has been running a small variety store and his business has been expanding since then. He managed to finish building a family house. 

In Mongolia, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. He is the only breadwinner in this family and supports his old mother and younger brother. 

Currently, he is renting this shop on two-year agreement. His future plan is to build his own small shop. The reason he is asking for this loan is to make some internal renovations to the shop and to increase his profit by adding some working capital.

loans.use: To make some internal renovations to the shop and to increase his profit by adding some working capital

loans.name: Habibulo

texts.en: Habibulo M. is 47 years old and married with three children. For Habibulo, the harvest is what he enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting the vegetables that he will sell because the price will depend on the quality of the crops. Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family, even more when they sell for a good price at the market; that is the motivation to continue planting. This is the third loan that Habibulo has had with IMON International. He has been making his payments on time. And he is very grateful to those who support him because they allow him to provide well-being to his family. With the money requested, he will buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his farm. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn is 53 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Upper Langcangan, a part of Oroquieta City in Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Nelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store in her local community. Nelyn has been in business for about two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In June 2005 Nelyn joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is asking for a loan, her tenth from PMPC, of 14,900 PHP for additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Costant Mulwale Pascal

texts.en:
Costant Mulwale Pascal A. is 60 years old.  He is married to Lucia Mulwale, who is a farmer, and provides a source of additional income for the family. They have four adult children ages 44, 40, 38, and 36 years old. They live in Kibomet Kitale-Kenya.  He operates a butcher shop and has been in this business for 10 years, earning a monthly profit of 20,000 KES.

Costant learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer and is applying for a loan of 80,000 KES, with which he intends to buy four cows. With the anticipated profits, he plans to expand his butchery business.

In the future, Costant wishes to operates a supermarket and create job opportunities. His deeper desire is to live a standard type of life.

loans.use: To buy four cows

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s animal sales business. He buys animals such as buffalos and goats inexpensively from animal markets. Then he raises them and sells them to his customers. His work is time-intensive, but in the end it earns for him a good profit. With the loan, he will buy buffalos and goats for his animal sales business.
 
Sughran is a very supportive lady. She shares the financial burden for her family through her sewing business. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and receives regular orders every month. Her earning allows her to pay for the utilities. She is the mother of two sons, both of whom are enrolled in school and getting their education.  

Sughran is hopeful that through this loan investment, her husband will be able to improve the financial condition of his business by increasing his sales. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy buffalos and goats

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en: Evanson is a 61-year-old married man. He is blessed with five children. He has managed to educate three children and two are still in school. He has done this with financial support from Faulu Kenya. Evanson supplies cakes to hotels to earn a living. He also owns a stall where he sells secondhand clothes for extra income. He sees himself opening other branches in the future. Evanson has requested a loan of 90,000 KES to buy a scooter and a bicycle for goods distribution.

loans.use: To buy a scooter and a bicycle for goods distribution

loans.name: Pensando En El Futuro 6, 7 Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is the coordinator of her group, Pensando en el Futuro 6, 7 (Think about the Future). She makes her home in a simple structure with her four children. She says that her goal is to work and enable her children to have better living conditions. In the meantime she plans to continue cooking different dishes.

Elizabeth is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She will start her business with this loan. She plans to use it to invest in her new beauty salon, by purchasing a hair dryer and some beauty products. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed capital to develop her business and increase her household income. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's other Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsuL. with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer for her salon.

loans.name: Nilda Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Nilda; ella tiene 37 años. La socia es soltera, y se dedica la compra y venta de productos de belleza, ella vende cosméticos por catálogos, la socia trabaja repartiendo sus catálogos y una vez que tiene los cliente y hacen el pedido ella envía la solicitud y pide los productos que le encargaron, la socia desea incrementar sus ventas para ello pedirá los productos que estén en oferta y los mantendrá con ella para ofrecerlos en una siguiente campaña. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza en oferta para almacenar hasta la siguiente campaña.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nilda is a member of the 'Nuevo Amanecer del Cusco' (Cusco's New Dawn) community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Nilda is 37 years old.  She is single and works buying and selling beauty products.  She sells cosmetics through catalogs.  She delivers her catalogs and once her customers have made their orders with her, she sends in her request for the products that they have ordered.  Nilda would like to increase her sales.  She plans to order products that are on offer and keep them safe so that she can sell them to her customers during a later sales period.

Nilda is requesting this loan so that she can invest in buying beauty products that are on offer and store them for a later sales period.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy beauty products that are on offer and store them until a later sales period

loans.name: Nelson Kariuki

texts.en:
Nelson has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 15 years. He is 55 years old and married to Lucy Wanjiku.

Nelson was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of 40,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to plant potatoes this season. In the future, Nelson hopes to expand his farming and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: to plant potatoes

loans.name: El Zapote 3 Group

texts.es:
el grupo el zapote 3 esta integrado por 4 mujeres las cuales tienen mucho tiempo de conocerse, son amigas y vecinas de la misma comunidad, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

doña Angela O. se dedica a la venta de granos basicos (frijoles, maiz, arroz) en su casa de habitacion en el caserio el Zapote del Triunfo Choluteca, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
ademas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia,  Angela es madre de 3 hijos y en sus tiempos libres visitan la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de granos basicos.
 
la joven lizhet del Carmen O. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas en su casa de habitacion, es soltera y cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres.
Lizhet todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para elaborar sus ricas tortillas, las que vende en su comunidad. en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y agua. para tener una mayor produccion de tortillas.

doña Blanca Luz O. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Blanca es madre de 4 hijos, junto con su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante a su hijos.
en sus ratos libres cria gallinas y cerdos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar abarroteria para surtir su pulperia.

doña Deysi Isabel V. tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, Deysi es madre de 5 hijos los cuales 
los tiene estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad, sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar a su demas familiares.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
The 'El Zapote 3' group has 4 female members who have known each other for a long time.  They are friends and also neighbors who live in the same neighborhood.  Below we will provide details about the different business activities that they carry out:

Angela O. sells basic grains (beans, corn and rice) from her home in the village of Zapote del Triunfo, Choluteca.  She has been in this business for 5 years.  She also has her husband's help and they both work hard to get their family ahead.  Angela has three children and in their spare time they go to church.  She will use her loan to buy basic grains.

Young Lizhet del Carmen O. makes and sells tortillas from her home.  She is single and able to count on help from her parents.  Lizhet gets up at 4.00am every day in order to prepare the delicious tortillas that she sells in her neighborhood.  In her spare time she goes to church.  She will use her loan to buy corn, firewood, lime and water in order to produce more tortillas.

Blanca Luz O. sells convenience store items from her small grocery store which is located in her home. Blanca has 4 children and, together with her husband, she works hard to get her children ahead.  In her spare time she raises hens and pigs.  She will use her loan to buy groceries for her grocery store.

Deysi Isabel V. owns a small grocery store which is located in her home.  Deysi has 5 children who attend a local school.  In her spare time she visits other family members.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, soup, pasta, soft drinks, juice, corn, firewood, lime, water, wheat flour, soap, batteries, candles and matches.baterias, candelas, fosforos,

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LA ÑUSTA III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agripina; ella tiene 37 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia se dedica a la agricultura lleva años en este negocio la socia siembra café en su chacra y cada cierto tiempo empieza  a cosechar sus siembras para luego venderlos a sus clientes, a veces la socia viaja por todo el Valle Sagrado ofreciendo sus productos, esta la única  actividad que realiza por el momento la socia y de esta forma  saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas de café para seguir sembrando en su chacra.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "LA ÑUSTA III" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Calca in the department of Cusco.

The member's name is Mrs. Agripina.  She is 37 years old, has a live-in partner and five children.  She has been working in agriculture for several years,   growing coffee which she sells to her customers who are located throughout the Valle Sagrado area.  This is her only job and sole means of income for her family.

She plans to use the loan to buy coffee beans so she can continue growing the crop on her land.  She is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy coffee beans for planting

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 50 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de warikebougou, préfecture de Barouéli ; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de bétail, de condiments et de parfums.                                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire.                                                                         AMINATA D. compte acheter quelques de moutons et  chèvres sur pieds dans le village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place à la maison et au marché de Konobougou, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi Group, all married, are on average 50 years old, have six children and all live in large extended families in the village of Warikebougou, a prefecture of Barouéli, in the region of Ségou (the fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali).  They know each other through kinship ties, as neighbors and as friends.  They sell livestock, spices and perfume.  The women of the Benkadi Group are on their ninth group loan.

Aminata D. intends to purchase several sheep and goats by foot in the village and its surroundings.  She conducts her sales from her home and at the market of Konobougou, in cash and credit, to a clientele made up of men and women.

She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA which will be used to pay the loan installments, contribute to social ceremonies and the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing livestock

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn P. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old. Noralyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Noralyn owns & operates a business buying and selling clothing, like t-shirts & blouses, in the local community. She also sells silver-plated jewelry.  Noralyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Noralyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noralyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Noralyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products, like ready-to-wear clothing to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Noralyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, like ready-to-wear clothing to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 40 años es una luchadora madre soltera. Vive junto a sus 2 hijas: Salome y Noe, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Carita. Hace más 20 años se dedica a la siembra de papa, habas y arveja, en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que se sitúan paralelo a su casa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las horas de trabajo que requiere sacar el fruto maduro de la tierra, pues siente la alegría de poder vender sus cultivos después de tanto tiempo de trabajo. Según afirma en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma le compran a muy buen precio sus cosechas. Su mayor dificultad son los gastos que realiza en los estudios universitarios de sus hijos. Ahora está planeando viajar a la capital del país a comercializar sus sembríos, pues ahí son más cotizados. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada, pues el poyo que recibe de parte de su asociación le permite progresar. María, tiene sembrado habas y arveja en sus terrenos agrícolas. Por ello con el crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, para que sus cultivos maduren grandes y nutritivos.
texts.en:
María, 40, is a tenacious single mother living with her two daughters, Salome and Noe, in her own house located in the hamlet of Carita.  She’s been farming potatoes, broad beans and peas for over 20 years on her two hectares of farmland located next to her house.  What she enjoys most about her work is the hours needed to extract ripe fruit from the soil because she feels happy seeing her crops bear fruit after so much time. According to what she tells us, her crops are bought for very good prices at Tarma’s wholesale market.  

Her greatest difficulty is the expense associated with her children’s university studies.  She is planning to travel to the nation’s capital to sell her crops because they are priced higher there.

She belongs to the “Progreso Carita” communal bank and this is the ninth loan with MFP where she feels fulfilled because the support she gets from her association allows her to progress.

Maria has broad beans and peas planted in her fields so will use the loan to buy several sacks of organic manure so that her crops grow big and nutritious.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Erkinbek

texts.en:
Erkinbek S. is 48, married and has five children. He has been engaged in cattle breeding since 1985 and has managed to develop a farm with calves and milk cows. Also, he cultivates land with perennial herbs, clover and barley which serve as forage for his cattle. He sells part of the harvest to local customers.  

Erkinbek has applied for a loan of 65,000 KGS to purchase three bull calves, which will allow him to broaden his business. With the revenues, he plans to reconstruct his barn in order to provide good conditions for breeding animals. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase three bull calves.

loans.name: Hairolla

texts.en:
Hairolla, 45, is married and lives with his wife and three children in a house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His two older children, ages 10 and 12, attend local secondary school while the youngest one, 7 months old, stays at home. 

Hairolla manages an animal rawhide and herd-trading business between Bayan-Ulgii province and Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He started his business in 2004. He collects animal rawhides from Bayan-Ulgii herders and sells them to traders of Ulaanbaatar. Now his daily sales exceed 15,000-25,000 MNT with a net profit of 15-20%. His business was quite profitable which allowed him to deposit 10 million MNT. He is an honest and hard-working man who says, "I am planning to deposit more in the future." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more hides and cashmere for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more hides and cashmere

loans.name: Geysel Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Geysel del rosario P. Velásquez , tiene la edad de 25 años , habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , barrio  buenos aires , actualmente se encuentra soltera , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda , para poder tener un mejor condiciones de vida junto a sus padres ,  doña Geysel desde hace  trece años labora como agricultura , la mayor afectación son las plagas y enfermedades , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su papá , el cultivo de piña carece de fertilizantes e insumos lo cual tiene una coloración no muy buena y si no aplica urgente podría ser una pérdida total del mismo .El crédito lo quiere para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes .
texts.en: Geysel del Rosario P. Velásquez is 25 years old and currently single.  She lives in Buenos Aires neighborhood, in the town of Ticuantepe.  Her plans for her family are to improve the infrastructure of their home so that she and her parents can enjoy better living conditions.  Geysel has been working in farming for 13 years.  Her biggest problems are pests and plant diseases.  She started out in this business with her dad's support.  She currently lacks fertilizers and supplies for her pineapple crops which do not have a very good color.  If she doesn't apply these products urgently she could lose everything.  She would like this loan to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Zebedee

texts.en:
Zebedee is 62 years old and married. He has six children aged between 17 and 35. His youngest child is still attending school.

Zebedee has been practicing mixed farming for the last 25 years in Kitale town in western Kenya. His mixed farm produces eggs, maize and beans, which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his rental houses in the same location.

He recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 KES and has requested this loan of 80,000 KES to expand his poultry farm. 

This loan will enable him increase his stock of chickens and purchase enough poultry feed. He says that this loan will enable him expand his poultry farm and he will be able to get a steady income that will help improve his lifestyle. 

His biggest challenge has been the high death rates at the early stages of the chicks.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizer and seeds to plant corn

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es:
Jose Ramiro tiene 23 años, es soltero vive con  los padres, no tiene hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

Jose  se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir trabajando y tener dinero para estudiar

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
José Ramiro is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents, in Agua Clara, in Chillanes canton.  He does not have any children.

The Virgen del Huayco community bank has 14 members and is located in Loma de Guacalgoto, 20 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The members of this bank work in farming, growing corn and beans.  Some of them sell flour or animals.

José is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and makes his sales in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help José to buy supplies for his crops.  The loan supported him in increasing his crop production.  His dream is to buy a plot of land so that he can continue working and to make money so that he can study.

José enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops

loans.name: Los Trinfadores Group

texts.en: Rigoberto, Erika, and Reyna, all of whom reside in San Lorenzo, Honduras, formed the “Los Trinfadores” solidarity group in June, 2011. Both Rigoberto and Erika make a living by selling clothing and small household appliances such as fans and irons. They are requesting loans of Lps. 5,000 with which to purchase merchandise. Reyna makes a living by running a small convenience shop, selling basic foodstuffs and household consumer products. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 5,000 to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, small appliances and convenience store merchandise.

loans.name: Ana Adelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Adelina; ella tiene 20 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite entre otros productos, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos al por mayor para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Adelina is a member of the Mama Simona Community Bank which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco. She is 20 years old and lives with her partner and son. As well as her household duties, she runs a grocery store selling staples such as rice, sugar, pasta, oil etc. She works from 6am to 10pm.

Because of the income from the store, Ana can support her son. She wants to expand the business and increase stock. She will use the loan to buy products at wholesale prices.

Ana is very pleased to get a loan and promises to repay it.

loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale prices for her grocery store

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: It is a big responsibility of the parent to be the head of the family. Mrs. Sin never takes time to visit or talk freely with someone else. She always takes care of how to earn more cash for her family. Nowadays she is a farmer. When she takes time from this business, Mrs Sin is a fish seller around her village. She earns about $2.5 per day. Talking to her husband, he is a supreme person who always takes care of her and all their children. He works as a construction worker in his community. Mrs. Sin wishes a loan of perhaps $250 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pumping machine.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and a pumping machine.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Merly is a farmer and grows bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to purchase banana plants and to pay for the labor. 
Merly has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Merly hopes to improve the living condition of her family and to save for the education of her children .

loans.use: To purchase banana plants  and pay for a worker

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandra; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente del nivel primario, ella trabaja en el distrito de Maras desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y también se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde siembra espinaca y luego lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba, por medio de este trabajo y negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de agricultura sembrando espinaca y también mejorar en el trabajo como docente. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas de espinaca y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Señor Pasión” communal bank located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.  
Alejandra, 37, is the member.  She’s single and has a son.  She alternates her daily chores with working as an Elementary School Teacher.  She works in Maras District from 8am until 7pm.  She also farms.  She has a field where she grows spinach that she then sells in Urubamba’s market.  Through this work and business she’s able to support her son.  She wants to expand the farming planting spinach and also improve her work as a teacher.  She is asking for a loan to buy spinach seeds and fertilizer for her fields.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy spinach seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Unisa B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are a group of teachers from Feredugu, a village in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 6,500,000 Leones (SLL) from SMT, a Kiva partner in Makeni city. With the help of this loan, they will be able to settle their immediate financial constraints and then gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. 

Unisa is their leader. Born in a village called Boya Romende, the 51 year old is married and has seven children, five of whom are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Unisa has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children and to renovate his house.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and to renovate his house

loans.name: Misiratkhan's Group

texts.en:
Misiratkhan is fifty and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised a son and five daughters. The son is a farmer, two younger daughters work in Russia and the other daughters are married and live separately with their families.

Misiratkhan farms rice and corn as well as breeding and reselling livestock after fattening them. In this way she earns money to meet the family’s daily needs.

Misiratkhan is the leader of this group. With her portion of this loan she wants to purchase two sheep for breeding and hire labor for harvesting her crops.

In the future Misiratkhan wishes to see her younger daughters get married.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep for breeding and hire labor for harvesting her crops.

loans.name: Jaih

texts.en: Jaih is 40 years old and lives with his wife and children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Bayan-Ulgii province in Mongolia. His wife works at the local company. His two children are high school students. He started his business in 1999 by selling livestock. He has been managing the same business until now. He started the business with turnover capital of 200,000 MNT. Now this turnover has increased to 800,000 MNT. Now he owns a commercial space to sell the livestock at the local market. He is a diligent and hard working man who says, "When my business goes well and make more profits, I plan to purchase a car." He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat at whole sale price.

loans.use: To purchase more meat at whole sale price

loans.name: Naiba

texts.en:
Naiba is 34 years old. She is a very active and passionate woman. She started her business in 2006 and since then has become a well-experienced and skilled woman and many people of her village come to ask her for advice about keeping livestock. Her primary activity is selling sheep for meat production. 

Naiba, together with her husband, runs the business. The income from sheep selling is 200 USD, and Naiba would like to expand her activity in this field. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of 600 AZN. She will use this loan to purchase 6 sheep.

loans.use: to purchase six sheep

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 28-year-old single man from Baqa'a, Jordan.

Yousef has a grocery store and is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to make new decorations for the store.

Yousef is looking to expand his business by adding new products for his store, such as frozen food.

loans.use: to make new decorations for the store

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 29-year-old married man with two children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to buy a taxi and also to construct a permanent house. He has been riding a bicycle as a form of transport for the last eleven years. He has faced the challenge of mechanical breakdowns, but has managed to survive and support his family. Vincent needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 51 years old and lives in Tinago, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is separated from her husband and has eight children.

To earn a living, Gloria has a business in which she makes salted tiny shrimp to eat. She earns about 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work.  Gloria requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase ingredients to produce salted tiny shrimp food.

Gloria has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 10 months. In the future, Gloria would like to grow and sustain her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her salted tiny shrimp food production.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline's priority in life is to uplift her family's living conditions. She has four children attending school and needs to pay for their daily allowances. She wants to earn consistent profits for their education. She described herself as a small entrepreneur, yet a hardworking woman. She raise hogs to fatten and breed and usually sells them to butchers who come into her village. She earns about PHP 3,000 whenever she sells a raised hog. 

She wants to improve her business, that is why she is asking for additional capital to provide good nutrition for her hogs. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy hog feeds, vitamins and medicines. This loan will help her grow her hogs and be able to sell them at a higher cost upon distribution. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her pigpen and maintain the safety and good growth of her hogs and also to continuously educate her children.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines to ensure the good nutrition of her hogs.

loans.name: Rita Lorena

texts.es:
Doña Rita, sigue con su negocio de venta de reposteria, pizza, queques, en donde ha captado mas clientes, su objetuvo ha sido la mejora a su casa, el cual ha venido por parte construyendo.
Es soltera y sus hijos casados, el cual la  apoyan economicamente, Rita logro terminar el cambio electrico de su casa, dando seguridad a su familia,  y ahora hara mejoras en el baño, y cambio de tuberias de aguas negras, ya que le esta dando problema, y es necesario hacer la mejora, logrando mantener la higiene en su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Rita is continuing with her business selling confections, pizza and cakes.  She has gained more customers for her business.  Her goal has been to make improvements to her home, which is only partially constructed.
Doña Rita is single and her children are married.  They help her financially.  Rita replaced the electrical wiring in her house, which made her house safer for her family.  Now she will make improvements to her bathroom and replace the sewage pipes, since they have been causing problems.  This improvement is necessary to maintain hygiene in her home.

loans.use: to make improvements to her bathroom and to replace the sewage pipes, which will help maintain her family's hygiene.

loans.name: Concepcion Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Concepcion está integrado por tres socias, las cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales. La coordinadora del Grupo es Felicita, ella tiene 47 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Juticalpa, su familia esta conformada por su esposo quien es Tractorista y sus cinco hijos. 

A los 18 años de edad Felicita inició a trabajar como empleada domestica y lo hizo por 13 años. Ahora ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, quesadillas y pan. Trabaja con su hija menor y con una hermana, inicia a hornear a las 4:00 am y termina a las 8:00 am y luego tiene una empleada quien es la que vende de forma ambulante los productos.

Ella solicita este préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mas materia prima como ser leña, maiz y maseca; asi de esta forma podra cumplir con los encargos de producto que algunos clientes le han hecho para estas fiestas navideñas. Con el apoyo de este prestamo Felicita espera aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar y tambien comprar 3 hornos y asi poder ser una fuente de empleo en la comunidad. Tiene cuatro años de ser cliente de FAMA y con los prestamos obtenidos ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción Solidarity Group has three members who work in different business activities.  Felicita is the coordinator of the group.  She is 47 and lives in the town of Juticalpa.  Her family consists of her husband, who works as a tractor driver, and her five children.

At the age of 18 Felicita began to work as a domestic worker, and she did it for 13 years.  Now she works making and selling "rosquillas" [a type of doughnut], "quesadillas" [a cheese dessert], and bread.  She works with her youngest daughter and with a sister.  She begins baking at 4:00 a.m. and finishes at 8:00 a.m., and later she has an employee who is the one who sells the products on foot.

She is requesting this loan so she can have the money necessary to buy more ingredients such as firewood, corn, and Maseca corn flour.  In this way she will be able to fulfill the product orders that some customers have requested of her for the Christmas season.

With the support of this loan Felicita hopes to increase her profits and in this way improve the finances of her home, and also buy three ovens to be able to be a source of employment in the community.  She has been a client of FAMA for four years and she has been able to get her family ahead with the loans obtained.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, and corn flour.

loans.name: Salicou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  SALICOU  est né en 1985 à Dioumaténé préfecture de KADIOLO et il réside à Kadiolo  dans une famille monogame.
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans réussite, Monsieur  SALICOU  décide de mener les activités d’achats et de ventes de téléphones portables, façades et autres accessoires et le transfert d’unité il y a 5 ans. Il s'approvisionne à Bamako sur commande. Acheminé à Kadiolo, les produits sont stockés dans une boutique au marché, il vend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et femmes . 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Il compte acheter des téléphones portables et une quantité importante d'accessoires :  batteries et façades.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA dont  une partie sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts de son prêt et l’autre partie sera investis dans son activité.
Il compte devenir un grossiste dans la ville de Kadiolo.
texts.en:
Salicou was born in 1985 in Dioumaténé, Kadiolo prefecture and he lives in Kadiolo in a monogamous family. 

After having run many businesses without success, Salicou decided to manage a business buying and selling cell phones, cases and other accessories and the transfer of units five years ago. He gets his supplies in Bamako by order. Dispatched to Kadiolo, the products are stocked in a shop in the market. He sells for cash to a clientèle made up of men and women. 

To satisfy his increasingly growing clientèle, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first individual loan. He plans to buy cell phones and a significant quantity of accessories: batteries and cases. 

He envisions making an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA with this loan, of which one part will be used to pay the interest on his loan and the other part will be invested in his business. He plans to become a wholesaler in the town of Kadiolo.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
This is Jean, 33, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Marvin, an electrician. Jean is a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jean operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jean hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: María Benita

texts.es:
Con gran ahínco la señora María Benita se dedica a laborar con el fin de proporcionarles a sus hijos las mejores condiciones de vida para su desarrollo principalmente por medio de la educación escolar. Es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, donde ha vivido toda su vida, dedicándose a laborar en una institución de dicho municipio.

Es madre soltera de dos hijos los que está educando con esfuerzo propio y de la mejor manera posible, ya que es una persona luchadora, trabajadora y sobre todo con mucha honradez.

Actualmente, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de útiles escolares y uniformes para sus hijos, ya que se acerca la temporada de inicio de clases por lo que necesita prepararlos con todas la condiciones para el inicio escolar y así puedan desarrollarse intelectualmente.
texts.en:
María Benita works very diligently to provide her children with the best living conditions for their development, principally by means of their education. She is a lifelong resident of El Sauce, where she works for a municipal agency.
