She is a single mother of two children, whom she is educating in the best manner possible through her own efforts, since she is a tenacious, hardworking, and above all very honorable person.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase school supplies and uniforms for her children, since the start of classes is approaching and she needs to prepare them with all of the necessary items for the start of school and their continuing intellectual development.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and uniforms for her children.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa de treinta y siete años vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella se dedica a la carpintería elabora todo tipo de muebles, mesas, bancos, sillas, entre otros, tiene varios años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor y obtener la mejor mueblería del lugar su negocio está ubicado en el lugar de su residencia, trabaja al gusto de las personas que solicitan su servicio ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precio accesibles y con un servicio excelente siempre está a la orden de los clientes; Elisa es una mujer entregada a su labor, visionaria quiere un futuro más próspero por eso siempre está en la búsqueda de oportunidades que lo hagan llegar al éxito, quiere hacer crecer el negocio ahora que la demanda ha aumentado pero necesita de capital que respalde la inversión de materia prima por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar madera por mayor y mantenimiento de herramientas de trabajo como cepilladora, sierra etc. Elisa tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.

loans.use: madera por mayor, mantenimiento de herramienta

loans.name: Mahugnon De Djokombi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON DE DJOKOMBI est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Valérie Hélène Baï, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 39 ans est mariée à un peintre nommé Grégoire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Valérie Hélène Baï vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Valérie Hélène Baï et son mari. Valérie Hélène Baï a très fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Valérie Hélène Baï vend des produits de mercerie et des divers produits à son domicile depuis une vingtaine d’année. Valérie Hélène Baï s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Valérie Hélène Baï sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON DE DJOKOMBI un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits de mercerie.

loans.name: Milia

texts.en: Milia from Kilolo district. She is 28 years old, married and lives with her husband. She is a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches life skills to students. Milia runs a market store business near her village, where she sells onions and tomatoes. She uses her profit to pay for household expenses. She requests a Kiva loan to improve her business by buying varieties of tomatoes and onions to cater to the community's daily cooking needs. The profit obtained from the loan will help Milia to pay for household expenses for her family.

loans.use: to improve her business by buying varieties of tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Marlon Francisco

texts.en:
My name the Marlon Francisco, I have a business of clothes used located in the central part of this city. I've been selling clothes for several years so that I can pay for my childrens' education. Right now, I could use the loan for transportation so that I can get to neighboring towns to sell my clothes there. This will help me generate the profits I need to pay back the loan.

SPANISH

Mi nombre el Marlon Francisco, tengo un negocio de ropa usada ubicado en la parte central y mas transitable en esta ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad. Con la que podido dar educacion a mis hijos, en este momento necesito vender mas para poder comprar mi propio carro y visitar otras comunidades y lograr mayores ingresos en mis ventas.

loans.use: Compra de fardos de ropa usada clasificada

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sabena would wish to buy a water tank

loans.name: Sayaad Ahamad

texts.en: Sayaad Ahamad is 40 years old. He lives in a household of eight in District 6 of Kabul,  Afghanistan. He is married and lives with his family of five children. He has a retail-food business. Working on it now, he wants to take a loan to buy extra things like rice, milk, baskets and other materials to make a big business and to find extra clients. Also, he has six years of experience with the shop. He is sure that he can work with this loan and he is very happy now.

loans.use: To buy more rice, milk and extra material.

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Mrs. T. sells foodstuffs and cold drinks to the public. She needs a loan of US$250  to improve her business. That way, she hopes to be able to take better care of her family's needs, especially her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase of more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Minayat

texts.en: Minayat has been in this business for one year. He and his family live in the town of Khachmaz.  He is a 46-year-old man with 4 children. Minayat uses this car to distribute goods to stores. Now he needs a loan of $825 to buy spare parts to service this car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Ea

texts.en:
Mrs. Ea S. is 27 years old, married with three children, and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to take care of her three little children, who are too young to attend school. Her husband is the one who works very hard to support his entire family. He usually gets up early in the morning to drive a motor-taxi to transport his regular customers as well as other passengers in his area.

Mrs. Ea S. is humbly requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to replace his old one which breaks down often.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to replace his old one which breaks down often

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: I am Safia B. from Lahore, a big and busy metropolitan in Pakistan. I am a mother of five children, two boys and three girls. My husband runs an artificial jewelry business. He get orders from various shops in the city and supplies them the required jewelry. Last year, he took a loan and bought the machine that is used to make jewelry. The machine enabled him to work efficiently, which eventually led to better profits. We bought a color television with these profits. Now, my husband requires another loan of $425 to further expand his business. He will buy the raw materials in bulk that are required in the making of the jewelry.

loans.use: Expand jewelry business

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en: Zaynab is a 25-year-old woman. She is single and lives in the Beirut suburbs. Zaynab loves computers and enjoys working in this sector. She repairs and carries out the maintenance of computers. Zaynab needs $300 to buy the needed material to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy material for her business

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Mrs. Seak S., age 49, is a widow and a mother of six children. She is employed by a garment factory making on average $5 each day. Also, two of her children are employed by a garment factory and make collectively $150 each month; two are unemployed; and two are enrolled in school. This loan will be used to purchase a taxi for one of her unemployed children to drive in order to generate additional profit for her household. Since they all live together, this will benefit the entire family.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi to operate a business.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
When she divorced her husband 34 years ago, all of a sudden Genara faced the responsibility of caring for her five children by herself. As time went on, the sale of clothing she herself made was no longer enough to support her family. For that reason, in 1983, she decided to open a general store. Things were going well, but lack of time forced her to close the business since she needed to take care of her younger children. Because of this she continued making clothing and worked in whatever other business appeared at the time, such as the sale of fish, sale of food, etc.

Three years ago, one of her daughters suggested that she reopen the store. Since she had continued to pay the yearly business license fee to her city, it was no problem to reopen. Because of this, thanks to her daughter´s support and a loan from EDAPROSPRO, she able to open the store again.

With a lot of effort, Genera gets ahead in her business. Fortunately her children are grown now and help her once in a while. However, she thinks about growing the business even more because now she needs to take care of two illnesses which she suffers from, diabetes and osteoporosis.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Con el divorcio de su esposo, hace treinta y cuatro años, Genara, de pronto, se vio con la responsabilidad de cuidar a sus cinco hijos ella sola. Conforme pasaba el tiempo, la venta de ropa que ella misma confeccionaba no era suficiente para mantener a su hogar. Por ello, en el año 1983 decidió abrir una bodega. Todo iba yendo bien, pero la falta de tiempo la obligo a cerrar el negocio, pues debía ocuparse de atender a sus hijos menores aún. Así que continúo con la confección de ropas y alguno que otro negocio que se le presentaba en el momento, como la venta de pescados, venta de comidas, etc.

Hace tres años, una de sus hijas le propuso volver a abrir la tienda. Ya que ella continuaba pagando año tras año el permiso que la municipalidad le había otorgado de tener un negocio en su casa, no fue un problema reinaugurarla. Fue así que, gracias al apoyo de su hija y al préstamo que le brindo EDAPROSPO pudo volver a abrir su bodega.

Actualmente, Genara lleva con mucho esfuerzo su negocio adelante, felizmente sus hijos ya están grandes y la ayudan de vez en cuando. Sin embargo, ella piensa en hacer crecer su negocio aun más porque ahora debe encargarse de las dos enfermedades que la molestan, diabetes y osteoporosis.

loans.use: Supply her store with more products.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
I am Shamim K., a mother of five: four girls and one boy. One of my daughters is married; the remaining three sew clothes, while my son works at a local company. I am a cook at someone’s house, and my husband is a rickshaw driver. Last year, I got a loan from Asasah and bought my daughters sewing machines, and this year we need a loan to repair our rickshaw.

I have been joined in my loan group by three other women: Chanda Z., who also wants this loan to fix her rickshaw; Asiah J., who sews clothes for her neighborhood clients, and Parween L., who sells cloth. This loan will be distributed among the group members either for their own business or their household’s commerce.

loans.use: To repair our rickshaw

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is a very hard working person and she is demanding of herself in every job that she starts. For years at her husband's siD. she has been working support her 4 children who are now grown men and women. Now that she is only living with her dear husband she works in the areas that are within her reach; she raises guinea pigs which are a great help in supporting themselves and despite the frigid climate in her area she keeps them well fed and in safe keeping so that she can realize the fruits of her labor. She has her own alfalfa crop field to proviD. the daily feed for her little animals. She would like to improve her farm and buy the necessary things for the construction of a barn in order to augment her sales and breeding business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mercedes es una persona muy trabajadora y se auto exige en cada trabajo que emprenD., durante años al lado D. su esposo han estado trabajando para mantener a sus 4 hijos que ahora son hombres y mujeres D. bien, ahora sola en compañía D. su amado esposo trabaja en las tareas que están a su alcance; ellos crían cuyes los cuales son D. vital ayuda para sostenerse y a pesar del clima frígido D. su zona los mantiene muy bien y a buen recaudo para observar los frutos D. su trabajo. Cuenta con su propio campo D. cultivo D. alfalfa para disponer del alimento diario D. sus animalitos. Desea mejorar su granja y comprar lo necesario para la construcción D. sus galpones a fin D. una mejor distribución y crianza.

loans.use: Construction of a barn for her animals

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 38-years old and a married mother with three children. She has sold lingerie for both men and women in the local market for 10 years. She travels to Accra to buy her products and retails them for profit. She will use the loan to buy more lingerie and expand her operation. Monica is a member of the group called "Bo Bra Pa" meaning live a Good Life. Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's under garment stock

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is 43 years old. She is married with five children. She is a very busy woman who balances motherhood and business pressures. She admits, ‘it is very challenging’.

Dora started trading in both dry fish and garment clothes ten years ago. They are two entirely different commodities. Dora sells clothes for additional income. The dedication and zeal she attaches to her work has made her one of the most successful traders in Obuasi.

Dry fish is suitable for preparation of fish meals, soup and sauces. She obtains her supply from a town called Yeji on the eastern side of Ghana.

Dora wants to use the loan to buy bulk stock of dry fish and garment clothes to meet the needs of her customers. She hopes to use part of the profit to pay for her children’s educational fees.

She belongs to the community group called, "God is Able Trust Group." In this group, group members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

Dora is the one standing in this photograph. The photo was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bulk stock of dry fish and garment clothes.

loans.name: Songnonyé (Soumission Mutuelle) Group

texts.fr:
The seven members of the Songnonyé Group average 39 years of age and four children. They live for the most part in monogamous households in the Bagadadji district of the city of Ségou (Republic of Mali).

The members of the group are brought together around their work and have been collaborating for five years now. The leader of the group, having benefited from training (through the support of the Ségou Dept. of the Promotion of Women) in how to dye fabrics and to make soap, has by turns trained the other members of her group and her association. Besides working with dyes and making soap, they sell firewood, rice, condiments, and clothing, etc....

In order to obtain further financial resources, the women of the Songnonyé Group have decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their first loan. With this loan, they intend to buy one role of white damask (very popular fabric in West Africa) that will be dyed before being sold; six lengths of Wax pagnes (traditional print cloth); two cart loads of firewood; and one sack of rice. They generally get their stock from neighboring villages (such as Zambougou) for the firewood; from the Office of Niger in Niono for the rice (the biggest management and production organization for rice in West Africa); and from the grand marketplace of Ségou for the clothing, tubers, and condiments.

Sales are made locally in Ségou (in the district marketplaces) and generally at the retail level, with cash and sometimes credit. Sales are also accomplished in the home and at the weekly markets of the surrounding villages. They hope to realize an average monthly benefit of 20,000 francs CFA and wish to be better organized to perfect their training, notably in working with dyes and in making soap, in order to offer quality products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Les sept (7) membres du groupe Songnonyé ont une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des foyers monogamiques au quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (République du Mali).

Les membres du groupe se sont regroupés autour de leurs activités économiques et collaborent depuis maintenant 5 ans. La responsable du groupe ayant bénéficié d’une formation (à travers un appui du département de la Promotion Féminine de Ségou.), en teinture et en fabrication de savon a tour à tour formé les autres membres de son groupe et de son association. En plus de la teinture et de la fabrication de savon, elles vendent aussi le bois de chauffe, le riz, les condiments, les habits etc…..

Afin d’obtenir une ressource financière complémentaire les femmes du groupe Songnonyé ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter 1 rouleau bazin blanc (tissu très prisé en Afrique de l’ouest) qui sera teint avant la vente, 6 pièces de pagnes wax, 2 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe et 1 sac de riz. Elles s’approvisionnent généralement dans les villages voisins (tel Zambougou) en bois de chauffe, en riz à l’office du Niger à Niono (la plus grande structure d’encadrement et de production de riz de l’Afrique de l’Ouest) et au grand marché de Ségou pour les habits, les tubercules et les condiments.

Les ventes sont faites sur place à Ségou (dans les marchés de quartiers) généralement en détail au comptant quelques fois à crédit. Les ventes sont également effectuées à domicile et dans les foires des villages environnants. Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA. et souhaitent s’organiser davantage pour parfaire leurs formations notamment en teinture et dans la fabrication du savon afin d’offrir des articles de qualité.

loans.use: To buy cloth, pagnes, rice, and firewood

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
They group came together with 14 people, the majority of whom work selling Herbalife products, and some of whom sell goods in bulk at the big markets. They meet on Wedesday afternoons at the president, Hilaria's, house. She sells bric-a-brac, Ronal sells clothing items, Celia sells used plastics, Juana sells American clothing, Delia sells shoes on the street, Eusebio sells cel phones, Silvia sells detergent, Melquiades sells Herbalife products, Rosmery sells a food dish called 'salchipapas', Isabel sells cel phones, Rosenda sells sweets and things, Cipriano makes clothes, Gabinasells seeds and pesticides, and lastly Olga sells fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El grupo fue desembolsado el en presencia de 14 personas, la mayoría de quienes componen este grupo son personas que trabajan con la venta de productos Herbafife y algunas son vendedoras mayoristas de la super feria es así que quedaron en reunirse los Días miércoles por la tarde en casa de la presidenta la sra. Hilaria que se también se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, por otra parte Ronal también elabora prendas de vestir, Celia también vende plásticos usados, Juana también vende ropa americana, Delia también vende zapatos en la calle, Eusebio también vende celulares, Silvia también vende detergentes, Melquíades vende solo productos de Herbalife, Rosmery vende salchipapas, Isabel vende celulares, Rosenda vende dulces y variedades, Cipriano elabora prendas de vestir, Gabina vende semillas y pesticidas y por último Olga vende frutas.

loans.use: Operations' capital/Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio. Aurelia es separada, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Aurelia se dedica a la producción de joyas de metales finos (oro y plata), actividad que aprendió observando cuando trabajaba como ayudante en una joyería, y posteriormente perfecciono su técnica estudiando unos meses. Actualmente Aurelia tiene un taller en un local alquilado ubicado a 1 cuadra de la plaza principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en algunas oportunidades cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, Aurelia crea sus propios diseños como también realiza los modelos que le solicitan sus clientes.

Aurelia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de oro. Aurelia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, implementar su joyería con todas las maquinarias necesarias y construir otra casa.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the Imperio Communal Bank (a group loan). She is 38 years old, separated from her husband and has five children. She makes jewelry from precious metals (gold and silver), a trade she learned from observing when she used to work as an assistant in a jewelry store. She then spent several months studying to perfect her technique. She currently has her own workshop located a block from the main plaza in the city of Ayacucho. Her children sometimes help her out at work. Aurelia creates her own designs and also does custom designs as per the requests of her clients.

Aurelia needs a loan of 1050 soles (about $375), which she will use to buy gold. She dreams of her children growing up to be professionals, of buying all the necessary equipment for her jewelry workshop, and of building another house.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gold to make jewelry

loans.name: Oeu

texts.en:
Oeu, S., 50, is married with six children and lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband work buying fish from a river dock to resell at a market for a profit. Each day she can typically make around $5/day of profit. 
This couple has applied a loan from KIVA to purchase more fish to increase their profit.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to increase her profit margin.

loans.name: Malim

texts.en: Mrs. Malim L. is a villager in Srae Vong Village in Takeo Province. She is a 27 year old widow with an 11 year old child currently attending a local school. She owns a small grocery store in the local market.  Since she is a widow and has only one business, she cannot support the family very well. She is asking for a loan to buy a cow to breed in hopes of increasing her income after she sells her cow.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora J. sells cakes and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Flora is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a soldier. She has three children, who are all in school. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling cakes.

loans.name: Adzavouvou

texts.fr: Mme A. Adzavouvou est née en 1961, mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle est revendeuse de  condiments  (tomate, piment, sel, huile) et autres ingrédients de cuisine. Mais le manque de moyens financiers la handicape sérieusement. En vue de bien se ravitailler régulièrement en marchandise et avoir une clientèle fidèle, elle sollicite un financement. Ce qui lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adzavouvou A. was born in 1961. Married and the mother of two children, she sells condiments (tomatoes, hot peppers, salt, oil) and other cooking ingredients. The lack of financial means handicaps her significantly. With the intention of being able to stock up on merchandise regularly so as to develop a faithful clientele, she has requested a loan. This will allow her to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mr. Ban V., 25, and his wife, Mrs. Sinat Khan, 30, live in a small village off of National Road number Two about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 2006 and they have no children. Ban's sister, brother, and his parents live with them.
 
Ban has been farming for over 10 years, a skill he learned from his father. He grows tomatoes and cucumbers. Mrs. Sinat Khan has been a garment factory worker for 13 years. Ban is requesting his first loan. He is asking for $400 USD to purchase a water pump machine for the farm and to buy some parts so his bother can repair his motor remoque trailer (motor taxi).

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine and to repair his brother's motor taxi.

loans.name: Conforte

texts.fr: A. Conforte est revendeuse de céréales au marché d’Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle exerce ce métier depuis des années et espère avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce en approvisionnant son magasin afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et d’éviter des ruptures de stocks. Conforte est âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants
texts.en:
A. Conforte is a reseller of cereal grains at the market place in Avetonou, a village located about 100 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. She has been doing this for many years and hopes that this loan will increase her business by restocking her store to meet her customers needs and preventing a shortage of inventory. A. Comforte is 49 years old, married and mother of 4 children.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corm, millet, beans and peanuts for resale

loans.name: Juaquina

texts.es:
La señora Juaquina H. D. M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas”, en el distrito D. Desaguadero, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 66 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios D. secundaria completa. 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 años, se dedica a la compra y venta D. frutas al por mayor y menor, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir frutas en cajas (plátanos, tunas,  peras, etc.).  
Ella viene solicitando actualmente un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir mercaderías para su negocio, es decir fruta según la época y temporada (plátanos, sandías, etc.) asimismo desea adquirir gaseosas según lo que le pidan sus clientes; ella desea continuar trabajando con Manuela Ramos hasta que la vida le siga dando fuerzas; asimismo su anhelo es comprarse ganado para D. esta manera asegurar su vejez..
texts.en:
Juaquina H. D. M. is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas” (“United Women”) Community Bank, in the Desaguadero district of Chucuito province, in the state of Puno. She is 66 years old, married, has two children, and has completed secondary school.

Juaquina has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for six years. She buys and sells fruit wholesale and retail. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, with which she was able to purchase cases of fruit (bananas, prickly pears, pears, etc.).

She is now requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles, which she promises to repay in three monthly installments. With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for her business, specifically fruit according to the season and time of year (bananas, watermelon, etc.). She would also like to purchase soft drinks, as her customers have requested them.

Juaquina wants to keep working with Manuela Ramos for the rest of her life. Her dream is to purchase cattle to proviD. security in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business (bananas, watermelon, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Nomindalai

texts.en:
Nomindalai H. lives with her husband and two children in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her daughter is a student in the University of Arts and Culture in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and her son is a high school student. 
Nomindalai runs a clothing stall in the local market and sells secondhand clothes imported from China. Her husband is a taxi driver and also helps with her business whenever he has the time. She started the clothing business in 2003. It has been quite successful. She frequently goes to Ereen, China - a border town where many goods are purchased for importation to Mongolia. There she buys cheap secondhand clothes for her retail business. 
Nomindalai's dream is to see her daughter perform on TV, as she is so talented and is doing so well in her studies. The University of Arts and Culture has produced many well-known Mongolian artists. Although university tuition is expensive, this mother hopes to do well in her business so she can continue to support her daughter's education. She requests a loan to purchase more secondhand clothes from China.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes from China

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: La sra. Jacqueline trabaja ya dos años con la institución, es muy buena cliente, ella se dedica a la comercialización de condimentos, como aji molido, ajo molido, locoto molido, pimienta y comino, ella compra los condimentos por quintal, los muele en la máquina y los envasa para ponerlos a la venta, su producto se llama “El Cocinero”, lleva a venderlos a la ciudad de Oruro, Potosí y en El Alto de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja conjuntamente con su papá. Tiene un hijito en edad escolar, ella sola se ocupa de su manutención. Es una cliente muy puntual y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jacqueline has worked for two years with this institution and is a very good customer. She markets condiments like ground garlic, ground chili, crushed locoto peppers, pepper and cumin. She buys the condiments per quintal, mills it in a machine and then packages it to be sold, her product is called "The Chef". She brings them to sell in Oruro, Potosí and El Alto in La Paz, where she works together with her father. Her son is of school age and she is responsible for his taking care of him. She is a very punctual and responsible customer.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of yellow and red pepper.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita A. is married with four dependents and has received an education through Junior High School.  Since 2004 Rita has sold groceries like milk, Milo (a powdered malted milk product) and canned goods. She is asking for a loan to purchase more groceries for resale.  Rita plans to reinvest the profits from this new loan back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for resale

loans.name: Nambusi Allen's Group

texts.en:
Allen is the leader of 5 members of a group. She is 27 and a single mother of four children, aged between 2 and 8 years. Three of her children go to school. She rents a one-roomed house where she is staying with five people. Allen doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Allen sells second-hand clothes in Nakulabye Market, in one of Kampala's suburbs. She sells to an average of 15 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Allen buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She uses public transport to and from shopping.

Her major monthly expenses include medication for the family, rent, school fees, and feeding the family. She has been in her business for the last ten years. Her main challenge is the rainy season which stops her customers from coming to her.

Allen has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her thirteenth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothes, aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a pemanent home which will act as business premises. .

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Amaro

texts.en:
Amaro V. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs at the restaurant to sell. Amaro is 39 years old and married to a businessman. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase land for building a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are all delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. 

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs at the resturant to sell

loans.name: Bersy

texts.es: Bersy tiene 36 años, es una mujer que ha sabido progresar sola en la vida, vive de manera independiente en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. En el distrito de Nuñoa (distrito de la provincia de Melgar del departamento de Puno) Bersy tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable, lleva realizando esta actividad 20 años y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio. Por otro lado considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. Para un futuro cercano espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y ofrecerles una mayor variedad de productos, para ello sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro y sin descanso. Este es el noveno préstamo de Bersy con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los tres mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Bersy is 36 years old and is a woman who has known how to progress on her own in life. She lives independently in the house that she inherited from her parents and what she desires most is to improve her quality of life. In the district of Nuñoa (district of the province of Meglar of the department of Puno), Bersy has her own grocery store. She is very happy with her business since it is very profitable. She has been working in this business for 20 years and what she likes best about it is talking with her customers and finding out what is happening in her neighborhood. On the other hand, what she considers most difficult about her job is having to stay inside her shop all day, without being able to go out on the street to carry out other activities. In the near future she hopes to have a bigger store where she can better attend to her customers and offer them a larger variety of products. For this she knows that she has to work very hard and without rest. This is Bersy’s 9th loan with MFP – she knows that she has to pay it back on time and she is determined to do so. In her village bank she is very responsible and is always waiting for agreements to be fulfilled between partners. With the 3500 nuevos soles requested, she will buy more products to improve her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Omoregie

texts.en: Omoregie O. is 31 years old. He is single and has no childreb. He sells shoes of various sizes and shapes. He is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more shoes to sell. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing of new clothing and shoes for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace G. Jonah sells cosmetics at Cape Coast. Grace G. has received senior high school education. She is married and has three children. Grace G. has been selling cosmetics since 2009. She is responsible for paying of rent and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cometics for resale at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more cometics for resale at the market.

loans.name: Jeny

texts.es:
Jeny tiene 24 años, es madre soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Su familia es agricultora, por ende ella domina todas las herramientas agrícolas, su siembra preferida es la papa, ya que la vende para consumo y como semilla. Cuando es para consumo, selecciona las más grandes para venderlas en el mercado de mayorista de la ciudad. Y cuando son papas medianas o para semilla, espera a los compradores de la costa que van hasta su casa para comprarle su producto. Por ello Jeny cree que con este cultivo no hay pérdidas, por eso  invierte confiada, anhelando incrementar su producción para lograr comprar sus propios terrenos y no depender más de sus padres.
En los ciclos anteriores su padre era el titular de los préstamos y ella pagaba todas las cuotas, pero en esta oportunidad decidió ingresar como miembro activa de su banco comunal y de ese modo poder ahorrar junto con el grupo, lo cual es muy importante para ella. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y abono para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Jeny is a 24 year old single mother who lives in her parents’ house. Her family is a farming family. She knows how to use all of the farming tools. Her preferred crop is the potato. She sells it for consumption and as seed. When it is for consumption she selects the biggest ones to sell in the wholesale market in the city. When the potatoes are medium sized or for seeds she waits for the buyers from the coast who go to her house to buy her product. That’s why Jeny believes that with this crop there are no losses. She invests confidently, striving to increase her production to be able to buy her own land and to no longer be dependent upon her parents. In previous cycles her father’s name was on the loans, and she made all of the payments. But this time she decided to join her communal bank as an active member. This way she will be able to save with the group, which is very important to her. The money she is asking for is to buy chemical and organic fertilizers for her potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chemical and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede has poultry farm where she rears birds to make a living. She is 45 years old and married with 2 children. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more poultry birds. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
El socio Policarpio; es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y ella pertenece al banco comunal, Chaska ñahui, ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestro socio tiene 42 años de edad, nuestro socio es soltero y es técnico en peluquería, el socio tiene una peluquería en pavitos y se dedica a cortar, teñir, peinar y mucho más en cuanto a cabellos de damas, caballeros y niños. Nuestro socio desea el préstamo para invertir en su pequeño negocio y de este modo hacerlo crecer un poco más.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Policapio is a Cusco native and a member of the ¨ Chaska ñahui¨ Community Bank in the city of Cusco.

He is 42 years old, single and is a hairdresser technician. He owns a hair saloon in “Pavitos”, and is dedicated to hair cutting, coloring and styling for women, men and children. This member is asking for a loan that will be invested in his small business to help it grow.

He appreciates and values the loan and is committed to make the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and dirt for her fields

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La señora Ana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 42 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.Tiene varios años dedicándose a la venta de pollos desviscerados, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, vendiendo pocos pollos, luego tuvo mucha acogida y clientes fuertes.Así, siguió superándose, ahora vende pollos en cantidad. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, en un ambiente alquilado del Mercado Central, donde brinda el servicio, a los moradores de la comunidad y amas de casa.  Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  pollos vivos en jabas y  parte del dinero lo invertirá comprando herramientas nuevas como una balanza digital y cuchillos nuevos para remplazar a la que ahora tiene.Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio.Anita, como le dicen de cariño nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Ana belongs to the "Mujeres Activas" Communal Bank, in the District and Province of Bellavista in the San Martín area. She lives with her partner, is 42-years-old and is the mother of 3 children, one of whom still depends on her. She has spent several years selling gutted chickens. She is located in the central market of her town. She began with the first loan from Manuela Ramos, selling a few chickens. Soon she was well-received and had regular customers. Thus, she continued to excel and now she sells chickens in abundance. Currently, she continues with the same business in a rented stall at the central market, where she offers service to the residents of the community and housewives. With this loan of S/ 3,000.00, she will buy chickens in crates and she will invest part of the money in the purchase of new tools such as a digital scale and new knives to replace the ones she has now. Today, she is an independent woman and she is the one who manages and makes decisions regarding her business. Anita, as they affectionately call her, tells us that belonging to a group of women has helped her to know her rights better and together they make sure that they are respected.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy chickens in crates.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Don Miguelito como es conocido en su comunida ser una persona lider de su comunidad de Pacho a quince Kilometros  del municipio de Totonicapan una comunidad muy abandonado por el gobierno los vecinos lucha para poder sobre salir para poder satisfacer la necesidad de su familias, como don miguelito, ve que el desarrollo trae grandes beneficios, el aprendio el arte de la capinteria cuando tenia diez años, como operario trabajo quince años el decidio iniciar su propio negocio hasta la fecha todo marcha muy bien el escucho un anuncio por una emisora locas que asdir da credito, el visita la oficina para dicho credito que le servira para la compra de madera,herramientas,clavos, pinturas, cola blanca.
texts.en:
Don Miguelito is known in his community as a leader of the Pacho community, fifteen kilometers from the municipality of Totonicapan, a community abandoned by the government snd the neighbors struggle to get ahead to satisfy the needs of their families. As don Miguelito realizes that development brings many benefits he learned the art of carpentry when he was ten. He worked as a worker for fifteen years and then decided to start his own business which is doing fine so far. He heard an anouncement on the local radio that Asdir provides loan, he visited the office and the loan will be spent on buying wood, tools, nails, paint, and glue.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Adita

texts.es:
Adita P. es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali. Ella tiene 39 años D. edad, es madre D. cinco hijos (dos mayores)y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien trabaja en un consorcio.
Adita se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” donD. se ha caracterizado colaboradora y puntual en sus pagos. El primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300.00 n nuevos soles los que le permitieron invertir en pollos para vender.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito D. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà prendas D. vestir y para luego venderlas. 
La meta D. Adita es llegar a tener un negocio bien implementado.
texts.en:
Adita P. is a dynamic and contributing woman who lives in the Pucallpa Region of Ucayali. She is 39 years old and is a mother of 5 children (2 are older). She counts on her husband’s support, who works in a consortium. Adita sells clothing, and is part of the Communal Bank “Las Nazarenas” where she is known for contributing and her punctual payments. The first loan of 300 PEN that she received allowed her to invest in chickens to sell. Currently she needs a loan of 500 PEN which she will use to purchase clothing to later sell. Adita’s goal is to have a well established business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to purchase women and men’s clothing.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves, de 19 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos familiares.

Su tienda de abarrotes es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que siempre es la primera en abrirse.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. 
Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal de su barrio.

Este el segundo préstamo de Nieves con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Nieves, aged 19, is a hardworking and cheerful young lady. She lives with her parents and wants to help them with their family expenses.

Her grocery store is one of the most frequented stores in her neighborhood. Her great charisma and kindness have made her the preferred storekeeper of her neighbors, who do not hesitate to shop already very early in the morning, as they know that Nieves is always the first to open her store. What she likes best about her work is to talk with her customers about things that happen in the neighborhood. She has been in this business for two years. According to her, the hardest part in her activity is to stay the whole day in her store, unless she could cope with lower sales. For the future she hopes that her business grows and becomes the primary store in her neighborhood.

This is Nieves' second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is aware that if she repays on schedule, she can access further loans easier and without difficulty from her community bank, where she is much liked by her fellow members. She will use her 1000 nuevos soles to buy more supplies for her grocery store and thus increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia GREGORIA, pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIWATANA”, la socia  radica en el poblado de Pisac, provincia de Calca departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tienen 48 años de edad es casada tiene 4 hijos de 28, 26, 21, 16 años; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, nuestra socia compra y vende artesanía, la socia compra materia prima para elaborar la arcilla y fabricar diferentes trabajos, muchas veces compra productos ya hechos y los vende al por mayor o al por menor, ella tiene su stand en la feria principal del pueblo que esta ubicado en la plaza principal de Pisac a unos metros del conjunto arqueológico de Pisac en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los incas. Nuestra socia trabaja junto a sus hijos mayores con artesanía, en está temporada suelen llevar los productos a los países vecino aprovechando el verano y los venden en las playas y si no están ahí viajando están siempre en Pisac, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos y materia prima para elaborar y vender artesanía.

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y les envía a sus colaboradores en este sueño un fuerte abrazo y un sincero agradecimiento a la distancia.
texts.en:
Our member, Gregoria, belongs to the communal bank “INTIWATANA,” she lives in the town of Pisac, province of Calca, department of Cusco.

Our member is 48 years old and is married; she has 4 children of 28, 26, 21, and 16 years of age. Gregoria varies her activities in her home and commerce, she buys and sells crafts. She buys raw materials to make the clay and make different pieces of work; many times she buys products already made and sells them wholesale or retail. She has her stall in the main market of the main square of Pisac, which is a few meters near the archeological site of Pisac in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas. Gregoria works with her eldest children with the crafts. In this season, they tend to take the products to neighboring countries taking advantage summer months and sell them in the beaches, if they’re not traveling they are always in Pisac. Gregoria needs a loan to buy goods and raw materials and to make and sell her crafts.

The member is grateful and wants to show her satisfaction in being able to keep growing with her own business and she sends those who help her with her dreams a great hug and a sincere long distance thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make her products from clay.

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es: La señora Maria Andrea tiene 39 años de edad, madre soltera de  tres hijos, muy trabajadora desde su juventud ha trabajado en servicios domestico ya que no logro culminar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos. Es por eso tiene estudiando a sus hijos para que puedan culminar sus estudios. Para ella ha sido difícil sola poder hacer las mejoras de su vivienda pero ha ido poco a poco con la el apoyo que Afodenic ha dado mediante sus financiamientos ya que ahora con todo caro y ganando poco no se puede hacer una obra. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para poder hacer un cuarto en la parte de atrás ya que su casa es de bloque pequeña pero el cuarto y la cocina es de zinc y viejo ya, el cual desea comenzar a construir y poder tener mejor comodidad como mejor higiene para esta obra comprara: bloques, arena, hierro, cemento para comenzar. Su meta es poder terminar toda su casa de concreto ya que la delincuencia asecha a diario. Esta motivada con los financiamiento que gracias a estos esta haciendo posible una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Andrea is 39 years old, a single, hard-working mother of three children. Since her youth she has worked in domestic services, since she did succeed in completing her schooling due to lack of economic resources. It is for this reason that she has her children studying, so that they can complete their schooling.

For her, it has been difficult to make improvements in her house by herself, but she has progressed little by little with the support that Afodenic has given her through her loans, since now, with everything expensive and her earning little, it isn't possible to do a project. With this loan, she will buy construction materials to make a room in the back part of her house. Since her small house is made of blocks but the room (to be replaced) and the kitchen are of zinc and are already old, what she wants is to begin building and to be able to have more comfort as well as better hygiene. For this project, she will buy blocks, sand, iron, and cement to begin. Her goal is to complete all of her house in concrete, since (with the present zinc construction of the room and the kitchen) she is on the watch for crime every day. She is motivated by the loans, thanks to which she is is able to make a better house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blocks, sand, iron and cement to begin construction of a room

loans.name: Rodolfo Manuel

texts.es: Rodolfo Manuel habita en la zona # 8 de Nueva Guinea junto a su familia integrada por su esposa Gladinel y su hijo , graduado en Administración de empresa, trabaja en la Alcaldia Municipal como responsable de comunicacion social, este joven ha luchado por tener una vivienda propia para su familia, esta solicitando su 3er credito y espera ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva para construir su cocina y brindar mayor comodidad a su familia  ya que actualmente no tiene un espacio adecuado para ella, el mayor sueño que tiene es un hogar bonito y digno para familia, Rodolfo se caracteriza por ser un hombre con un alto espiritu de superación,  responsable, honesto, con buena conducta, tiene alto liderzgo en el municipio, expresa que se siente muy satisfecho con la atencion recibida en AFODENIC.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Manuel lives in District #8 of Nueva Guinea with his family, which consists of his wife Gladinel and their son. He graduated with a degree with business administration and works for the city as a communications director. This young man has strived to acquire a home for his family. He is requesting his third loan and hopes to be a beneficiary of Kiva funds so that he can build a kitchen and provide greater comfort for his family. At the moment, there is not adequate space in his home. His greatest dream is to have a beautiful and dignified home for his family.

Rodolfo is known as a high-spirited man of excellence who is responsible, honest, well-manned, and holds a position of high leadership within the city. He says he is very satisfied with the attention he has received from AFODENIC.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kitchen in his house

loans.name: Ne

texts.en:
Mr. Ne N. (pictured with his wife, daughter, and nephew), has been married since 2004 and they have two children: one son who attends school and one young daughter. The family is living in a small village off of National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ne has been driving a motor remorque for over two years; 'remorque' is a motorbike with a trailer at the back. His wife has been a garment factory worker for over eleven years as well. 

Ne’s wife does not have transportation for commuting to work, so she needs to spend a lot of money for traveling costs. Facing this, Ne is applying for loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his wife to get work. 

When she has her own transportation, Ne’s wife will be able to save some money by not spending it on traveling costs any more.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his wife to drive to work.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren A. is a 50 year old widow with three children to care for. She has a weaving business where she makes and sells mats. She started this business in the year 2000 in Dunga Kisumu, Kenya after giving up selling vegetables as her only source of income to provide the school fees for her children and other basic needs.

She wishes to get a loan worth KSH 20,000 to be able to increase her stock as she intends to expand her business. Her dream is to build her own house and provide her children with a better education so that they can have a bright future.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es: Ana Guadalupe M. D. A. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja para una empresa privada, y junto a sus dos pequeños hijos D. 7 y 2 años D. edad, D. los cuales el mayor asiste a la escuela, y el menor esta a cuidado D. Ana. Ella posee una tienda D. abarrotes en la cual comercializa pollo, verduras, aderezos, golosinas y otros más, el negocio a penas esta creciendo ya que cuenta con año D. poseerlo, ha pesar D. esto tiene muchos clientes los cuales le comprar semanalmente, así también la tienda esta ubicada en calle principal lo cual la hace aún más visible para todas las personas. Ana solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el fin D. poder aumentar su inventario, adquiriendo todos los productos necesarios, para poder contar con más clientela. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo D. poder crecer en su negocio y D. esta manera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Guadalupe M. D. A. is 32 years old and resides in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works at a private business, and their 2 children, ages 7 and 2. The older child attends school while Ana takes care of the toddler. Ana has a grocery store, where she sells poultry, vegetables, seasonings, candy and more. The business hasn't grown much because it has only been operating for 1 year. Despite this, Ana has many customers who shop weekly. The store is located on a main street, which makes it more visible to shoppers. Ana is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral, with the intent of increasing her inventory to incluD. more basic goods in order to attract more customers. She does this in hopes that her business will grow and her sales will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic goods for grocery store inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
El grupo Madre Tereza está conformado por tres personas un de ellas es  M. S.M.O de 52 años  quien desde 1980 vende cosméticos al por mayor y al detalle. Ella con el préstamo surtirá su negocio con distintos y novedosos productos.
Sus compañeros de grupo son E. A. L. que comercializa todo tipo de producción y L. B. M. tiene una fritanga desde hace quince años.
texts.en:
The group Madre Tereza is made up of three women. One of them is M.S.M.O., a 52 year-old who has been selling cosmetics wholesale and retail since 1980. With this loan, she would increase her business with different and novel products. Her partners are E.A.L., who sells all kinds of products, and L.B.M., who has had a shop selling fried foods for the past fifteen years.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Mrs. Fe A. from Blancia, St. Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, is 41 years old, married and the mother of one child. A PDP-LP member, Fe has operated a sari-sari store for over a year, earning about 5000 a month, while her husband farms.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to learn how to more effectively engage in business activities. Having fully repaid her previous loan of 7000 from PMPC that was used to expand her business, Fe is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 8000 to use as additional capital for her business, and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma S. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 42 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling products like dried fish and shrimp in the local community. She also sells vegetables and spices. Alma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell and for working capital. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell and for working capital

loans.name: Betulia Lourdes

texts.es:
Betulia Lourdes M. C. tiene 46 anos de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y reside en Colonia Los Angeles en Juticalpa, Olancho.  Con la ayuda de su esposo se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano en su casa y de forma ambulante.  Hace dos anos empezo su negocio de venta de ropa de segunanda mano con unas amigas pero ahorra trabaja sola y su negocio esta creciendo.

Con el prestamo de 15,000 Lempiras comprara dos fardos de ropa de segunda mano para aumentar sus ingresos.  Con el apoyo del prestamo su negocio sera mas grande, podra mantener su familia y apoyar a su hija en el colegio.      

Su sueno es superar con sus ventas y seguir creciendo su negocio para soportar a su familia.  Es el tercer ciclo de prestamos con FAMA y ha pagado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Betulia Lourdes M. C. is 46, married, has 4 children and lives in Colonia Los Angeles in Juticalpa, Olancho. With her husband's help she sells second-hand clothing, in her home and on foot. Two years ago she started her business with some friends, but now she works alone and her business is growing. With this loan of 15,000 Lempiras she will buy two bundles of second-hand clothing to increase her income. With the aid of this loan her business will grow, she will be able to maintain her family and help her daughter in school. Her dream is to increase her sales and for her business to continue growing to support her family. This is her third loan cycle with FAMA and she has repaid her quotas punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Two bundles of second-hand clothing for sale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba E. is married and lives with her husband, a driver from Abura. She has not received any formal education. Aba sells material, underwear, babies’ wear and Pampers. She has been in this business for three years. She hopes to use the loan she will be receiving to purchase more material, children’s wear and other things to sell. Aba plans to save the new profits from her expanded business for her unborn children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more material, children’s wear and other things to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina T. is currently in the business of selling local brew and beer at a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  

She is 33 years old and is married to a husband who is a tailor. She has two children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her pub.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita S. is from the village of Galas, Dipolog City. She is 63 years old and is widowed with four adult children. Rosita owns and operates a business raising ducks for sale. She is just starting this business. In 2006, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 6,500 PHP which will be used to purchase chicks and materials for raising poultry. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and materials for raising poultry

loans.name: Erick Omar

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Erick Omar F. le esta haciendo falta un baño de material ya que actual mente tiene una de madera y esta en muy mal condiciones.
Solicita el un préstamo para poder comprar el material, ya que el se encargar de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como oficial vial de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
texts.en:
The house of Erick Omar Fernandez is lacking a bathroom of solid materials, since the one he currently has is made of wood and is in very bad condition. He requests a loan so that he can buy materials; he will be in charge of making the improvements during the hours he is not at work. He plans to pay off the loan with the salary he receives from his work as a traffic officer for the city of Nuevo Laredo.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
N. Jackline is a very determined and hardworking lady who is not afraid of diversity when considering business activities that can earn her profit. She is 35 years old and is a happily married lady of 6 children. She been in the agricultural produce business for some years now. She grows food crops like beans, coffee and bananas at Kacence, Rukungiri. She also sells milk and earns 300,000 Ugandan Shillings per month.

This loan is to help her purchase manure for her plantation as she is looking to diversify her business. She did not have start-up capital. This will give her a free ticket to earn more revenue, to cater for her family's basic needs and also to develop a self-sustaining livelihood: she hopes to open up a big store of her produce.

loans.use: to upgrade her plantations by buying manure.

loans.name: Abraham Kinyanjui

texts.en:
Abraham runs a shoeshine stall and sells juice, biscuits and sweets on the side in Naivasha town.  He is 38 years and married to Mary Wanjiru. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy shoe polish in different colors and shoe dye, and add to his stock of biscuits, sweets and juice drinks.

Abraham hopes to expand his retail business and open a shop.

loans.use: To buy shoe polish, shoe dye, biscuits, sweets and juice.

loans.name: Siddiqa's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqa, with hand raised, lives in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan known for its history and culture. She is a vigorous and artistic lady who runs a decorative embroidery business at home. She use different technical embroidery skills in making embroidered dresses. Due to her quality work and unique designs she gets regular orders every month which earns her a good profit. She started this work because her husband’s income alone was not enough to meet the needs of the family. 

Siddiqa has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy seasonal fruits to sell from his four-wheeled cart. He hopes to improve his sales and get a shop in the market.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Phoeung

texts.en: Mrs. Phoeung Y. is a 37-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer since she was single. In addition, she currently sells fresh fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She runs her business in the market and is earning approximately $4 a day. Her husband is a local fisherman. The humble couple has six children who are no longer in school and are working with their businesses. Mrs. Phoeung Y. always requires to hire taxis for travelling needs and she dreams of having a vehicle to be used for cutting down the cost of hiring, but she has no enough money to buy one. Therefore, Mrs. Phoeung Y. would like to borrow a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to provide transportation for family.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle to provide transportation for family.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg T. is 56 years old and lives with her husband in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Narantsetseg operates a grocery trading business with the help of her husband. She began her business in 1990, selling a variety of foodstuffs in a stall. After years of hard work and diligence, she has managed to expand her business and open her own grocery store. In the future, she hopes to increase her product line for her grocery shop. Narantsetseg is a modest and hardworking woman. She is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of groceries for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of groceries

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is fifty-six years old.  She lives in the village of Huaca Parita in the district of Pitipo near the city of Chiclayo.  It is a rural region with a rich cultural history and many ancient mud brick ruins.  Eualalia and her husband own the home in which they live.

Eualia owns two hectares of arable land.  She has planted corn in half her land—which is nearing maturity—and recently transplanted onions to the other half.  She has had these properties for a number of years. Edpyme Alternativa has worked with her in the past in order to assist with the maintenance and planting of the crops.

The current loan is requested in order to hire field workers for the maintenance of Eulalia's crops and the harvest.  She hopes to be able to provide a reasonable employment to some of her neighbors and other locals and to reap an appropriate profit that will help her maintain her own household and be able to continue planting.  The use of laborers increases the crop yield significantly and betters the product.

loans.use: To hire field workers for the maintenance of crops and the harvest

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 56 years old. Rosalinda is married and has four children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosalinda also grows hogs for fattening.

Rosalinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products and pig feed. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products and pig feed

loans.name: Marvin Jeovanny

texts.es: Marvin Jeovanny R. G. de 31 años de edad, es un padre de familia muy responsable y dedicada al bienestar de su hogar. Él reside en Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad. Marvin posee un taller de mecánica automotriz, el cual esta ubicado sobre la carretera panamericana, la cual es una de las principales calles del país. Desde hace 7 años que él realiza este tipo de trabajo, obteniendo mucha experiencia en el oficio, lo cual le da la ventaja de elaborar un excelente trabajo con sus clientes, los cuales se sienten muy satisfechos con el servicio brindado por parte de Marvin. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materiales para su taller tales como lijas, pinturas, herramientas, focos, cables y otros insumos más. Todo esto lo hace con el inmenso deseo de poder obtener mayores ganancias, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que su familia cuenta, es por ello que Marvin se esfuerza mucho por realizar un excelente trabajo, y de esta manera brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Marvin Jeovanny R. G. is a 31 year-old father who is very responsible and committed to the well-being of his household.  He lives in Cojutepeque, in Cuscatlán department.  He lives with his wife and three dependent children.

Marvin has a car repair shop which is located on Carretera Panamericana (Panamericana street).  This is one of the main streets in the country.  He has been in doing this work for 7 years, gaining a lot of experience in his trade, which allows him to do excellent work for his customers.  His customers are very happy with his service.

Marvin is requesting a loan so that he can buy material for his shop such as sandpaper, paint, tools, lights, cables, etc.  He does all this with a great wish to make more profits since this is the only source of income that his family has.  For this reason, Marvin works hard to do an excellent job so that he can provide his children and wife with everything they need.

loans.use: To buy tools for fixing cars

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Juan Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Martínez es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado el se ha dedicado a la construcción desde hace muchos años, anteriormente trabajaba solo por su cuenta pero debido a que últimamente se ha estado escaseando el área de construcción tuvo la necesidad de empezar a laborar dependiendo de un contratista, pero  aparte el sigue tomando trabajos independientes los fines de semanas, su esposa se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de su hijo, el requiere el crédito para terminar el acabado de su cerca del área de enfrente de su casa debido a que le gusta tener un hogar confortable y bonito para comodidad de el y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Martínez is  hardworking and esteemed man, who has worked in construction for many years.  He used to work on his own but because construction jobs have been scarce recently, he has had to start working for a contractor.  However, he continues to do independent jobs on the weekends.  His wife is a homemaker and cares for their son.  He is seeking a loan to finish the fence around his house so he can have a more comfortable and attractive home for his own and his family's comfort.

loans.use: To finish the construction of a fence

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 30 years old. She is married with one child who is two months old. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Clementine sells foodstuffs and she has spent three years in this business. She hopes to use this new loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She would like to buy a truck from the profits she hopes to get from this loan. Clementine plans to save money and pay school fees for her children in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Anta, perteneciente a la provincia D. Anta y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 61 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. queso y también se dedica a la agricultura, la socia tiene un pequeño terreno donD. cultiva maíz, papa y verduras, la socia el queso y los productos agrícolas los venD. en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito D. Anta, por medio D. estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio D. venta D. quesos y agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar queso y mejorar las tierras D. cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 61, is a member of the “MUJERES EN ACCION” (Women in Action) communal bank located in Anta district which belongs to Anta province, Cusco department.

She is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily chores with cheese sales.  She also is a farmer.  She has a small plot where she grows corn, potato and vegetables.  She sells the cheese and the various agricultural products at the various farmers’ markets occurring in Anta.  Through these small businesses she’s able to support her children.  She wants to improve and expand the cheese sales business and the farming.  She is asking for the loan to buy cheese and to improve her farmland.

She is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy cheese and to improve her farmland.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica de 40 años, tiene en su casa una pequeña tienda de golosinas y víveres. La especialidad de su tienda son las golosinas y bebidas. 

Comenzó con la tienda para ayudar a su esposo que es albañil con los gastos de la familia, vendiendo con pocos productos y golosinas en su casa ubicada en Duran completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña tienda. Vende caramelos, cachitos, etc. Trabaja desde muy temprano en su tienda.
