Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar golosinas y víveres. En el futuro quiere tener dinero para una tienda para darle una buena vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Angélica, 40, has a small candy and general store in her house. The speciality of her store is candy and drinks. She started the store to help her husband, who is a bricklayer, with the family expenses by selling a few products and candy in her house located in Duran. She raised the money to put in her small store. She sells candy, small rolls, etc. She starts work in her store very early. To be able to continue with her business, she wants to buy candy and provisions. In the future, she would like to have money for a store in order to give a good life to her children.

loans.use: Candy, oil, sweets

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a young woman from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. She is a mother of three daughters and three sons. Laila's husband Mahmoud is a rickshaw driver in Rafah city. Rafah is a city with a very high population density that makes a rickshaw a very feasible means of transportation. Laila took a loan from FATEN as her husband wants to buy a newer rickshaw since the one he has now is becoming very old and needs a lot of maintenance. Laila's husband sold the current one and needed $2500 to purchase the new one.

Laila's husband appears in the picture here, as Laila is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To purchase a new rickshaw

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the village of San Carlos, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 60 years old. Josephine is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as diapers, beverages, salt, noodles & coffee in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, a 62-year-old widowed mother of nine children, works hard to provide for her family. For 20 years she has run a general store in the Philippines, and also earns an income from used clothing sales.

Having received and repaid 18 loans from NWTF, Lilia is now requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to buy more stocks to sell in her general store. She aspires to be able to complete the education of her youngest child.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of nine members. Mrs. Chea, a married woman who was born in 1971, was selected to be the village bank president by the others members.

Her husband, Mr. Yong, was born in 1978 and is a government worker who is able to earn a small salary to help support his family. This couple has five children. One is a wedding chef, one is a mirror smith, two are attending the local school, and the last one is 4 years old. 

Mrs. Chea earns a living by selling snacks. 

Soon, one of her children is going to get married, but she doesn’t have enough money to support it, so she decided to ask for a loan to help pay for her child's wedding.

loans.use: to help pay for her child's wedding.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Durante 15 años Martha trabajo como empleada en un negocio donde se comercializa ropa en general, pero en el 2005 la dueña del negocio le dio la oportunidad de comprar parte del negocio gracias a su buen desempeño y su responsabilidad. Hoy en día Martha tiene su propio negocio con el que genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus 3 hijas ya que su ex esposo no cumple con la responsabilidad económica de sus hijas y como madre cabeza de hogar debe asumir todos los gastos.

 

Esta emprendedora tiene su negocio en el municipio de Sonsón al norte del departamento de Antioquia donde vende ropa interior, pijamas y ropa deportiva, ella debe mantener suficiente surtido para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, pero actualmente no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar la mercancía que le hace falta. Sueña con ver crecer a sus hijas en un hogar donde la economía no sea un impedimento para su desarrollo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
For 15 years, Martha worked as an employee in a business that sold clothes.  However, in 2005 the owner gave her the opportunity to buy part of the business as a result of her good job performance and her responsibility.  Now Martha has her own business with which she makes the income she needs to support her three daughters.  Since her ex-husband does not fulfil his financial responsibilities towards his daughters, as head of her household Martha must cover all their expenses.

This entrepreneur's business is located in the town of Sonsón, in the north of Antioquia department.  She sells underwear, pajamas and sports clothes.  Martha must keep her business sufficiently well stocked in order to meet her customers' needs.  However, she currently does not have the capital she needs to buy merchandise that she is lacking.  She dreams of watching her daughters grow up in a household where finances are not an obstacle to their development.  She hopes to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothes store

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has three children.

Maher has had a food market since 2009, selling different kinds of food and soft drinks. He has a long experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $1500 to buy a tricycle called in Iraqi, "Stotp". It’s like a motorcycle with three wheels linked to box-like open car, to some extent a "pickup". He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a tricycle ("stotp").

loans.name: Mercedes Lucely

texts.es:
En la parroquia Rio Chico  del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como San Clemente, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal San Clemente De Rio Chico, este lugar es conocido por su vegetación y porque la mayoría de su gente se dedica al agro.

La señora Mercedes es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos ya que no piden tantos requisitos comenta. Tiene  años de edad 44 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 21 y 10 años de edad, la mayor estudia en Cuba y este año se incorpora de médico y la menor aun esta en escuela. Su marido es chofer profesional.

Es una gran ama de casa que se dedica al comercio, vende  zapatos de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta o bajo pedido, trabaja tres días a la semana  por las mañanas que es más fresco y aprovecha que su hija pequeña esta en la escuela, nos cuenta que lleva cinco años en ese negocio y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos para damas, caballeros y niños.
 
Sus sueños  son seguir trabajando y crecer en su negocio día a día.
texts.en:
In Rio Chico parish, in Portoviejo canton, we come across a place called San Clemente.  Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Clemente de Rio Chico' community bank meet here.  The area is known for its vegetation and for the fact that most of the locals work in agriculture.

Mercedes is a founding member of her community bank and she tells us that she likes it because of the ease with which she can obtain loans (they do have so many requirements).  Mercedes is 44 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has two daughters aged 21 and 10.  Her eldest is studying in Cuba and this year she will become a doctor.  Her youngest is still in school.  Mercedes' husband is a professional driver.

Mercedes is a great housewife who is also a saleswoman.  She sells all kinds of shoes, making her sales door to door or to order.  She works three days a week in the mornings when it is cooler and she can take advantage of the fact that her youngest daughter is in school.  She tells us that she has been in this business for five years and it has done very well.

Mercedes will use this loan to buy ladies', men's and children's shoes.  Her dreams are to continue working and to grow in her business every day.

loans.use: to buy ladies', men's and children's shoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm animals and chickens to butcher.

loans.name: Isidoro Martin

texts.es: Isidoro Martin tiene su negocio que es compra y venta de sal también es transportista. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy difícil sufragar los gastos del hogar él ha tenido que recurrir a otros ingresos. Inicio desde muy joven  ya que trabajaba en una salinera con el paso del tiempo fue que obtuvo este medio de transporte, por lo que sale todos los días a ofrecer grandes cantidades de bolsas de sal. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de sal por quintal para ofrecerla con su camión.
texts.en: Isidoro Martin has a business buying and selling salt.  He is also a truck driver.  He has been in this business for more than 20 years.  It has been very difficult for him to cover his household expenses and so he has had to turn to other sources of income.  He started working when he was very young, in a saltworks.  Over time, he obtained his vehicle with which he goes out every day to sell large bags of salt.  He is requesting a loan to buy salt in 100lb amounts so that he can sell it in his truck.

loans.use: to buy salt by the 100lb bag

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Ollantaytambo, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 37 años; la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos, de 17 y 14 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la compra y veta de comidas en el mercado, la socia tiene un stand en el mercado en el cual prepara todo tipo de comidas caseras, la soca tiene su puesto y es muy conocida y cotizada , ella desea invertir en la compra de papas y aceite, la socia tiene planeado invertir en papas al por mayor comprara una arroba de papa peruanita y 1 arroba de papas blancas para freír, también comprara un bidón de 10 kilos de aceite para que le dure cerca de 2 meses, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de papas y aceite al por mayor.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO", which is in the Ollantaytambo District in the Urubamba Province, department of Cusco.

She is 37, married and has two children, ages 17 and 14.  She has a stand at the market where she sells all types of home-made meals.  She is well-known and popular, and wants to buy potatoes and oil on a wholesale basis.  She plans to buy an "arroba" (weight measurement) of Peruvian potatoes and an "arroba" of white potatoes for frying.  Also, she plans to buy 10 kilos of oil that will last her nearly two months. The loan will be used to buy the potatoes and oil wholesale.

She is very content and grateful for this support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and oil wholesale.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 57 years of age, widowed and has four children. She has owned and managed a general store for almost five years now. She is earning an average net profit of PHP 7,000 each month. She wants to improve her store for stability to satisfy their basic needs at home and help finance the education of her grandchildren.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy stocks of soft drinks, junk foods, coffee, sugar, breads and canned goods to sell in her general store. Pilar also plans to put up another income-generating project to expand her ventures in the business to ensure big profits.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, junk foods, coffee, sugar, breads and canned goods to sell

location.town: Hill top Nagsabaran, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Kulsahira's Group

texts.en:
Kulsahira, the leader of this group, is 50 years old and divorced. She has raised a daughter, who is now married and living separately with her own family, and a son, who is in the military.

Five years ago Kulsahira secured a loan with which she started her own business baking bread at home and then supplying it to grocery stores. She is now requesting this loan in order to purchase more flour. In the future, Kulsahira wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase flour.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 48 años de edad. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Ella es cosmetóloga y tiene un pequeño salón de belleza. En esta oportunidad Leonarda requiere el préstamo para comprar tintes, champús, tijeras, acondicionador y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Virgen de Chapi” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Leonarda was born in the city of Cusco (Perú).  She’s 48 years old and currently lives in the city of her birth where she carries out her economic activities.  She’s a Cosmetologist and has a small beauty salon.  On this occasion, Leonarda needs the loan to buy dyes, shampoo, scissors, conditioners and other things.

The “Virgen de Chapi” communal bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco (Perú). Cusco is known for being a very tourist oriented, commercial zone, for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr:
Fati est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 01 enfant âgé de 18ans et il est scolarisé. 
Fati travaille comme revendeuse de céréales. Elle vend à toutes personnes intéressée par ses marchandises.
Fati a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut étendre son activité avec les profits réalisés.
Dans les prochaines années, Fati voudrait diversifier ses marchandises. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer l’éducation de son seul enfant.
texts.en:
Fati is a 39-year-old woman. She is widowed and has one child aged eighteen. He goes to school.
Fati works as a cereal retailer. She sells to anyone who is interested in her products.
Fati is requesting her third loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase cereals. She wants to grow her business with the profit made.
In the coming years, Fati would like to diversify her products. She says that with the profit, she is planning on making sure her only child gets an education.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Shakhlohon

texts.ru: Шахлохон 45 лет, вдова и имеет двух детей.  В поисках постоянного источника дохода  для своих детей, 10 лет назад Шахлохон начала заниматься животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости, Шахлохон сумела развить свое хозяйство с ежемесячным доходом  около 15,000 сом (KGS) и насчитывающее на сегодняшний день 4 голов коров и 2 голов нетели.  В поисках дополнительного источника прибыли для своей семьи, инициативная Шахлохон также начала торговать одеждой на местном рынке, что позволяет ей покрыть ежедневные расходы.  Для дальнейшего развития животноводства, Шахлохон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку крупного рогатого скота. В будущем, Шахлохон планирует подготовить хорошее приданое для своей дочери благодаря доходам от кредита.
texts.en: Shakhlohon is 45 years old, a widow and has two children.  In search of a consistent income for her children, Shakhlohon became involved in animal husbandry ten years ago.  Thanks to her hard work and persistence, she was able to develop her farm to yield a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS) and have four cows and two heifers today.  To find an additional source of profit for her family, entrepreneurial Shakhlohon also started to sell clothing at the local market, and this allows her to cover daily expenses.  To further develop her animal husbandry business, she requested a loan in the sum of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase cattle.  In the future, Shakhlohon plans to prepare a good dowry for her daughter, thanks to the profits from the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 32-year-old married man. He offers a courier service, a business he has operated for the last two years in Mtwapa, Mombasa. 
Benson is a client of Kiva partner, KADET and this is his second loan to finance his business. With this loan he plans to expand his business premises. The profits that will be generated from his business will be directed into the gradual expansion of the business and the repayment of the loan. Benson's dream is to own a courier company.

loans.use: to expand his business premises.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar is a mother of three children. She is a very honorable and resolute woman. Ever since she was a young girl, she learned the honest work of raising cattle -- knowledge she has passed down to her own children, who have also managed to improve their quality of life. 

Gulnar and her husband started their livestock business with only one cow seven years ago. After a number of sacrifices, they were able to increase little by little the quantity of calves. At the moment, with the support of their children, they have started to produce milk from their cattle. They sell it on the weekends in their village. 

Currently, Gulnar wants to expand her business and to purchase more cattle. With the desire of improving their living conditions, she applied for a 1,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) loan.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père d'un enfant.Il pratique le commerce de bétail en achetant sur les marchés hebdommadaires.Il pratique cette activité depuis prés de 8 ans et arrive à générer des bénéfices qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires, vestimentaires , scolaires et de santé de sa famille.Afin d'augmenter de préparer la féte de Tabaski durant laquelle il y 'a une forte demande  , il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter 40 moutons. Son ambition est de faire de l'embouche ovine et bovine .
texts.en: The borrower is a married man who is father to one child. He trades in livestock and buys his animals at the weekly markets. He has been carrying out this activity for almost eight years and manages to generate sufficient profits to provide for his family's needs in terms of food, clothing, education and health. In preparation for the Tabaski festival, during which there is strong demand, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs in order to buy 40 sheep. His ambition is to practise both sheep and beef fattening.

loans.use: to buy 40 sheep

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a 57-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Jane who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children aged 20 and 17 years respectively. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his 3rd loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Stanley will use the loan to buy seedlings and farm manure for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will venture into fish farming. His hopes and dreams are to export the farm produce which will help him educate his children up to university level and improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and farm manure for his farm.

loans.name: Khum

texts.en: Khum, 44, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorian sites. Khum and her husband sell cow ties and equipment. This couple work so hard every day for income to help cover the family's expenses. Khum is requesting a loan of USD 1,100 to purchase more cow ties and equipment to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more cow ties to resell

loans.name: Handsuren

texts.en: Handsuren is 43 years old and lives with her mother and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her mother is retired and her son is a college student. She started her garment retailing business in 2007 by renting space in the market. Her products are very fashionable and inexpensive therefore she has many regular customers. Now that her business is stable, she wants to expand her business by renting another space in the market. Handsuren is a hardworking and diligent woman who says"Since I am the only one with the income in the family, I have to pay my son's college fees". She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more garments from wholesalers in Ulaanbaatar, the capitol..

loans.use: To buy more garments for her clothing business.

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Antonio esta solicitando un crédito con nosotros por desea poner una barda de block para separar su casa de la de enseguida y también para tener seguridad al dejar los carros afuera.  
       El señor Jesús Antonio  trabaja en una fabrica como técnico, y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a reparar aparatos electrónicos en su casa, y también cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos desde hace aproximadamente dos años ya que  inicio un  pequeño de negocio con su cuñado el cual es básicamente ambientar los eventos sociales y el cual representa un ingreso extra para el y para su cuñado.
Don Jesús Antonio es originario de Coahuila pero ya tiene tiempo residiendo aquí en Nuevo Laredo, ya que aquí ya formo una familia con su esposa Marveliz y con su hijo, al cual ambos se esfuerzan por darle lo mejor.
texts.en:
Jesús Antonio is asking for a loan because he wants to build a cinder block wall to separate his house from the one next door, and to improve security when he leaves his cars outside.

Jesús Antonio works as a technician in a factory and he repairs electrical appliances in his spare time.  He’s also had another source of income for the past two years; he started a small business with his brother-in-law, which basically consists of providing the set-up for social events.  This represents an extra income for him and his brother-in-law.

Jesús Antonio is originally from Coahuila, but he’s been living in Nuevo Laredo for some time.  He established his family with his wife Marveliz and his son, to who they both strive to provide the best.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia de 33 años es soltera tiene un hijo de 6 años que cursa el primer año de primaria en una escuela pública de la localidad; Olivia desde antes de cumplir cinco años tuvo un problema en la columna el cual hasta la fecha no le permitido caminar, su mamá siempre la tuvo en terapia física y psicológica de lo cual ella le da gracias a Dios y a su mamá por toda la atención que ella tenido y lo cual le ha permitido tener una vida normal. Para Olivia nada es imposible porque tiene  una meta bien establecida y la cual está dispuesta a lograr enfrentando cualquier obstáculo que se le pueda presentar su meta y mayor ilusión en la vida darle una educación y una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo Cristian  que la que ella recibió,  su discapacidad no es un obstáculo para que ella pueda lograr su meta ella trabaja como promotora de productos de belleza por cátalo de empresas reconocidas en México, La forma en la que ella trabaja es tocando puerta por puerta ofreciendo los productos que ella vende y de esta manera poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de ella y su hijo, ella vive en casa de su mamá  al igual que otro hermano y está buscando tener su propio espacio el cual le permita a ella y a su hijo mejorar su calidad de vida por ello solicita el apoyo para iniciar la construcción de un cuarto.
texts.en: Olivia, thirty-three years old, is single with a six year old son who currently attends his first year of school in a local public school. Since before she turned five, Olivia has had a problem with her spine which, to this day, does not allow her to walk. Her mother always had her in physical and psychological therapy. She is grateful to God and her mother for the attention she has received, and for being able to have a normal life. Nothing is impossible for Olivia because she has a well established goal which she is determined to achieve, confronting whatever obstacle which may present itself. Her greatest dream in life is to provide an education and a better quality of life to her son Cristian than that which she received. Her disability is not an obstacle for her to be able to achieve her goal. She works selling catalog beauty products from recognized businesses in Mexico. The way she works is by going door to door offering the products she sells. In this way, she is able to cover the costs of her and her son’s basic necessities. She lives in her mother’s house, along with another brother, and is looking to have her own space in which she and her son will be able to improve their quality of life. For this reason she requests the loan to begin the construction of a room.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 29-year-old food kiosk owner in Mombasa. 

He is single and has been operating this business for the past three years and he is doing great. This marks his third borrowing  to finance his business since he was introduced to KADET. He plans to purchase cooking oil, baking flour, beans, maize and maize flour for his food kiosk. 

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business more and hopes to own a bigger hotel in future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, baking flour, beans, maize and maize flour

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 39 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with three children between 9 and 23 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past 22 years, Hawa has been selling doughnuts and meat pies. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit and has a little income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, baking powder, and coal for her business. Her plan is to expand her business and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, baking powder, and coal for her business

loans.name: 02 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Dung has a manufacturing business making nem chua (fermetter/cured pork).   Dung has been involved in this business for 3 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase pork to make nem chua (fermeter/cured pork).

Dung is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children.  Nam lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Dung is the group leader of the 02.04.02 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

In 2010, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dung has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase pork to make nem chua (fermeter/cured pork)

loans.name: Kamiila

texts.ru: Камийла,46 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Она успешно погасила свой кредит, Камийла очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы, лошадь. На участке мерою 0,55 Га собственной и 0,40 Га арендованной земли она выращивает перец и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Камийла вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 93,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков. Доходы от кредита позволят Камийле развить бизнес и улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Kamiila is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She started her own animal husbandry business in 1990.  Today, she owns two cows and one horse.  She also grows pepper and clover on 0.55 hectare of her own land and 0.4 hectare of leased land.  These crops are consumed on the farm and also resold.  Kamiila has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 93,000 som (KGS) to buy three steers.  The earnings from her loan will help her to grow her business and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy three steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Fanny Yanireth

texts.en:
My name is Fanny Yanireth. I have a used clothes store located in this city’s downtown. I’ve been in this industry for several years. My income allows me to pay my suppliers, and my family’s expenses. We currently need a car to be able to bring merchandise from the capital city to our city.

Loan Use: Purchase categorized bulks of American clothes

Mi nombre el Fanny Yanireth, tengo un negocio de ropa usasa ubicado en uno de los barrios mas centricos de esta ciudad, cueanto con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis compromisos con proveedores y gastos familiares, actuamente necesitamos un carro para poder transportar la mercaderia desde la capital a nuestra ciudad.

loans.use: Compra de fardos clasificados de ropa americana

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan R. has been a farmer and a cattle rancher in Salitre his whole life. Although he only has a primary education, he has been able to be successful in cattle ranching and rice cultivation. After working in his father's ranch as a young man, he decided to acquire his own land and start his own family. He has 8 children ages 20, 18, 17, 16, 14, 7, 5 and 1. His older children have already finished their studies and work with him on the ranch while his other kids are still in school. Along with rice cultivation he will also make some investment in cattle with the loan.

Ivan is part of the first Communal Bank in the new Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Resistencia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named Resistencia. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Resistencia Association are responsible for the amount that is missing. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There is not a single financial institution that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The only access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Invest in cattle and prepare his lands for rice cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice K. is married with four children and hails from a suburban area of the Edo State in Nigeria. She is a fashion designer who designs clothes for people and is eager to borrow $25 to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Hoyi

texts.en: Hoyi Hélène is 35 years old and has decided to live with her husband for better and worst on September15th,  2000. They have 3 children, 2 among them are freshman and sophomore in law and electricity, and the youngest is in secondary school. She has 7 years of work experience in selling food products. Hélène lives with her family in Marcory, in the south of the Abidjan District. She has demonstrated dynamism and honesty since she joined AE&I microcredit program in July 2005. She is a good performer and she is requesting this loan to pay school expenses for her children. She thanks in advance those world citizens who believes in her and help her to take care to her family.

loans.use: Hoyi Hélène will use the loan to pay education expenses

loans.name: Asiah

texts.en: I am Asiah B. and the mother of three children, one son and two daughters. My son is in grade one whereas the daughters are too small to attend school. I am a textile designer and I make embroidered clothes. I am very good at my work but I cannot operate on a large scale due to limited resources. I need to expand my clothing business and require US$ 300 as a loan to buy the necessary materials.

loans.use: buy materials required for making embroidered clothes

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Mrs. Phin T., 48, is a widow who buys garlic from the grower and resells it at the market, earning around $5 each day. She has eight children. One works at a garment factory, earning around $120 per month. One is a grocer, another is a construction worker, and two are students. The rest are married and living away from home. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase more garlic in order to meet customer demand and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase garlic for resale

loans.name: Clavelina

texts.es:
Clavelina is 36 and has been married to Hermino López for 25 years. She has 2 daughters, both who are young and high school students.

She has a small business where she works hard to buy fish at wholesale and sell at retail. She has been a seasoned vendor 20 years and already has stable client base.

She started out traveling around and selling fish in the small center of Asunción (capital of Paraguay). Later, together with her husband, they bought a motorcycle and sold fish in regions far from their home. Currently, they depend on a truck to distribute fish and furthermore, they opened a small canteen where they offer different types of fast food dishes. The menu varies but is composed of fish and beverages.

The loan they request will be used to buy more fish and vegetables, condiments, and sodas for their canteen.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La Sra. Clavelina tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Herminio López hace 25 años, tienen 2 hijas, ambas menores y estudiantes de la secundaria.

Tienen una microempresa que se dedica a la compra y venta de pescados al por mayor y menor. Mantiene una antigüedad de 20 años y ya posee su clientela formada.

Se iniciaron con la venta de pescado en forma ambulante en el micro centro de Asunción ( Capital del Paraguay ), luego junto con su marido adquirieron una moto y empezaron a vender por las zonas más lejanas a su domicilio, Actualmente cuentan con una camioneta para la distribución y además abrieron un pequeño copetín (comedor) en donde también venden distintos tipos de comidas rápidas, diferentes menús hechos con pescado y bebidas.

Con el crédito desean adquirir más pescados además de verduras, condimentos y gaseosas para el copetín.

loans.use: buy fish, vegetables, condiments, and beverages

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn C. T., age 34, works as a farmer growing vegetables, mainly peppers, making on average $10 each day. Her husband runs a motorcycle repair shop making on average $5 each day. They have two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more spare parts to supply her husband’s inventory to meet his growing clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase spare motorcycle parts to expand the repair business.

loans.name: Norma Elida's Group

texts.en:
Norma, Esther, and Teofila have been members of the community bank “Marcela” for about two years. In that time they have learned be responsible, punctual, and to save.

Norma is 41 years old. She is a single mom raising her three children. Norma runs a hostel. She has been running her business for fifteen years. Holy Week is next month and it is the biggest tourism event in the area. Norma plans to use her loan to make some repairs to her hostel in order to accommodate the tourists.

Esther is 28 years old. She lives with her partner and two young children. Teofila travels eight hours on poor roads twice per week to sell food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar in the jungle region. With loans from the community bank she has also been able to buy two motorcycle taxis, which she leases to people who drive them.

Teofila is 50 years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of thirty and eight. Teofila is an artisan weaver who concentrates on blankets. She has been weaving for eight years and sells her products from her home.

Norma, Esther, and Teofila need loans of 200, 1500, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy decorations, new sheets, food staples, thread, yarn, and fabrics.

One of the most important aspects of the community banks is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Norma, Esther, and Teofila plan to use their savings to buy a home, a van, and a sewing machine for a daughter who is studying to be a tailor.

loans.use: Norma, Esther, and Teofila need loans of 200, 1500, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy decorations, new sheets, food staples, thread, yarn, and fabrics.

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
I am Nargis R., married and a mother of six: two sons and four daughters. I have lived all my life in Lahore, Pakistan. My husband works at a local hospital. One of my sons wants to buy a taxi that he plans to rent out to supplement our household income. We will also add in our savings to your loan for this purpose. I plan to save this extra income to collect dowries for my daughters.

I am joined in my loan group by four other women: Balqees B., who runs a tailoring business; Samina, who is borrowing for her family’s beetle-nut shop; Rubina and Walayat, who both run beauty salons. These women are very hardworking entrepreneurs and wish to give their children a decent living standard.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is forty-nine years old and the mother of three children. She has been selling clothing, batik shirts, linens and other sewing materials, deodorants, perfumes and other cosmetics in Koforidua for eighteen years now. She wants to use her loan to buy more cosmetics and clothing to expand her business. Comfort is a member of the group called Good Family. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothing, cosmetics, deodorants, perfumes, etc

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Saada M.. She is single and has two children, ages 17 and 22. She also has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans.

In 2006, Saada established her rice business. Working seven days a week and 5 to 9 hours each day, she earns about USD $150 every month from this business. She is assisted by her children and one employee.

Saada needs a loan to buy additional stocks of rice and soap. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $90. In the future, Saada plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice and soap in bulk.

loans.name: Akofa Bayi

texts.fr:
Ms. Akofa Bayi G., age 24, was born in Lomé and come from a modest family. She is an energetic girl who started trading in charcoal in 2007. At first, she used to sell grain but thought well to leave it behind and to embrace commerce in charcoal, which not anyone can do. Even though this is a tough business, especially when it comes to getting inventory, she would like to do it because she found a location to make rapid sales. She is going to get her supplies five times a week up north. She has wanted to buy more than in the past and is requesting this loan to buy 50 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 24 ans, Mademoiselle G. Akofa Bayi est née à Lomé et vient d’une famille modeste. Elle est une fille dynamique qui a commencé le commerce de charbon de bois depuis l’année 2007. Entre temps elle vendait les céréales mais elle a jugé bon de laisser ce commerce et d’embrasser le commerce de charbon de bois qui n’est pas connu par tout le monde. Bien que l’exercice de cette activité soit difficile surtout au moment de l’approvisionnement, elle désire le faire car elle a trouvée un bon emplacement pour pouvoir les écouler rapidement. Elle va s’approvisionner cinq fois par semaine au nord du pays. Elle voulait en acheter plus qu’elle le faisait avant et sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 50 sacs de charbons de bois.

loans.use: To buy 50 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of freezer, provisions, and drinks

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Jhanneth is the president and is married with two children, one who is 17 years old and the other is 23 years old. Her husband is Mr. Paulino, who is a typographer. She has sold clothing in the farmer’s market for the past five years. She is grateful to Agrocapital for the loan because it will bring more clothes and money from selling to her customers.

Maria sells Avon and Ebel products, Francisca sells vegetables, Shirley sells clothes, Julia sells food, Wilson is dedicated to public transportation, Filomena sells food, Milady sells Avon products, Juana sells potatoes, Vicxtori sells hamburgers, Julia sells coal, Margarita sells cosmetics, AngeL. sells food, Mercy sells clothes, DanieL. and Lucero also sell cosmetics, Cira offers services, Isabel sells food.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

L. presidenta es L. señora Jhanneth es casada y tiene dos hijos uno D. 17 años y el otro D. 23 años, el esposo es el señor Paulino, es tipógrafo. L. señora se dedica a L. venta D. ropa en el mercado campesino ya hace cinco años. Y esta muy agradecida a Agrocapital por que el préstamo le servirá para traer más ropa pera L. venta a sus clientes. Maria venD. productos Avon y Ebel, Francisca venD. verduras, shirley venD. ropa, Julia venD. comida, Wilson se dedica al transporte público, Filomena venD. comida, Milady venD. productos D. Avon, Juana venD. papa, vicxtori venD. hamburguesas, Julia venD. carbón, Margarita venD. cosméticos, AngeL. venD. comida, Mercy venD. ropa, DanieL. y Lucero también venden cosméticos, Cira ofrece servicios, Isabel venD. comida.

loans.use: Capital for Operations

loans.name: Antonio De Jesús

texts.es: Habitante del Barrio Laureles Norte, del distrito seis de Managua, vive solo en su casa de habitación, donde también trabaja en su pequeño taller de Mecánica y soldadura, lo inició hace 10 años con fondos propios, ya que contaba con la experiencia en estos trabajo y decidió aventurarse poniendo el taller en su casa como alternativa de trabajo.  Le tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar de los cuales apoya a la madre de ellos para su debida alimentación, estudios y salud. En la actualidad solicita este crédito para mejorar el techo de la casa y su mayor deseo es mantener su negocio en vías de crecimiento y poder apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan completar sus estudios
texts.en:
A citizen of Barrio Laureles Norte in the district of Seis de Managua, this person lives alone in his home and also works from his small mechanic and soldering shop. He started 10 years ago this self-funded business having had previous experience in this field of work. He decided to go on his own and set up a workshop in his home as an alternative to working for someone else.

He has 3 school-aged children and he supports their mother with child support, providing for their nutrition, schooling and health.

He is requesting this loan to renovate the roof of his house. His greatest dream is to maintain his business and keep it growing to be able to support his children so that they may finish their studies.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate the roof of his house.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Mrs. Parbati R. M. is a tailor in the town of Tikhidewal in Lalitpur. She lives with her husband, Mr. Bhoj Bahadur, who is a farmer.

Before starting her own business, Mrs. R. M. took a 6 month training course in tailoring. She opened her tailoring shop a year ago and now also has a training center for tailoring. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, long ladies dresses, Makhshi, and others.

Mrs. Parbati R. M. is requesting a loan of Rs 10,000 ($150.00). She plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: Buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Sabinus

texts.en:
Sabinus N. is 38 years old. He is married and he has one child. His child is in grade 5 of private school. Sabinus is determined to lift his family above poverty.

He sells sunglasses of various types. He is happy because the festive season is approaching and the demands for his sunglasses will increase.

He is requesting a loan of N50,000 so he can purchase more sunglasses to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sunglasses to sell

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: Né vers 1973 dans l’arrondissement de  KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, dame   S. A. Céline est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. Elle cultive dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement   GM SENABLO DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 100 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in the district of Kessounou, in the town of Dangbo, Mrs. Céline S. A. is married and the mother of 6 children, of whom one is enrolled in school. She is a farmer in the village of Glahounsa in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GM Senablo of Glahounsa.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Céline S. A. has requested a loan of 100,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 1 hectare, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1 hectare in maize (corn) and hot peppers

loans.name: Alaine

texts.en: Alaine S., 19, is single with  children.  She has 1 year of experience in the Elei (traditional fabric printing) business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Alaine’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase printing boards, materials, and brushes for painting

loans.name: Vith

texts.en: Mrs. Vith T. lives in Srae Boeung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. She is facing some problems because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides to make her crop more productive. Thus, she decided to apply for a loan buy these things. Her husband, Mr. Ket Suy, is a hairdresser. Mrs. Vith T. is 43 years old and the mother of two children, both of who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is seen here with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides to make her farm more productive.

loans.name: Aidah Namukasa Group

texts.en:
Aidah, a 49-year-old group leader of four other women, has seven children between 16 and 28 years of age, all attending school. She rents a one-room house with electricity and water access where she resides with her children. She also takes care of additional family members. Her greatest expenses in a month are rent and feeding her family

For the past 14 years, Aidah has sold second hand clothes from a market stall she rents, normally receiving about 20 customers a day working six days a week. She has been with MCDT for over four years now, having chosen them for their timely service, and is currently servicing her 12th loan. She is requesting her latest loan to increase her stock.

Aidah looks forward to expanding her business to improve her income.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Candelaria Marina

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria Marina G. M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Andina”, del barrio M.,  en el distrito de Platería, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su negocio es la artesanía (tejido a mano), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de lana para sus tejidos.  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas fibra de alpaca al por mayor y poder hilarlo para elaborar sus tejidos tales como chompas, guantes, chullos, etc. es decir todo lo que le pidan sus clientes; su deseo es comprarse un carrito para transportar sus tejidos a las diferentes ferias de la región.
texts.en:
Mrs. Candelaria Marina G. M. is a member of the Banco Comunal "Flor Andina" in the M. neighborhood, Plateria district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 43 years old, single and has no children. She completed middle school. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuel Ramos for the past two years. She is an artisan knitter and her first loan was for 300 new soles which she used to purchase wool for her knits. She now needs a loan of 1000 new soles which she will pay back in four payments. These funds will be used to acquire additional alpaca fiber at wholesale which she will spin into yarn in order to knit sweaters, mittens, caps, etc., in other words, whatever her customers require. Her wish is to purchase a small cart to transport her knits to the various regional fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alpaca fiber to knit sweaters, mittens, caps, etc.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina M. is a 50-year-old widow and the mother of five children.  She has two daughters who have graduated from college, two children who are still in college, and another child that is no longer in school.  Before she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) she sold various snack foods.  The proceeds from previous loans she received were used to open up her store.  

She is now applying for another loan to buy assorted groceries, which she believes will help her both sustain and expand her business.  Indeed, she wants to expand her store in the future in order to generate additional income so that she can finance her two college students' studies.  She feels that, by expanding her inventory, she will maintain her loyal customers and attract new customers.  Finally, she explains that her membership in ASHI has had a positive impact on her life and her entire family.

loans.use: To expand and improve her store by purchasing additional foods

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Fatima R. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual posee ella misma en su establecimiento con el propósito de salir adelante en su vida.

Actualmente ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería y así suplir sus estantes para atender a sus clientes en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the town of Chinandega, Mrs. Fatima R. owns a local store as her goal is to get ahead in life.

Presently she needs to invest in her business and for that reason she has approached Ceprodel to benefit from a loan in order to buy products for her local store and thus supply the shelves so she can serve her clients properly in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products.

loans.name: Atsoupi Julienne

texts.fr: Cette femme est une dame très dynamique qui travaille dur pour aider son époux qui est un enseignant  dans les charges du foyer. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce est le commerce de pagnes, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de bijoux. Elle s’approvisionne en pagnes au grand marché de Lomé et en bijoux au BENIN. Elle est très sympathique et accueillante avec ses clients. Mais elle fait face en ce moment à une rupture de stock. Elle s’adresse alors à WAGES pour solliciter un crédit avec lequel elle pourra acheter 20 pièces de pagnes et 6 douzaines de bijoux.
texts.en:
This is a very energetic woman who works hard to help her husband, a teacher, with the family expenses. Her business consists in selling pagnes (colorful African cloth), to which she added the sale of jewelry. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé for the pagnes, and in Benin for the jewels. She's very kind and friendly with her customers, but she's currently faced with a depleted stock. She's therefore seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, that will enable her to buy 20 pieces of pagnes and six dozen jewels.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pagnes and jewelry

loans.name: Youssouf

texts.fr:
Marié sans enfant, Monsieur Youssouf S. a  25 ans et vit  avec sa femme dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni(troisième région du Mali)
Pour des raisons sociales (la pauvreté extrême de ses parents), Monsieur Youssouf S. décida d’abandonner l’école (à l'âge de 15 ans) pour mener des activités génératrices de revenus afin  d’aider ses parents à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
Après plusieurs années de commerce tout azimut, il  décide finalement de s’installer dans la vente d’articles  divers de boutique dans son quartier. Avec ses 4 années d’expériences,  Youssouf S. maîtrise bien son activité.
Afin d’étoffer son fonds de commerce, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte acheter divers articles de boutique à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectuer sa vente dans sa boutique sise à Massablacoura à une clientèle riche et variée.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Youssouf S. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA qui servira à  agrandir sa boutique  et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Married and having no children, Mr. Youssouf S. is 24 years old and lives with his wife in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For societal reasons (his parents' extreme poverty), he decided to drop out of school (at age 15) to earn an income in order to help his parents provide for the family. After several years of all kinds of commerce, he decided in the end to get settled in selling various shop goods in his district. With his four years of experience, he has a good command of his business. To expand his working capital, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and is on his first individual loan. He intends to buy various shop goods in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. And he'll make his sales to a rich and varied customer base out of his shop located in Massablacoura. With this loan, he hopes to realize a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA for expanding his shop and for meeting the needs of the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is married and the mother of three children. She is 41years old and currently living with her family. She is a very hard working woman and committed to her work. She prepares and sells doughnuts in her neighborhood. They are prepared from flour; her doughnuts are mostly purchased by the school children and she sometimes sells the rest through hawking. Georgina treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She asks for this loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine etc. to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, sugar, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul O. is 40 years old. He is married and has 5 children. He sells sarongs of various colours in the market. He is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. He says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea M., 36 (pictured with her husband), and her husband, Mr. Sina Noun, 39, live along National Road Number One about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2004 and have a young son.

Sophea has been a tailor for 8 years. In addition to her tailoring business, she sells second-hand clothes. Her husband has been a security guard for many years. She is applying for her first loan of $ 1,200 to purchase silk fabrics for her tailoring business and second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.use: To purchase silk fabrics for her tailoring business and second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is forty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Gladys lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. Gladys supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio es casado con la Sra. Teresa, tienen cuatro  hijos de 8, 10, 12  y 14 años respectivamente. Poseen un bien inmueble propio. Cecilio se dedica a prestar sus servicios  como maestro albañil.   La conyugue vende desayunos en su carrito ambulante.  Ambos cuentan con muchos años de experiencia en cada uno de sus rubros. La competencia es alta, pero la antigüedad, experiencia, calidad,  rapidez e higiene impuesta en cada uno de sus rubros, les ha permitido ser requeridos constantemente por los servicios que prestan. El destino del crédito es para mejorar la vivienda que poseen, efectuado algunas mejoras tercer préstamo  al que acceden, con excelente comportamiento de pago demostrado en sus créditos anteriores. No tienen pasivos en el sistema financiero.
texts.en:
Cecilio is married to his wife Teresa, and they have 4 children, ages 8, 10, 12 and 14. They own a nice home. Cecilio works as a builder. His wife sells breakfasts from a cart. They both have many years of experiences in their careers. Competition is fierce, but the years, experience, quality, speed and cleanliness apparent in their work has led them to be called on constantly for their services. The purpose of this loan is to improve their home. Some improvements have already been made. This is their third loan, and they have demonstrated their commitment to repaying these loans. They do not have any debts in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: improve and expand their house

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 48 years old and married with four children. For the last ten years, she has been selling beans, rice and other provisions. Bola hopes for the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more inventory. She would like to say "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Liduvina es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Liduvina es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Liduvina tiene un restaurante polleria llamado Kevin Chicken, en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 9 personas.
Liduvina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Liduvina son ampliar su negocio, tener una cadena de pollerias y brindar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Liduvina is a member of the Violeta communal bank.

Liduvina is married, 38 years old, and has 2 children. Liduvina has a chicken restaurant called Kevin Chicken, in a rented location located in the center of the city. She works there every day with the help of 9 people.

Liduvina needs a loan of PEN 2000 which she will invest in buying rice and sugar.

Liduvina's dreams are to grow her business, to have a chain of chicken restaurants, and to give a good quality of life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: José Catalino

texts.es:
José tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos varones de 18, 15 y 10 años de edad en el caserío Pasabar La Granja, distrito de Olmos, ubicado dos horas al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El trabaja durante todo el día como peón agrícola, pero esta ocupación no es estable, por lo que se vio en la necesidad de instalar hace tres años en su vivienda una pequeña bodega – tienda que es administrada por su mujer. Alli ofrece productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes y bebidas a los vecinos del lugar.

Actualmente su bodega se encuentra desabastecida debido a la constante demanda de sus clientes. Por este motivo está solcitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más productos y así ampliar su negocio.

El nos comenta que debido a la difícil situación económica por la que atraviesa no ha podido bridarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior: los dos hijos mayores trabajan para solventar sus gastos y apoyar a la economía familiar, mientras que el último estudia en un colegio de la zona.

Su más grande anhelo es hacer crecer su bodega y reunir los ingresos suficientes para brindarle a sus hijos la educación que necesitan para asegurarse estabilidad en el futuro.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their three sons, who are 18, 15 and 10 years old, in the Pasabar La Granja neighborhood of Olmos District, two hours north of the city of Chiclayo. During the day, he works as an agricultural laborer, but this is not steady work, so three years ago he decided he needed to open a small grocery store within his home, which his wife now runs. They offer their neighbors basic goods like rice, sugar and oil, as well as other dry goods and drinks. His store is currently depleted of merchandise because of his neighbors' constant high demand. This is why he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa: a loan of 1000 soles which he will use to buy more products and expand his business. He tells us that because of the difficult economic circumstances he faces, he hasn't been able to give his children the opportunity to pursue higher education. His two older children work to help support the family, while his youngest son is studying at a local school. His greatest dream is to expand his business and save up enough to provide his children with the education they need in order to to ensure a stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more basic goods to expand his store

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An S., 32, is a married man who works as a construction worker. He and his wife have been living in a fishing boat on the river for more than nine years.

They wake up every morning, drive their boat toward the middle of river, and then fish. Once they finish, they hurry to bring their fish to the market to sell to their regular buyers on credit. They collect money after their buyers finish selling the fish.

Recently, they haven't been able to catch as many fish as before because some of their fishing equipment has been ruined. Therefore, An S. is applying for a loan to repair the old equipment and to also buy more equipment.

loans.use: To repair old fishing equipment and to buy more equipment

loans.name: Jesus Miguel

texts.es: Don Jesús Miguel es originario de la zona 4 del municipio de Totonicapan su principal actividad es la artesania en la elaboracion de sandalias para damas dicho oficio lo aprendio  de su querido padre hace mas de veinte años hoy se ve la necesida de remodelar un pequeño taller ya que ha planificado ampliar su taller para el dos mil diez, la cual necesita de mayor espacio para poder contar con tres operario con ello aumenta su produccion y mejor su nivel de vida y la de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Don Jesús Miguel is originally from District 4 of the town of Totonicapan. He is a craftsman who manufactures women’s sandals. He learned this trade more than 20 years ago from his beloved father. He needs to remodel and enlarge his small workshop, and hopes to have the project completed by 2010. Jesús Miguel needs the additional space to make room for three more workers so that he can increase production and provide a better standard of living for his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand his workshop

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 14 años atrás del distrito  y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 48 años de edad, estudiò primaria incompleta, es casada y tiene 6 hijos (2 de ellos están a su lado y 4 viven aparte). 
Cristina se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y adicionalmente cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes y un kiosco en la escuela de su distrito.Ella nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
En la actualidad solicitará un crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar mercadería de abarrotes como fideos, azúcar, arroz, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Tacna y poner una tienda. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias
texts.en:
Cristina has been a member of the “Tupac Amaru I” communal bank in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the Puno department, for the past 14 years. She is 48 years old, married, and has 6 children (2 live with her and 4 live separately). She completed some of primary school.

Cristina purchases and sells cattle and also has a grocery store and kiosk at the school in her district. She tells us that with her first loan with Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which was for 300 PEN, she was able to increase her capital. She is currently asking for a loan of 3000 PEN with which she will be able to purchase grocery merchandise such as pasta, sugar, rice, etc.

Her dream for the future is to have her house in Tacna and set up a store. What she likes most about her communal bank are the savings and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, pasta

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato tiene 54 años, vive con su esposa Lidia, que tiene 52 años, y con sus dos últimos hijos que son gemelos; Juber y Jhonny, ambos de 16 años. El resto de sus 6 hijos varones ya están casados y han formado sus propias familias.

Este jovial hombre se podría decir que es “multifuncional”, ya que tiene varios oficios, los cuales desempeña con mucha dedicación. Primero empezó con la agricultura, trabajo en el que hasta hoy ocupa gran parte de su tiempo, siembra papa, cebada y alverja, con las que obtiene buenas ganancias. Para estas labores le apoyan sus hijos gemelos, pero sólo cuando tienen tiempo porque ellos aun no terminan sus estudios. También se dedica a la crianza y venta de carneros y cuyes y paralelamente realiza todo tipo de artesanías, entre alfombras, telares, chompas, etc. En esta actividad también ocupa bastante tiempo, porque le gusta y aprendió desde muy joven.
Desde entonces, esta actividad también le genera buenas ganancias y le gusta mucho, ya que hace hermosos telares de distintos colores y texturas.
Para el futuro tiene pensado sembrar en mayor cantidad y migrar de la zona donde vive para probar suerte en otras tierras donde tiene familiares, pero continuar con la agricultura.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que cumplirá con cada pago porque quiere pedir otros créditos para seguir adelante con todos sus sueños. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para dar el tratamiento adecuado a sus tierras, y también adquirirá más carneros y cuyes para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Fortunato is 54 years old and lives with his wife Lidia, age 52, and their youngest two sons, who are twins: Juber and Jhonny, both age 16. The rest of their sons are married and have their own families. This cheerful man can be described as "multi-functional", as he currently works in various trades and is very dedicated to each. He began in farming, which still occupies a large part of his time today, growing potatoes, barley, and peas, which turn a good profit. His twin sons help him with the farming, but only when they have time, since they are still in school. Fortunato also raises and sells rams and guinea pigs, and produces different types of textiles including carpets, weavings, sweaters, etc. This work also occupies a lot of his time, because he learned to create woven products when he was very young and likes the work. Since then, this work has also generated good income and he really enjoys making beautiful weavings that have distinctive colors and textures. In the future he plans to plant greater quantities and move away from where he currently lives to try his luck farming in a different region where he has relatives. This is his first loan from MFP and Fortunato is sure he will make each payment because he wants to qualify for future loans to continue progress toward his dreams. The money he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of manure and fertilizers to properly cultivate his crops. He will also acquire more rams and guinea pigs to continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Claudia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La  Señora Claudia del Socorro M. C., Labora como Inspector en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua.
 Ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, Cemento y mano de obra, para construcción de una pared de su casa de habitación ya que esta estaba construida de tabla.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia del Socorro M. C. works as an inspector for the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. She is raising two school-age children.
