texts.en: Mrs. Lun H., aged 59, is a housewife. Her husband works as a farmer growing rice and various kinds of vegetables, earning only $1 each day. She has two children who are married, and one of her children’s family lives with them. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more rice seeds and yams to expand her crops and raise her income.

loans.use: To purchase more rice seed and yams to expand her crops.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz T. C. sells chickens in the main market of Picota in the Department of San Martin. She has been selling chickens in the stall, which she rents from the municipality of Picota, since 2005. She started the business because she wanted to help pay for her family's basic needs and save for her children’s education.

Luz is 34 years old and is happily married with 2 children. She loves her business. Although she has an advanced degree in administration from a technical school, she prefers working in the market.

A member of Manuela Ramos Credi Mujer and the community bank Mujeres En Accion, Luz is requesting a loan of S/800 to be repaid over 6 months. With this loan, Luz would like to buy more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Salelavalu Tai Centre - Group 3

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these two women of Salelavalu Tai, from the island of Savaii, passed their written tests on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) to ensure their first group loand from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individual business endeavours to guarantee on-time payments.

Sulufaiga L., 35, has 5 children and is married to an engineer. Her family has been involved in farming for many years. Specifically, she grows taro, bananas and other produce. For two days of the week, she sells themto the people in her village and during the rest of the week, she sells them to the other public. With her loan, she will purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, three knives, a filing, two spades and three laborers. She expects to earn 100 Tala (~40 USD) per week in net cash flow.

Koreti L., 44, is married, with seven children. She has over five years experience with her shop where she sells donuts, snacks, drinks and other times 7 days per week. With her loan, she will purchase flour, sugar, oil, yeast, chicken legs, lamb ribs, butter and boxes of noodles. She expects to earn 200 Tala (~80 USD) per week in net cash flow.

loans.use: Purchase assorted goods to sell at the market and farming equipment, etc.

loans.name: Maria Serafina's Group

texts.es:
Maria, Ana and Maria have belonged to the Communal Bank Morenita II for one year.

Maria is 49 years old, is married and has four children She buys cereals, tuna, tara and cochineal at fairs and towns which she subsequently sells at markets in the city of Ayacucho. Sometimes she brings fruit from Lima and sells it at the Nery Garcia Market.

Ana is 39 years old, is a single mother and has two children. Ana sells wood in bulk which she acquires in Cangallo. Ana also breeds guinea pigs.

Maria is 25 years old, is married and has one child. Maria sells fruit in the Nery Garcia market. She acquires her fruit in the city of Pampas.

Maria, Ana and Maria need a loan of 600 soles, 300 soles, and 300 soles respectively. They will use the money to purchase cochineal, tara, wood and papaya.

Maria, Ana and Maria dream of having a larger business, their own home and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria, Ana y Maria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Morenita II hace 1 año.

Maria es casada, tiene 49 años y 4 hijos, Maria compra cereales, tuna, cochinilla, tara en las ferias y pueblos, productos que posteriormente vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Algunas veces trae frutas de la ciudad de Lima y lo vende en el mercado Nery García.

Por otro lado Ana es madre soltera, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Ana vende leña al por mayor, su producto es adquirido en Cangallo. Además Ana se dedica a la crianza de cuyes.

Mientras que Maria es casada, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Maria vende frutas en el mercado Nery García, sus productos son adquiridos de la ciudad de Pampas.

Maria, Ana y Maria necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 300 soles, 300 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cochinilla, tara, leña y papaya.

Los sueños de Maria, Ana y Maria son tener una negocio más grande, casa propia, sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of cochineal, tara, wood and papaya.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu B. is 33 years old and married with a child. She is a professional nurse and her husband is a laboratory technician in one of the hospitals in Makeni town. With their meager salaries, they started a mini phamacy in the town, providing services to the community. They also purchased some medicines on credit in which the installments are paid on a daily basis. This did not enable Abibatu to make a good profit.

With news of the Kiva program going around the town, Abibatu approached SMT with a loan request of Le.2,500,000 ($US875) to purchase stock with cash and build her own capital.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of medicines.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 41 years old. She is married with four children. At the moment, they are all in school. She buys clothing, jeans and jewelry at wholesale prices and distributes them to her customers at retail prices at their door step.

Georgina would like distribute higher quality merchandise to meet the preference of her customers but needs a loan to pursue that. With the loan, she wants to purchase gold and diamond jewelry and top-quality jeans to serve her customers. She hopes to save more income to open her own container shop.

She is a member of the trust group called ‘Nyame Nnae’ (meaning God is Not Asleep). In this group, members guarantee one another's loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loan. Georgina is in the photo, taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase gold and diamond jewelry and top quality jeans.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmouna T. is twenty-seven years old and lives with her two children and her husband in a monogamous household in the Bougoulaville neighborhood in downtown Sikasso, in the third administrative district of Mali. For economic reasons, she did not attend school, but quickly took interest in income-generating activities. Since 2004, she has been particularly focused on the purchase and sale of clothing, baby powder and various other commodities.

Due to her lack of personal funds and a growing demand for her services, she sought the help of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which is coordinating this loan. She intends to buy ten dozen bottles of baby powder, twenty handbags, twenty pairs of women’s shoes and two boxes of beauty products.

She restocks monthly in the city of Bobo Dioulasso, in neighboring Burkina Faso. She sells her wares in her home as well as at the central market in Sikasso. Her business caters mainly to young women and new mothers. Most of her sales are retail and paid in cash. She has a loyal client base.

The profit from this loan, which is estimated at 100,000 CFA francs, will help cover the costs of family life, pay the interest on the loan, and provide further funds for her business.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Maïmouna T. a 27 ans et vit avec ses 2 enfants et son époux dans une famille monogame au quartier Bougoula-ville au centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Pour des raisons économiques elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école et s’est très vite interessée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente d’habits, de poudre pour enfants et d’articles divers depuis 2004. En raison de l’insuffissance de son fonds propre et en raison de la demande croissante, elle décida de solliciter la collabration de Soro Yiriwaso qui vient de lui octroyer un premier prêt. Elle compte acheter 10 douzaines de Poudre pour enfant, 20 sacs à main féminins, 20 paires de chaussures feminines et 2 cartons de produits de beauté. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso (république du Burkina Faso un pays limitrophe de la république du Mali) généralement une fois par mois. Elle vend ses articles au grand marché de Sikasso et au niveau du domicile conjugal. Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes, de démoiselles et des nouvelles mamans. Ses ventes se font généralement en détail au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle très fidèle. Le bénéfice estimé à 100.000 FCFA servira aux dépenses familiales en appui à son mari, à payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Purchase of handbags, beauty products and women's shoes

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Mrs. Theng M., 33, is a farmer while her husband, Mr. Chhoeng Rit, is a bricklayer. They live in Kork Thlork Commune in the Siem Reap Province. Theng has been farming since 1990 and typically earns around 4,000 Riel (US $1.00) per day. Because her farming business is the main source of income for her family, she would like to request a loan to purchase a plot of land to expand her rice growing.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land for her rice growing

loans.name: Alma Fabiola

texts.es:
Alma inicio el negocio por el gusto hacia las ventas, los deseos D. superación y D. salir adelante, D. ganar su propio dinero para poder comprar sus cosas y ser una mujer independiente. Comenzó en Junio del 2005 cuando una amiga L. invito a vender ropa, le dijo que era muy buen negocio y acepto, posteriormente compro unos catálogos D. artículos para decorar interiores D. las casa (artesanías), las cuales empezó comprando para su casa, pero a las personas que L. visitaban les gustaban mucho y las empezó a encargar para venderlas y D. ahí a L. fecha le ha ido muy bien.

ElL. necesita un prestamo por US $375 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar variedad D. mercancía para poder ofrecerles mejores opciones a sus clientes y con esto obtener mejores ganancias para invertir nuevamente. Con tu apoyo podra lograrlo.
texts.en:
Alma started her business as she enjoys selling and has a desire for self-improvement, for getting ahead, and for earning her own money to enable her to buy her things and become an independent lady. She started in the year of 2005 when a friend invited her to sell clothes as she told her it was good business; she accepted and later bought catalogues with articles for interior decoration (craftworks) which she started to buy for her own house, but people visiting her liked them so much and she started ordering the items to sell them and from then on she has been doing very well.

Alma needs a loan of $375, to be repaid in 4 months, to purchase a variety of merchandise to offer better options to her clients and thus obtain higher earnings to be invested again. With your support she will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to improve sales

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina operates a small business selling children's clothes in Nikolaev, Ukraine. She has an attractively arranged little outdoor kiosk at the Ekur market in Nikolaev where she carries all sorts of necessary items for babies and kids. Irina has been in business for about two years and has developed a stable, profitable enterprise based on products that are always in demand. Her business has become the main source of income for her, her husband Maxim and 6-year-old daughter. In a typical month she makes around $1,000 in income.

Irina's business is growing. She has requested a loan of 2000 Grivnas, $375, to increase her working capital and help boost the further development of her business.

Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase the variety of products

loans.name: Rabi

texts.fr:
Née en 1979 à Atakpamé, ville située à 180 Km de la capitale du Togo, madame K. Rabi est mariée et mère de deux enfants. En 2001 elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure dans le quartier Agoè au nord de Lomé. Dans son atelier, elle vend aussi des bijoux et des mèches. 
Son premier crédit lui a permis de d’aménager son atelier afin de pouvoir attirer des clients.
Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter 60 colliers et 45 mèches. Ce nouveau stock lui permettra de pouvoir bien vendre durant la période des fêtes en décembre.
texts.en:
Born in 1979 in Atakpamé, a city 180 km from the capital of Togo, Mrs. Rabi K. is married and has two children. In 2001, she opened a hairdressing studio in the Agoè district in northern Lomé. In her studio, she also sells jewelry and hair extensions. Her first loan allowed her to outfit her studio in order to attract more customers. She is asking for this second loan to buy 60 necklaces and 45 sets of hair extensions. This new stock will allow her to sell well during the period of festivals in December.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry and hair extensions for resale

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en:
N. Nuriddin is 51 years old and was born in Penjikent, Tajikistan. He is the father of three children, and his main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. A very ambitious man, he would like to buy a greater number of cattle, and to build a farmhouse to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni ($ 150 USD) for the realization of this project. He promises to repay the loan in 12 months. When his dream is carried out, he will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help this will be possible. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle and the small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.es:
El señor Eliud R. tiene una hermosa familia y como tal desea lo mejor para sus hijos 
Con dos créditos anteriores de FVP ha construido una parte de su casa pero no ha concluido, le está faltando los acabados interiores y poner las protecciones de las puertas y ventanas.
Está solicitando un préstamo para terminar la mejora y planea pagarlo con los ingresos de su trabaja. Él y su esposa desean que sus hijos tengan su propio espacio para que les permita estar más cómodos y felices.
texts.en:
Mr. Eliud R. has a lovely family and wants the best for his children. He used his two prior FVP loans to build part of his house, but he is not done yet. He still needs to do some interior finish work and add locks to the windows and doors. He is requesting a loan so he can finish the improvements. He plans to pay it off with income from his job. He and his wife would like their children to have space of their own so they can be happier and more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior finish work and iron working shop

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. Mona has owned a gift shop for six years. She sells perfumes, make-up, toys and accessories. Mona has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for her shop, but especially to purchase gifts for Valentine’s Day. 

This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

Her previous loan helped her to improve her business. Mona is special in her work because she offers many choices to her clients and has diversity in her collection. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t believe in her work and never thought that her business would succeed. She decided to start her business because she had bought the shop and she wanted to help supplement her family's income. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Mona will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen, brings home for processing and preservation, and then sends to the market for sale at Atobiase near Elmina. Mary has been selling fish since 1996. She has received no formal education. She is married with 3 children, and her husband is a farmer. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in their children's education.

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica E. sells provisions and drinks in Oliha Quarters in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She needs the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander runs a small business selling electronics in a bus station market of Mukachevo, Transcarpathians. The location of his business is very favorable as there are many bus and car drivers who come for electronic supplies and parts for their vehicles. Alexander offers assorted merchandise which attracts new customers and brings many of them back later. Alexander has been in this trade for 4 years. Presently, he has 40,000 Grivnas in working capital.

The inventory Alexander offers for retail sale is always in high demand. Alexander enjoys working with this type of merchandise. He likes electronics and can always give good advice to a customer. This time he is seeking a loan for 10,000 Grivnas. He is hoping to increase his turnover capital and sales as a result. Alexander is planning to grow his business and keep stable standing ensuring his decent livelihood.

loans.use: To generate additional income by expanding inventory

loans.name: Karla Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Nancy Mercedes Tercian V., Karla de los Angeles S. V. y Mercedes del Carmen H. Orozco.
 El grupo solidario Karla, es originario de la comarca Las Flores perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, de forma general se dedican a la elaboración ropa, calzado y salón de belleza.
Son bien conocidas entre ellas y de confianza, son mujeres jóvenes que tienen mucho empeño y trabajar y salir adelante, les gusta trabajar con Adim porque reciben capacitaciones de cómo mejorar su negocio.

Doña Nancy elabora ropa, tiene un pequeño taller en su casa de habitación donde elabora delantales, camisas de uniforme escolar y manteles. Es una mujer joven con un niño pequeño, ella inició su taller para tener más ingresos para ayudar con los gastos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa textil y de ahí ella pensó en tener este tipo de negocio.
Doña Mercedes del Carmen se dedica a la elaboración de calzado femenino, tiene dos trabajadores, en su casa está el taller, con el crédito compró pega, cuero, materiales plásticos para dar diseño a las sandalias. Espera poder mejorar el taller y darle más protección para el invierno y no detenerse de trabajar por la lluvia ya que está descubierto.
Doña Karla de los Angeles tiene un pequeño salón de belleza en su casa, tiene buena clientela, necesita el crédito para comprar cosméticos que usa en los arreglos de cabellos y para ofrecer a los clientes que llegan, ella fue elegida como coordinadora del grupo por ser persona responsable en reunir los abonos y dejarlos en las oficinas de Adim, ella sueña con mejorar la sala de belleza y comprar más espejos para dar un mejor ambiente al lugar. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa de pollos y le ayuda a los gastos del hogar, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar primaria, este negocio le ha ayudado mucho a mantener a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In photograph from left to right: Nancy Mercedes Tercian Vasquez, Karla de los Angeles S. Vasquez and Mercedes del Carmen Hernandez Orozco. The solidarity group Karla is from the locality of Las Flores, city of Masaya. Their businesses are the making of clothing, shoes and a beauty salon. They are well known and trusted in the community, they are young women with a lot of drive and the desire to work and improve themselves. They like to work with Adim because they receive training in how to improve their businesses. Mrs. Nancy makes clothes; she has a small workshop in her home where she makes aprons, school shirts and tablecloths. She has a small child, and started her business to generate more income and help with expenses. Her husband works in a textile company, which is what gave her the idea for the business. Mrs. Mercedes del Carmen makes woman's shoes, she has two workers, her workshop is in her home. With credit she purchased glue, leather, and plastic to design her sandals. She hopes to improve her workshop and make it weather-proof, since presently she cannot work when it rains, as it is out in the open. Ms. Karla de los Angeles has a small beauty salon in her home, very good clients, and needs the loan to buy cosmetics for use in her shop. She was selected the group's coordinator, responsible for collecting the payments and dropping them off at the Adim office. She dreams to improve her beauty salon, purchase more mirrors and provide a better atmosphere to the place. Her husband works at a chicken processing factory and helps with the household expenses; she has three school-age children, and this business has helped her provide for her children immensely.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar cosméticos como tintes, cremas para peinar, geltinas para el pelo, colores para peinar, etc. Tambien compra pinturas como : maquillajes, cremas limpiadoras, sombras y lapices labiales, pinturas de uñas, etc., estos tambien se los ofrece a los clientes

loans.name: Selestina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Selestina from Mwanza. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 10 and 19 years old. Selestina has been running a grocery business since 1995. She operates her business from a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof where she sells general items such as beer, soda and water. She works 13 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase more drinks so she can expand her business and service more customers. Selestina thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a small entrepreneur from Drogobych. She runs a retail business selling newspapers and magazines. Moreover, she owns three additional vending locations selling office supplies and toys. One of the best attractions of her business is reasonable wholesale prices that make her business competitive in the market.

Galina launched her trade about seven years ago. Back then she was one of the first vendors working with this type of merchandise. Publications sales which is her major business trend is a specific business with a non-standard work day. It requires close and accurate management of copies for sale, and up-front payment for all printed matter. Galina has to calculate everything very thoroughly to make sure printed issues are not wasted causing her unexpected losses. 

Galina is a Christian. She always adds a little word of blessing as her customers buy from her. This always helps her have personal interaction, build a relationship, and establish a bond. This time Galina is requesting a loan of 14,500 Gryvnyas to re-stock her inventory.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Saidumar

texts.ru: Саидумар Чабборов проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 21 год. Холост, детей не имеет. Саидумар более 2 лет занимается бизнесом. Он имеет продуктовый магазин. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот. На полученный доход собирается жениться.
texts.en:
Saidumar Chabborov lives in Kurgan-Tube region. He is 21 years old, single, and has no children. He has been in business for over two years, running a small grocery store. He is requesting a loan in order to increase his trade turnover. Once his business generates a profit, he plans to marry.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase trade turnover

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married and mother to two children, who are currently in school. She is a 30 year-old trader. She trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She mostly sells through hawking. She says hawking makes her clothing materials moves very fast. For lack of adequate working capital, she buys minimal stock of lace materials and sells through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to expand her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk quantities of lace materials and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase bulk quantities of lace materials and textile.

loans.name: Folake

texts.en:
Folake sells drinks and medicines and has been in the business for the past five years. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years and the loans have boosted her business tremendously.

Folake is 40 years old and married with four children. She is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase more medicines and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase of more medicines and drinks to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan manages a village store located in Rio Del Grande, Enrile, Cagayan. She is already 41 years old and already married for 12 years but unfortunately they do not have any children. For this reason, Susan and her husband adopted her own niece since her parents could no longer support her education. At the moment, Susan strives hard to maintain her store with the assistance of her husband so they can send the child to school.

Her store has been operating for three years. She is thankful that she can continue to maintain it and make the business grow. At present, she is hoping to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 30,000 as additional capital that she will use for further development in her store. She hopes that she can sustain the business for many years in order to give her family a stable living. She enjoys doing the business and is hoping that someday, she will be able to convert the business into a real grocery store.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana Isabel F. es una mujer de origen muy humilde que a sus 50 años de edad, refleja mucha serenidad y templanza. Desde que era muy joven aprendió la elaboración de tortillas de maíz (Las tortillerías en Nicaragua han sido una tradición ancestral) las cuales representan el complemento diario del plato nica tanto en el desayuno como en la cena.

“Es por esto que el comercio de las mismas no disminuye aunque la economía se decaiga, siempre en nuestros platos sobresale la Tortillita Nica” nos dice doña Juana. Y es la razón por la que sigo vendiendo mucho y deseo ampliar aun más mi negocio. De tal manera que pueda llegar a vender queso, crema, chicharon y leche Agria (Producto lácteo similar en textura al yoghurt) entre otros.

Su crédito pretende invertirlo en la reposición de sus comales y utensilios para la elaboración de tortillas.

Es su primer ciclo individual, en ADIM pero lleva ya muchos ciclos en grupos solidarios (Con el grupo Fransela) y por su categoría como cliente A (El mejor cliente), ADIM le ha financiado un crédito individual.
texts.en:
Juana Isabel F. is a woman of humble origins. She is 50 years old and known for her calm and restrained personality. When she was very young, she learned how to prepare corn tortillas (an ancestral tradition in Nicaragua), which complements every Nicaraguan dish for breakfast and dinner.

“Our business doesn’t diminish when the economy declines because our dishes stand out because of the Nicaraguan tortilla,” says Doña Juana. This is the reason she continues to sell a lot of her product and hopes to further expand her business. She wants to sell cheese, cream, fried pork skins, sour milk (a dairy product similar in texture to yogurt), and other products.

Her loan will be used to replace her griddles and utensils for making tortillas.

This is Doña Juana’s first individual loan with ADIM, but she has participated in several solidarity loans (with the Fransela Group). She is categorized as an “A” client (the best rating), so ADIM has approved her for an individual loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment & materials for improving her business

loans.name: Rosa Danelia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Danelia C. es una persona muy trabajadora el cual se dedica a atender su pulpería en su localidad siendo este el sustento de su familia.

Es de importancia destacar que la señora Rosa Danelia ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos a sus proveedores y de esta manera continuar en su actividad para seguir llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Danelia C. is a hardworking woman who manages a grocery store in her town. This enables her to support her family.

It is important to note that Sra. Rosa Danelia approached CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy products from her suppliers. This will enable her to continue her business so that she can earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her grocery store

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Monsieur Moussa N. est agé de 38 ans et il est marié, père de 2 enfants. C'est un jeune maçon et en plus de son métier, il gére une cantine où il vend de l'aliment de bétail et etc. Pour diversifier ses revenus et accroitre ses activités, il pense se lancer dans l'aviculture. C'est ainsi qu'il sollicite un prêt de 200 000 Frs cfa. Avec l'argent de crédit, il compte  acheter tout le necesaire pour pouvoir démarrer l'activité
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa N. is 38 years old, married and the father of 2 children. He is a young mason and in addition to his trade, he manages a canteen where he sells cattle feed. In order to diversify his income and grow his business, he has decided to launch an aviculture (bird-raising) business. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan of 200,000 FCFA. With this loan, he intends to buy all of the necessities for this start-up business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For bird-raising business.

loans.name: Ka

texts.en:
Ka S. is a 28 years old and is a resident of Battambang Province, where she has established a small family home and earns a living as a local farmer. She is married to Mr. Kem Thon, age 35, who works with her in the farming business. This couple has three school-aged kids, who are dependent on their income.

Ka S. finds it hard commuting to work on the farm or anywhere else, because she doesn’t have her own vehicle for her and her family’s traveling needs. She hopes to have a motor (motorcycle) but she doesn’t have enough money to buy one. Therefore, she decided to seek a loan from Kiva through HKL in order to purchase a used motor and use the rest of the loan to support the farm work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle and to support the farm

loans.name: Santisima Trinidad Group

texts.es:
ALCOM “SANTISIMA TRINIDAD”

Mirla es una señora trabajadora que pertenece al grupo “SANTISIMA TRINIDAD” trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD con el fin D. obtener prestamos para sus negocios, en la compra D. insumos, como en la D. mercadería.

Todo inicio cuando ella conoció a su pareja, él tenia una imprenta, entonces ella empezó a ayudarlo y poco a poco fue conociendo todo respecto al negocio, luego decidieron abrir una librería-bazar, así obtendrían mas ingresos, y complementarían los trabajos hechos en su imprenta para la venta en una librería con un valor agregado, después abrieron otro negocio, una tienda pequeña pero surtida, y D. la cual obtiene muchas ganancias D. la venta D. cerveza, por lo mismo que utilizara el préstamo obtenido en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda, ahora Mirla esta emocionada en llenar su tienda y espera lograr grandes ventas.
texts.en:
"Holy Trinity" Group: Mirla is a hard-working woman who belongs to the Holy Trinity Group and works with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD by taking out loans for her businesses to buy ingredients or merchandise. It all began when she met her partner. He had a printing shop, so she started helping out, and little by little she learned all about the business. Then they decided to open a school supply store in order to earn more and to have a place to sell their products from the printing shop. Then they opened another business, a small store where they sell a variety of merchandise and earn a lot in profits from selling beer. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise for her store. She's very excited about stocking up her store, and she hopes to have good sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en: Asuncion R. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 62 years old. Asuncion is married and has seven grown children. Asuncion owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Asuncion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Asuncion is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita A. is from the village of Camarahan, Pagatpat Cagayan De Oro City. She is 50 years old. Lolita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Lolita operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Camarahan, Pagatpat, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Orien

loans.name: Moraima

texts.es:
Moraima tiene 46 años, es madre soltera y vive con uno D. sus tres hijos, quien estudia y le apoya mucho en su negocio.
DesD. hace 4 años se dedica a vender comida (desayuno y almuerzo) en su propia casa, también ofrece a sus clientes bebidas, queques y pan caliente. En todo este tiempo, Moraima ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. todos sus comensales, quienes degustan D. su buena sazón y la recomiendan, pues lo que más importante para ella es dar a sus clientes la mejor atención para que se sientan satisfechos, así como preparar distintos platos para variar cada día.

Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta con su banco comunal porque no tienen problemas y son muy responsables en sus trabajos y en sus pagos. El dinero que esta vez solicita lo invertirá en su negocio D. comida, comprando los comestibles y utensilios necesarios para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Moraima is 46 years old, she is a single mother and she lives with one of her three children. He is going to school and he also helps her a great deal in her business.

For the past 4 years she has been running a breakfast and lunch business from her own home. She also serves drinks, cakes and warm breads. Through all this time she has won over a steady clientele that really enjoys good home cooking, always recommending the restaurant. Her most important goal is to proviD. her clients with only the best customer service so that her clients will feel welcome. She always looks to cook different recipes each day to give some variety.

This is her fifth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy with her community bank because it runs smoothly and they are very responsible in their work and with their payments. The funds that she requests will be invested in her restaurant, to purchase food and new utensils in order to proviD. a better quality of service to her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and utensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 42 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora que logró educar a sus 2 hijos; Oswaldo de 22 y Nicol de 20 años, con mucho esfuerzo; a los cuales adora. Juntos viven en su casa propia.
Desde hace dos años que sus hijos ya tienen trabajo y son más independientes, es por ello que ella decidió dedicarse a una actividad que le de la libertad de escoger sus horarios de trabajo, y la venta de productos de belleza fue lo indicado. Todas las mañana realiza las labores del hogar y el resto del día se encarga de repartir y ofrecer los productos que tiene en stock y los que le van llegando a lo largo del mes. Carmen está muy contenta y ha hecho muy buenas amigas en sus visitas, ya que esta actividad le permite conocer a mucha gente, pero no sólo sale a ofrecer sus productos, sino que también las clientas vienen hasta su domicilio para pedir y probar algunas muestras que tiene y así elegir cuál producto comprar. 
Carmen quiere seguir trabajando en este negocio y lograr implementar algo más estable, como un bazar, pero sabe que aún necesita mucho trabajo y tiempo, y está dispuesta a avanzar poco a poco.

Con este, es el dieciochoavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, teniendo un historial muy bueno, ya que siempre fue muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos cosméticos, ya que tiene muchos pedidos por estas fiestas.
texts.en:
Carmen, 42, is a hardworking woman who, with much effort, has achieved providing an education for her children, Oswaldo, 22, and Nicol, 20. She adores them both, and lives with them in her own house. Two years ago, as her children were working and were more independent, Carmen decided to pursue a business that allowed her to set her own hours. She decided on beauty product sales. Every day, after doing her household chores, she devotes the rest of the day to delivering and selling the products she has in stock and those that will arrive later that month. Carmen is happy that she has made good friends in her visits, as this work allows her to meet many people. In addition to sales calls, clients also come to her house to order and to try sample products to decide which to buy. Carmen wants to continue in this business and develop something more stable, like a bazaar, but she knows she has much work ahead of her and is happy to progress little by little. This is Carmen’s 18th loan with MFP and she has a good history, always punctual in her payments. With this loan, she will buy a large quantity of cosmetic products, as she has many orders for this holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Dovchin

texts.en:
Dovchin O. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year-old daughter in Tosontsengel in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia.

Dovchin works with his brother in a carpentry business which is located in his brother's khashaa, or yard. Dovchin also works as a security guard for the Khosiin gol LLC and earns 100,000 MNT per month.

With his brother Dovchin produces mongolian gers which are built with 4,5 or 6 walls and also smaller gers for the herders in the province. Gers, or traditional nomadic tents, are the main style of home in Mongolia.

The brothers also make a variety of traditional wooden furniture for the gers which they sell to their customers. This furniture follows traditionally prescribed dimensions and sizes in order to fit into the gers.

Dovchin is a very hardworking and responsible young man who hopes to have his own carpentry shop, khashaa, and land in the future so that he can make his family's living conditions more comfortable.

Dovchin is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to purchase wood for his carpentry business so that he and his brother can grow their business and provide quality gers and furniture for their customers.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: Julia tiene la edad de 39 años, es una persona muy luchadora a pesar de n tener todas las condiciones necesarias en sus vivienda, busca la manera de ganarse el pan de cada día.  Doña Julia se dedica a la actividad económica como es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella siempre mantiene ese espíritu emprendedor ya que necesitaba cubrir los gastos de su casa y así decide dedicarse a este negocio. Y es así como solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así movilizarse hasta las diferentes comarcas y también para la compara de cerdos. Los sueños de Julia son de establecer un restaurante que sea propio.
texts.en:
Julia, 39, is a real fighter. Even though she doesn't have all the basic conditions in her home, every day she looks for ways to earn her living. Julia butchers pigs. She has been in this line of work for over 16 years. She always kept her enterprising spirit in play because she had to meet household expenses, so she decided to go into this business. She is asking for funding to be able to move to the various districts and to buy pigs. Julia's dream is to set up her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Our God Is Good Group

texts.en:
Helena W. sells fruit and vegetables, such as plantains, cassava and lettuce, at the Red Light Market which is the largest market in Liberia. She has eight children between the ages of 2 years and 23 years.  In addition to her children, Helena also supports her parents.

Helena says she sells high quality food at good prices, which keeps customers returning. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. She hopes that this loan will help her to buy land and start her own farm in the future. In addition, her dream is for all of her children to be educated. 

Helena is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Our God is Good". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Helena is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet has received a KES 30,000 loan from SMEP to restock her pharmacy, 'Shibuye Chemist', in the town center of Kakamega, Kenya. She has been in the business for 6 years and prior to starting her own pharmacy, she was working as a pharmacist in the local hospital. 

Linet is married with two young girls. She describes herself as hard-working and visionary - and eventually she wishes to expand her business to open a dispensary, and to own a plot of land of her own.

loans.use: to buy more medicine to restock her shop (Amoxyl, Ampiclox, Erylthomycis, and Septin)
